text:
The summary of the contract is as follows:

1. The DAO prioritizes peg stability above all else when considering parameter changes.
2. Aave has assigned an overall risk rating of B+ to DAI, the current sole backing stablecoin of alUSD. USDC and USDT strategies will be added as alUSD collateral later. The new risks from introducing alUSD are Alchemix/alUSD and Yearn Vault contract risks.
3. The Alchemix DAO multisig and timelock wallet is the administrator for the alUSD token, with the ability to grant and revoke other contracts the minter role. All minting is currently handled by the alchemist.sol contract, but new contracts will also be granted the minting permissions upon launch of version two.
4. The alUSD price oracle will be served via Chainlink.
5. After a forum RFC and community sentiment snapshot vote pass, Alchemix will push a PR with the necessary payloads to the Aave GitHub adding alUSD to the assets list.
6. Proposed parameters for alUSD: Strategy: rateStrategyStableTwo, Base LTV As Collateral: 0, Liquidation Threshold: 0, Liquidation Bonus: 0, Borrowing Enabled: true, Stable BorrowRate Enabled: true, Reserve Decimals: 18, Reserve Factor: 20%.
7. The contract was deployed on February 27, 2021, with 49,594 transactions and 1328 token holders.
8. Social channels data: Twitter - 40.2k followers, Discord - 7.5k members, Medium - 1.7k followers.
9. Voting options: YES - enable alUSD as a borrowable asset on Aave, NO - do not enable alUSD as a borrowable asset on Aave.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to list Angle Protocol's decentralized Euro stablecoin, agEUR, on Aave V3 when it deploys on Polygon. The stablecoin has gained popularity with a large supply and high daily volume, and is currently available on multiple chains including Ethereum, Polygon, Fantom, Harmony, BSC, Avalanche, Solana, NEAR, Aurora, and Fuse. It is over-collateralized and backed by various stablecoins, and has undergone multiple audits for security. The benefits of listing agEUR on Aave V3 include potential efficiency modes for Euro stablecoins, increased use cases for the stablecoin within DeFi, and a reliable place for Euro holders to deposit their stablecoins and earn yield. The text also provides risk parameters, market data, social channels, and voting options for the proposal.
label: neutral

text: This proposal aims to adjust risk parameters for two Aave V2 assets, aligning with the chosen Moderate risk level by the community. The changes are based on Gauntlet's regular parameter recommendations, which balance insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. The proposed adjustments include a decrease in DPI Liquidation Bonus, an increase in FEI Loan To Value, and an increase in FEI Liquidation Threshold. These changes aim to maintain risk while increasing capital efficiency. For more details, refer to Gauntlet's Parameter Recommendation Methodology and Model Methodology. The community is encouraged to use the Risk Dashboard for better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Aave V2.
label: neutral

text:
1. Overview: The proposal is to add jEUR (Jarvis Euro), a stablecoin pegged to the EUR, on Aave's V3 market on the Polygon network. jEUR uses the EURUSD price feed of Chainlink for settlement and has risk parameters proposed for different modes.

2. Risk Parameters:
   - V3 Efficiency mode EUR stablecoins (if it exists): 97% LTV, 98% liquidation threshold, 10% reserve factor
   - V3 Efficiency mode stablecoins: 90% LTV, 95% Liquidation threshold, 10% reserve factor
   - V3 Isolation mode: 50% LTV, 80% liquidation threshold, 20% reserve factor, 2M$ debt ceiling.

3. Security Specification and Risks:
   - jEUR inherits risks from USDC, UMAs DVM oracle, and Chainlink.
   - jEUR can only be minted following the protocol rules on Polygon, with no DAO at present, but transitioning to a ve-model in Q2.
   - Audits have been conducted by Halborn and Ubik.

4. Data:
   - Market Cap: 3.5M circulating ($4M)
   - 24h Volume: $2M on primary market, $400k on secondary markets
   - Volatility: Low
   - Maturity: Early
   - Social channels data: Discord: 3k members, Twitter: 16.1k followers
   - Contracts date of deployments, number of transactions, number of holders for tokens: Sep 2021 (Polygon), 116k transactions, 3,242 holders (more possible due to farming programs)

5. Links:
   - Website: [https://jarvis.network](https://jarvis.network)
   - Dune: [Jarvis Dashboard](https://dune.xyz/0xroll/JarvisNetwork)
   - Docs: [https://learn.jarvis.network](https://learn.jarvis.network)
   - Code: [https://gitlab.com/jarvis-network](https://gitlab.com/jarvis-network)

6. Voting options:
   - YES, add jEUR on Aave v3 on Polygon
   - NO, do not add jEUR on Aave v3 on Polygon
label: bullish

text:
1. **Convex Finance** is a DeFi protocol built on the Ethereum blockchain, designed to optimize and reward Curve liquidity providers (LPs) and CRV stakers. It does this by charging a lower performance fee, returning fees back to the CRV stakers and CVX token holders, and distributing rewards directly.

2. **History**: The concept of Convex was published to the public on April 15, 2021, with the protocol launching on May 17, 2021. On April 30, 2021, the Convex platform was whitelisted on the Curve platform.

3. **Current Use**: The CVX token governs over $559M worth of CRV locked in the protocol and $4M worth of CVX in the Convex treasury multisig.

4. **Emission Schedule**: The emission schedule can be found [here](https://docs.convexfinance.com/convexfinance/general-information/tokenomics).

5. **Token & Protocol Permissions (minting) and upgradability. Is there a multisig? What can it do? Who are the signers?**: The Convex multisig can be found [here](https://docs.convexfinance.com/convexfinance/faq/multisig-admin-rights).

6. **Market Data**:
   - Market capitalisation: $1.35B
   - Average daily volume on the 30 last days: $25,918,420.66
   - CVX is listed on many exchanges, the largest being Gate.io, Sushiswap, Uniswap, and Binance. Source: [https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/convex-finance#markets](http://www.coingecko.com)
   - veCRV controlled /vlCVX: 5.05 veCRV/vlCVX

7. **Social Channels Data**:
   - Discord: [5,920 members](http://discord.gg/WHwgFwRG6h)
   - Twitter: [37.7k followers](https://twitter.com/convexfinance)
   - Github: [22 followers](https://github.com/convex-eth)

8. **Contracts date of deployments, number of transactions, number of holders for tokens**:

text:
1. MAI is a decentralized finance (DeFi) asset used by Celsius for borrowing against their Assets Under Management (AUM), and has also been used by Polygon to award bounties. It offers low-cost leverage to strategies on Stake DAO, Yearn, Beefy, Aave, etc.
2. Emission schedule: Users can mint MAI by locking up their assets and borrowing against that value at 0% interest. Temporary debt ceilings serve as a supply mitigation.
3. Token & Protocol permissions (minting) and upgradability: All funds stored as collateral are fully controlled by users. There is a 3/5 multisig, comprised by the QiDao team. The multisig executes the results of Snapshot votes: liquidation ratios for new collaterals, partnerships, and debt ceilings.
4. Market data: Market Cap ~$250M, 24h Volume >$40M, Volatility: Low, Exchanges: Curve, Balancer, QuickSwap, SpookySwap, SpiritSwap, Saber, Beethoven, Solidly, TombSwap, Solarbeam, Trader Joe, Crodex, ZoomSwap, PaintSwap, Elk Finance, and Rose, Launched 5/4/21
5. Social channels data: Project: https://www.mai.finance/, Defillama: https://defillama.com/protocol/qidao, Whitepaper: https://docs.mai.finance/, Document portal: https://docs.mai.finance/, Source code for the system(s) that interact with the proposed asset: https://github.com/0xlaozi, Twitter: 17k followers: https://twitter.com/QiDaoProtocol, Telegram: 2,130 members: @QiDaoProtocol, Discord: 8,987 members: https://discord.com/qidaoprotocol
6. Contracts date of deployments, number of transactions, number of holders for tokens: MAI token - Date of deployment: May 4, 2021, Number of transactions: +3M, Number of crosschain token holders: 16k+
7. Security Considerations: MAI has undergone 2 thorough audits and constant internal reviews are performed to ensure its economic and technical safety. The protocol currently has around $350M TVL. First audit: https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/606120c25fb119221b762612/60bd3b9a1366549deb6a1cf7_Mai_Finance_Audit_Bramah.pdf, Second audit: https://cloakwire.com/qi-dao-security-audit/
8. Contract addresses and Chainlink Oracle: Contract addresses: https://docs.mai.finance/functions/smart-contract-addresses, Chainlink Oracle: 0xd8d483d813547CfB624b8Dc33a00F2fcbCd2D428 (Polygon), 0x5D1F504211c17365CA66353442a74D4435A8b778 (Avalanche), 0x827863222c9C603960dE6FF2c0dD58D457Dcc363 (Fantom)
9. Voting options: YES, add MAI on Aave v3, NO, do not add MAI on Aave v3
label: bullish

text: This proposal aims to adjust six risk parameters across three Aave V2 assets, aligning with a Moderate risk level chosen by the community. The changes seek to maintain overall risk tolerance while making specific asset trade-offs. Gauntlet's recommendations are based on an optimization function that balances insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. The updated parameters include adjustments to DAI Loan To Value, LINK Liquidation Bonus and Threshold, USDC Loan To Value, and USDC Liquidation Bonus and Threshold. Additionally, the proposal suggests freezing Legacy KNC due to reduced liquidity and exchange support for the token, aiming to speed up its migration and eliminate risk. The community is encouraged to use Gauntlet's Risk Dashboard for better understanding of these changes and market risk in Aave V2.
label: bullish

text: The text proposes adding support for stMATIC to the Polygon v3 market on Aave, citing the success of stETH on Ethereum v2. It highlights that while stMATIC is similar to stETH, it does not rebase but instead becomes more expensive over time relative to MATIC as it accrues yield. The addition of stMATIC could unlock leveraged MATIC yield positions and help with Polygon decentralization by enabling users to stake their MATIC tokens in a secure manner while using them on secondary markets. The proposal also suggests parameters for the new token, including a maximum LTV of 55%, liquidation threshold of 62%, and liquidation penalty of 15%. Overall, the sentiment is optimistic and forward-looking regarding the potential benefits of adding stMATIC to Aave's Polygon market.
label: bearish

text: The Aave governance forum proposes BGD Labs to offer development services for the Aave ecosystem, seeking community approval before proceeding with a preliminary vote. Further discussion and questions can be found on Discord and Twitter Spaces.
label: bearish

text: This proposal aims to update the risk parameters in the ARC market, specifically the Loan to Value (LTV) and Liquidation Threshold, to match those of the mainnet V2 market as determined by Gauntlet. The goal is to improve capital efficiency, align risk parameters, and maintain the ARC market in line with the mainnet V2 market on a quarterly basis. The voting decision is whether to update the risk parameters or not.
label: neutral

text:
This summary outlines the process of depositing tokens into a contract, as demonstrated by Tribe DAO's swap of TRIBE for INDEX. The key steps are:

1. A specific amount of aBAL (1,890 at the time of writing) is held in the Reserve Factor. This aBAL will be redeemed for BAL and combined with 200,000 BAL tokens obtained via the proposed swap.

2. The received BAL is transferred to the Reserve Factor. Then, both BAL and an equivalent amount of ETH are deployed into the BAL : ETH pool on Balancer V2.

3. The BPT token (Balancer Pool Token) is deposited into the veBAL contract and locked for 1 year.

4. The veBAL holding is utilized to direct incentives towards new aToken Boosted Pools.

References:
[1] https://forum.balancer.fi/t/introducing-vebal-tokenomics/2512
[2] https://pools.balancer.exchange/#/pool/0xc697051d1c6296c24ae3bcef39aca743861d9a81/
[3] https://app.balancer.fi/#/pool/0x7b50775383d3d6f0215a8f290f2c9e2eebbeceb20000000000000000000000fe
[4] https://etherscan.io/token/0xba100000625a3754423978a60c9317c58a424e3d#balances

[6] https://tribe.fei.money/t/fip-33-swap-between-balancer-dao-and-fei-dao/3555
[7] https://governance.aave.com/t/arc-consolidate-aave-v1-v2-amm-reserve-factors-purchase-cvx-and-deploy-to-earn-yield/6797
[8] <https://github.com/fei-protocol/fei-protocol-core/blob/develop/contracts/utils/OtcEscrow.sol>

The sentiment is informative and optimistic about the potential benefits of this framework for both the entities and the Aave V3 protocol.

text: This proposal aims to adjust risk parameters across four Aave V2 assets, aligning with a moderate risk level chosen by the community. The adjustments are part of Gauntlet's regular parameter recommendations, driven by simulations that balance insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. The proposed changes include adjustments to LTV, Liquidation Threshold, and Liquidation Bonus for SNX, STETH, UNI, and USDC assets. The community is encouraged to review the detailed report on Gauntlet's website and use their Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the suggested updates and general market risk in Aave V2.

text: The text discusses a proposal to renew the Aave Grants DAO program for two more quarters, with an investment of $6 million dollars ($3 million per quarter). This community-led grants program aims to foster growth within the Aave ecosystem by funding projects and events that benefit it. The goal is to drive development on top of Aave and attract talented builders to maintain its long-term growth, while also building a strong culture and community around the Aave ecosystem. Additional details can be found in their renewal post on governance.aave.com.
label: neutral

text:
The text discusses a proposal to add support for the FRAX stablecoin on Aave V3 markets, which are currently available on Polygon, Fantom, and Avalanche networks. FRAX is described as a fractional stablecoin with a hybrid of algorithmic and collateralized mechanisms, currently ranked #7 by market cap (2.7B) according to Coingecko. It has never lost its peg since its inception 15 months ago.

FRAX is already deployed on the mentioned networks and has significant liquidity on Ethereum mainnet. It has been successfully lent out on Aave v2 for many months without issues. FRAX is a good fit for borrow assets in the Aave ecosystem due to its decentralized nature, deep liquidity pools, and successful lending history.

The text also mentions that FRAX has undergone two thorough audits and currently holds over $3.5 billion in total value locked (TVL) across all chains. The protocol is secure and mature, with a deployment date of Dec 20th, 2020, and over 25,000+ cross-chain token holders.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to acquire 100,000 BAL tokens by deploying a Bonding Curve contract at a cost of $1,708,500. This purchase aims to increase Aave's BAL token holding from just outside the Top 50 holders to inside the Top 30 or even Top 15. The acquired BAL tokens will be retained in the Reserve Factor until more information about auraBAL emerges, and the community can decide whether to deploy them for veBAL or auraBAL. The text also mentions potential benefits of this move, such as being an early leader in the veBAL wars, maximizing upside from investments, and positioning Aave to take advantage of future Balancer Boosted Pools using aTokens.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to list sAVAX, a Liquid Staking token from BENQI protocol, as a collateral asset on AAVE. The motivation behind this is that sAVAX allows users to unlock liquidity while participating in securing the Avalanche network and generates revenue. It has deep liquidity in AMMs and is integrated with various DeFi platforms. The token is yield-bearing and using it as a collateral asset would increase interest earned on supply and reduce borrowing costs. BENQI started as the first lending protocol on Avalanche, and with over 3M AVAX in circulation, there's an opportunity for users to participate in network validation and receive rewards. The transition of sAVAX delegation process is currently ongoing towards a more decentralized MPC model. Market Cap: $168M, Twitter followers: 62.9k, Telegram followers: 13.35k.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a fast-track framework for updating supply and borrow caps in Aave protocol V3 markets, with specific steps, scope, and limitations outlined. This process requires an 80k AAVE quorum, is applicable only to assets listed for at least 2 weeks, and should be completed within 4 days. The current proposal also suggests increasing the USDC supply cap on Aave Avalanche V3 market by 100%. Community discussions related to this topic can be found in a linked location. Overall, the text presents an initiative aimed at improving efficiency and speed in Aave protocol updates.
label: bearish

text: This proposal aims to adjust risk parameters across five Aave V2 assets to align with a moderate risk level chosen by the community. text: The text proposes enabling sUSD as collateral on AAVE V3 on Optimism with a 10 million sUSD supply cap, suggesting a low liquidation threshold (75%) and maximum LTV (60%), and a liquidation penalty of 5%. The author highlights the growth of sUSD market cap and its high over-collateralization by SNX, contributing to its stability. They also mention the incentives for SNX stakers, potential small deviations from peg but with low volatility, and deep liquidity in sUSDv2CRV pool on both L1 and L2. The text also includes technical specifications of sUSD's price feed via Chainlink. Overall, the sentiment appears to be positive and optimistic about the potential growth and stability of sUSD within AAVE markets.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist Connext, a fast and trustless cross-chain communication protocol, on six different blockchain networks. The proposal includes credit lines for USDC, USDT, and ETH on each chain. The reasoning behind this is that Connext allows for the building of bridges and other cross-chain applications without introducing new trust assumptions, and its architecture allows for immediate liquidity access in a trust-minimized way. The text also provides technical specifications about Connext's interoperability capabilities, current liquidity providers, and fee model for participants. The proposal is open to a vote, with the option to approve or reject credit lines for Connext.
label: bearish

text:
This text provides an overview of the security considerations, risks, and proposed risk parameters for a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform called StakeWise. The platform is designed to allow users to stake their ETH and earn rETH2 in return.

   *Counterparty risks* are mitigated by using an Oracle network to accurately report daily staking rewards. Currently, there are 5 oracles live on the network, with plans to increase this number to 10 over the coming months. The protocol is ultimately governed by the StakeWise DAO, which has additional security features in place to prevent malicious transactions.

   *Staking risks* such as slashing events and downtime penalties are mitigated through vetting of prospective node operators, providing them with an institutional-grade deployment package with embedded security features, and working with a third-party to provide protocol-level insurance (expected by early May). The StakeWise DAO also controls the exit signatures for its operators, making it impossible for operators to hold pool funds hostage.

   *Smart contract risks* are mitigated through audits by 3 separate auditors and a $200,000 bug bounty program with ImmuneFI. The protocol's code is open-source and available on GitHub.

   The proposed risk parameters for sETH2 include an LTV of 70%, a liquidation threshold of 75%, a liquidation bonus of 7.5%, and a reserve factor of 10%. These parameters are presented in comparison to those of ETH and are similar to the current risk parameters of stETH. The interest rate model for sETH2 includes a UOptimal of 50%, a base of 0%, slope 1 of 8%, and slope 2 of 200%.

   In summary, StakeWise is a DeFi platform that allows users to stake their ETH and earn rETH2. The platform uses an Oracle network for counterparty risk mitigation, has additional security features in place to prevent malicious transactions, and has proposed risk parameters that are similar to those of ETH and stETH. The interest rate model for sETH2 includes a UOptimal of 50%, a base of 0%, slope 1 of 8%, and slope 2 of 200%.
label: neutral

Notably, the Liquidation Thresholds for LINK and WETH are proposed to be reduced from 78% and 85% to 75% and 83%, respectively. The proposal also mentions the availability of Gauntlet's Risk Dashboards for community members to better understand the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Aave V2 and Aave Arc (Fireblocks). The target date for this proposal is May 31, 2022.

This integration aims to enable users worldwide to buy cryptocurrencies and earn yield-earning tokens in one step, using various payment methods. By doing so, it simplifies the process for users to interact with Aave, reducing the number of steps required before earning interest or borrowing funds. Transak supports over 100 countries and multiple blockchain networks, making it easier for a global user base to access DeFi through its one-click solution.

text:
Title: Proposal to Approve Credit Lines for deBridge

   Technical Implementation: The integration with AAVE Pools will be facilitated through a dedicated deAaveAdapter smart contract developed by the deBridge team and audited by Halborn. This smart contract uses the deBridge generic messaging protocol and interacts with AAVE Pools across different blockchains. It enables cross-chain swaps, ensuring that liquidity lent from Portals on one chain is always backed by the same amount of asset locked in deAaveAdapter on another chain.

   Proposed Credit Lines: The credit lines to be allocated to deBridge are requested for each blockchain where AAVE v3 is deployed. deBridge is currently deployed on 6 blockchains, and the integration with Portals will help match the supported blockchains. The maximal amount of the cross-chain swap that can be performed by users and protocols in one transaction is capped by the amount of approved credit line, with deBridge paying a 2bps fee on all liquidity taken from the Portals.

   Incentives: An incentive program may be approved by the deBridge DAO after the deBridge token goes live.

   Audits & Security: deBridge has passed four independent security audits by reputable companies such as Halborn, Zokyo, Ackee Blockchain, and Neodyme. It also has a long-term partnership with Halborn for ongoing smart contract audits. There have been no outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks on any networks.

   Voting:
      FOR: DO Approve Credit Lines for deBridge
      AGAINST: DO NOT Approve Credit Lines for deBridge
label: neutral

text:
Gnosis is a project founded in 2015 by Martin Koppelmann and Stefan George under ConsenSys, an Ethereum venture production studio. The main products of Gnosis are the Gnosis Auction, Zodiac 1, Conditional Tokens Framework, Gnosis Protocol V2, and Gnosis Safe.

Gnosis Auction is a platform for fair, transparent, and decentralized token price discovery. Gnosis Safe is a multi-signature wallet used to manage digital assets on Ethereum with over $107 billion USD worth of digital assets securely stored. GNO, the native token of Gnosis, serves as a governance token for prediction markets, a requirement for validating on the Gnosis Chain, and can be used in DeFi applications like Balancer, Uniswap, Sushiswap, Unit Protocol, etc.

The total supply of GNO is 10M, with most of it locked in a vesting contract for 8 years. There is no emission schedule. No additional GNO can be minted. The current market cap is $655,513,507, and the token is listed on various exchanges such as Uniswap, Binance, Bitvavo, XT.COM, Kraken, BTCEX, Bitfinex, Bancor Network, LATOKEN, CoinEx, Bittrex, AscendEX (BitMax), Balancer (v2), Nominex, Uniswap (v2), NiceHash, Honeyswap, WazirX, ZB, HitBTC, Sushiswap, Balancer (Arbitrum).

The Gnosis community can be found on Twitter (120.1K followers), Discord (9.7K members), Telegram (17.9K members), and Telegram announcement channel (2.6K subscribers). The project also has a newsletter with around 10K subscribers.

GnosisDAO, the prediction market-driven collective, was launched on November 23, 2020, to govern the Gnosis ecosystem through futarchy: governance by prediction markets. The DAO is live and actively making decisions for the future of the project.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to integrate Aave with Pocket Network, a decentralized RPC protocol, to improve the stability and decentralization of Aave's infrastructure. By using Pocket, Aave would own its service and benefit from lower costs as usage increases. The proposal involves staking 118,815 POKT tokens on behalf of AAVE DAO at a cost of approximately $16,396.47 USD, with the goal of enhancing stability, promoting decentralization, and raising awareness for both Aave and Pocket Network. The implementation will be in phases, starting with an endpoint for 25M relays that won't get rate limited.

text:
1INCH (1inch Network) is an ERC-20 token launched on December 23, 2020, with a significant trading volume of over $250B and approximately 3M users. The token is governed by around 88,475 wallets, while the staked INCH token, st1INCH, used for governance, is held by around 5,391 wallets.

The 1inch Foundation, which holds a significant portion of the 1INCH tokens, has transferred out most of them, with an approximate value of $15M at the time of writing. The foundation's wallet is a 2 of 3 multisig, and all three signers have other wallets worth similar values. On April 6, 2022, the 1inch Foundation burned the mint function of 1INCH.

There are extensive audits available on Github for review. Relevant addresses can be found in the links provided.

In terms of counterparty risk, 1inch is a permissionless protocol where token holders do not have direct control over governance. However, they can stake their tokens to participate in general proposals, Instant Governance, or benefit from the gas refund program. st1INCH token holders receive up to 100% of gas expenses refunded based on their stake size.

Users who stake 1INCH receive non-transferrable st1INCH tokens for governance purposes. If a malicious actor were to borrow 1INCH, stake it for st1INCH, and then attempt to attack the DAO's treasury, the Treasury Multisig 7 of 12 can veto the proposal during the 72-hour timelock period post successful Snapshot vote. This measure provides a level of protection for the DAOs Treasury funds, which are held in USDC.

Risk parameters can be found on the provided forum thread.
label: bullish

text:
The 1inch DAO generates revenue primarily in USDC through the Swap Surplus collector. The majority of this surplus is converted to USDC and deposited into the DAO's treasury. The 1INCH token, launched on December 23, 2020, has a high trading volume and a large number of users.

The 1INCH token is an ERC-20 token with governance influence held by around 5,391 wallets (staked INCH token, st1INCH). The 1inch Foundation, which holds the majority of the 1INCH tokens, has transferred out most of its tokens and currently holds approximately $15M.

There have been several audits available on Github for the 1inch smart contract. On April 6th, 2022, the 1inch Foundation burned the mint function of 1INCH.

For listing 1INCH as collateral on Aave v2, Gauntlet's risk parameters include:
- Collateral: Yes
- Borrowing: Yes
- LTV: 40%
- Liquidation Threshold: 50%
- Liquidation Penalty: 8.5%
- Reserve Factor: 20%
- UOptimal: 45%
- R_0: 0%
- R_s1: 7%
- R_s2: 300

For further context on the associated risks for listing 1INCH, please refer to the discussion on the governance forum.
label: bullish

The community is asked to vote on the maximum percentage by which each collateral asset's liquidation threshold can be reduced, with options ranging from 0% (no risk management) to 3%. The limit would not apply under severe conditions such as contract vulnerabilities and would affect all supported assets like WETH, WBTC, DAI, etc.

The text discusses a proposal to increase the supply cap of sUSD on AAVE V3 from 10M to 20M sUSD. The reasons given for this increase include:

1. Increased DEX liquidity of sUSD across various platforms, ensuring healthy liquidations if necessary.
2. The consistent peg of sUSD at $1, attributed to increased sUSD DEX liquidity and constant arbitrage by market makers.
3. The rapid depletion of the current sUSD supply cap due to the ongoing OP liquidity mining program on AAVE V3, necessitating an increase to ensure more users can supply/borrow on AAVE.

The text concludes with a positive tone, looking forward to discussions about the proposed increase.

The current guardian's responsibilities will be gradually reduced as a cross-chain governance solution is implemented on Arbitrum & Optimism, with BGD Labs working on a more generalized solution for all networks. text:
Title: Redeeming aFEI for FEI and DAI to reduce exposure to FEI stablecoin

   The Aave DAO currently holds approximately 619,185.82 units of aFEI in the Ethereum Reserve Factor. Due to uncertainty around Tribe DAO and FEI's future, this proposal encourages the community to redeem aFEI for FEI as an immediate priority. The redeemed FEI can then be swapped for DAI via the Tribe DAO Peg Stability Module to further reduce risk. This is due to the concentrated market structure of the FEI lending market and potential liquidity issues if large liquidity providers start redeeming aFEI. The proposal suggests this action to prevent Aave DAO from becoming trapped as a last resort lender in the FEI market.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for the Aave Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) to retroactively fund the development of Aave V3, which offers enhanced features and improvements in efficiency, risk management, user experience, and interoperability. The proposed funding amount is $16.28 million, covering development costs over a period of more than a year. If approved, an AIP (Aave Improvement Proposal) will be published for further action. The full proposal can be found on the Aave governance page. Overall sentiment: Positive and informative.
label: neutral

This action aims to mitigate the risk of high utilization and potential insolvency caused by users borrowing ETH before the merge, which could be used to benefit from a forked PoW ETH (ETHW). The proposal also includes an option to pay 60 AAVE tokens as part of the decision. The community can vote 'Yes' with or without deciding on the payment immediately, or choose 'No' or 'Abstain'. The target date for an AIP is September 2nd.
label: neutral

text:
The text discusses the potential benefits of adding agEUR (Aave Euro Stablecoin) to DeFi platforms Optimism and Arbitrum. This move would enable users to take advantage of various opportunities such as longing  and shorting $ through agEUR, accessing yield on their  assets without USD/EUR change risk, and facilitating Forex trading in DeFi.

The proposed risk parameters for agEUR on these platforms include a 97% LTV, 98% liquidation threshold, and 10% reserve factor for V3 Emode EUR stablecoins (if it exists), a 90% LTV, 95% Liquidation threshold, and 10% reserve factor for V3 Emode stablecoins, and 0% LTV when agEUR is not used as collateral in isolation mode.

The text also provides data on the current market cap, volume, social channels, and contract details of agEUR on Optimism and Arbitrum.

Finally, it presents two voting options: YES - add agEUR to Opti+Arbi, or NO - do nothing. The decision would impact the accessibility and utility of DeFi opportunities for European users and potentially shape the future of Forex trading in decentralized finance.
label: neutral

text:
1. KyberSwap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) that optimizes trade routes and prices for users by sourcing liquidity from over 60 different DEXs, including Uniswap, Sushi, Curve, QuickSwap, Pancakeswap, Traderjoe, Pangolin, SpookySwap, SpiritSwap, VVS Finance, and many others. This results in more efficient trading, saving time and money for thousands of users.

2. Elastic Pools allow liquidity providers (LPs) to deposit tokens into pools with customizable price ranges and features such as anti-sniping and concentrated liquidity. This mimics higher levels of liquidity, achieving better capital efficiency, volume, and returns. For example, stable token pairs can be up to 1000x better compared to other platforms.

3. KyberSwap users can view which tokens are 'Trending' and 'Trending Soon' based on current trending data from CoinGecko and Coinmarket, as well as Kybers special trend detection algorithm.

4. KNC is Kybers utility and governance token. KNC holders can stake KNC to vote on proposals within KyberDAO, including improvements to KyberSwap, determining incentives for liquidity providers, and capturing value created by new innovations. In return, KNC voters receive rewards from fees collected through trading on KyberSwap.com and other benefits from ecosystem collaborations.

5. There is currently no automatic emission of KNC. All tokens for founders and advisors have been distributed since September 2019. Approximately 23M KNC is managed by KyberDAO as part of an ecosystem growth fund to facilitate trade and liquidity mining, and other growth activities.

6. New KNC can be minted or burned by KyberDAO, subject to a DAO vote by KNC holders.

7. KNC is an upgradeable token with in-built governance safeguards to ensure that any decision or contract alteration will always be preceded by a suitable time period of preparation and reflection, as well as a minimum voter participation threshold. The multisig comprises a mix of Kyber team members and founders of external DeFi projects with no direct affiliation to Kyber.
label: neutral

text:
1. Overview: Bilira is a stablecoin backed 1:1 by the Turkish Lira (TRY) and operates across multiple blockchain platforms, including Ethereum, Avalanche C-Chain, Solana, BNB Chain, and Polygon. The media community has over 50,000+ users across all social media platforms.

2. Risk Parameters:
   - Isolation mode:
     - LTV: 0%
     - Liquidation Threshold: 70%
     - Liquidation Bonus: 10%
     - Reserve Factor: 10%
   - Debt Ceiling: $10 Mil USD (Equivalent to 185 Mil TRY Debt Ceiling)

3. Contracts and Transactions:
   - Ethereum: Deployed on July 19, 2019, with 19,594 transfers, 829 holders
   - Avalanche C-Chain: Deployed on May 27, 2021, with 2,308 transactions, 363 holders
   - Solana: Deployed on June 20, 2022, with 10,003 transactions, 924 holders
   - BNB Chain: Deployed on May 26, 2021, with 1,154 transactions, 208 holders
   - Polygon: Deployed on November 20, 2021, with 4,550 transactions, 102 holders

4. Security Considerations:
   - Risks inherent to TRY currency reserves: Possible smart-contract risks and fiat currency risk due to the backing of stablecoins by fiat TRY.
   - Regulation: No regulation on stablecoins in Turkey, but BiLira has been audited by the Central Bank of Turkey. Users must go through KYC and AML processes.
   - Security: No hacks or vulnerabilities reported on the project. The contract is verified on the mentioned explorers.
   - Classification: TRYB tokens are not considered a security as they are backed 1:1 with TRY fiat reserves, and there is no risk for users when withdrawing TRYB to Turkish Lira (TRY).

5. Voting Options:
   YES - add TRYB on Aave V3
   NO - do not add TRYB on Aave V3

The proposal aims to deploy Aave V3 on zkSync 2.0 testnet in partnership with Matter Labs. This move is intended to support Aave's multichain mission, expand cross-chain experiences, and onboard new users by decreasing costs compared to Ethereum without compromising security.

zkSync 2.0 is a ZK rollup that offers lower gas fees, more transactions per second, and EVM compatibility for existing dApps. It shares Ethereum's ethos of decentralization, open-source, and personal sovereignty. The deployment will accelerate developer and retail adoption, as zkSync is recognized as a long-term scaling solution by top researchers like Vitalik Buterin.

The proposal involves submitting a snapshot for testnet deployment followed by another snapshot for mainnet when the criteria for DEX liquidity and other items are met. The zkSync team encourages developers to prepare their contracts with Solidity/Vyper, as they support these languages.

text:
This summary outlines a proposal for the Llama community to utilize their USDC and aUSDC holdings to acquire CRV in order to recapitalize the protocol. The table shows that there is 385.61% more USDC relative to the excessive debt value, with additional large DAI and USDT holdings as well.

The proposal suggests deploying a swap contract exchanging USDC and aUSDC for CRV at a rate determined by the Chainlink CRV/USD Oracle plus 10 bps. A cap of $2M will be placed on the swap contract, creating an upper price bound on the CRV price of 75.29 cents, which is a 13% above the current spot price.

The actor interacting with the swap contract can select USDC and aUSDC by choosing true or false respectively. To repay the excess debt, the repay function will be used, requiring CRV as an input and the address where the bad debt has accumulated.

In the comments section, the community is invited to discuss the above proposal. A Snapshot vote will be presented for the two most popular options: Option 1) Use USDC to acquire CRV, Option 2) Use aUSDC + USDC to acquire CRV, and Option 3) Do Not Recapitalise Protocol. If the community prefers to sell AAVE, a swap contract at the AAVE/CRV composite oracle rate would be used without offering a premium for the swap.

The copyright and related rights are waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text:
The text presents a proposal to adjust the BAL interest rate parameters in Aave's Ethereum v2, Ethereum v3 (when deployed), Polygon v3, and Polygon v2 Liquidity Pools. The current high demand for borrowing BAL, particularly on Polygon v3, is causing poor capital efficiency due to the Reserve's utilization being near the optimal point of 45%.

The proposal aims to improve capital efficiency by lowering interest rates in markets where borrowing is disabled and encouraging capital flow towards markets with attractive yields. This is expected to generate more revenue for the DAO and increase capital efficiency within the BAL Reserves.

Users are currently borrowing BAL to earn yield, creating an arbitrage opportunity due to incentives offered by Aura Finance. The proposal suggests increasing the interest rate slope 1 parameter from 7% to 14%, introducing a base rate of 3%, and changing slope 2 from 300 to 150.

The improved capital efficiency is expected to lead to an increase in BAL liquidity on-chain, making it more expensive to manipulate oracle feeds. The Borrow Cap on the Polygon v3 deployment may also be increased, potentially doubling the revenue generated at the Optimal point for the DAO.
label: neutral

text:
This text outlines a proposal to make changes in the CRV Reserve on Polygon v2, v3, Ethereum v2, and the soon-to-be-deployed Ethereum v3 liquidity pool. The main adjustments include:

1. Increasing the SupplyCap and BorrowCap for Polygon v3.
2. Changing the slope parameters (Slope1, Slope2) to 14% and 150%, respectively, after the Optimal point, resulting in a less volatile interest rate for users with increasing utilization. The base rate is set at 3%.
3. Increasing the Reserve Factor on Polygon v3 from 10% to 20%, bringing it in line with all other Aave deployments.
4. Updating the Optimal point (Uoptimal) for all versions to 80%.

The table below shows the current and proposed changes for each version:

| Version | Parameter | Current (%) | Proposed (%) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Polygon v3 | SupplyCap | 937.70K | 1,125.24K |
| Polygon v3 | BorrowCap | 640.44K | 1,012.72K |
| Polygon v3 | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Polygon v3 | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Polygon v3 | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Polygon v3 | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Polygon v3 | Reserve Factor | 10 | 20 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Reserve Factor | 20 | 20 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Uoptimal | NA | 80 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Base | NA | 3 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Slope1 | NA | 14 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Slope2 | NA | 150 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Reserve Factor | NA | 20 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Reserve Factor | 20 | 20 |

References:
[1] <https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0x172370d5cd63279efa6d502dab29171933a610af&marketName=proto_polygon_v3>
[2] <https://governance.aave.com/t/aave-v3-borrow-caps-methodology/10925>
[3] <https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/>

Copyright: Copyright and related rights waived via CC0, [3].

text:
Here's a summary of the risk analysis report for [rETH] Collateral Onboarding on Rocket Pool:

- Isolation Mode: No, as enabling isolation mode would exclude potential use cases for rETH collateral in WETH or wstETH and delay understanding rETH dynamics on Aave markets.
- Borrowable: Yes, to allow rETH usage while mitigating risks via stringent borrow caps.
- LT (Liquidation Threshold): 74%
- LTV (Liquidation Ratio): 67%
- LB (Liquidation Bonus): 7.5%
- RF (Reserve Factor): 15%
- LPF (Liquidation Penalty Factor): 0.1
- Debt Ceiling: Not Applicable (NA)
- Supply Cap: 10K
- Borrow Cap: 1200

The report also recommends starting with conservative Interest Rate Curve and Reserve Factor parameters for rETH, similar to stETH, which can be optimized later. The proposed parameters are as follows:

- Base: 0
- Slope 1: 0.07
- Uoptimal: 0.45
- Slope 2: 3.0
- Reserve Factor: 0.15

These parameters create an interest rate curve that increases linearly from 0% at 0% utilization to 7% at 45% utilization, and then linearly to 307% at 100% utilization. This design aims to reduce the chances of utilization reaching 100%, which would prevent stakers from withdrawing rETH and prevent liquidators from seizing rETH collateral during liquidations.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to enable Lido to distribute LDO rewards across Aave v3 Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Optimism Liquidity Pools. The Emission_Admin role for LDO on each network will be assigned to a wallet controlled by the Lido DAO. The goal is to allow the Lido DAO to control the distribution of LDO rewards across these liquidity pools. The proposal involves assigning the Emission_Admin role for LDO to specific addresses on each network, as detailed in the table provided. The Lido Liquidity Mining Committee (LMC) will determine the emission rate and duration of LDO rewards.
label: neutral

text:
This text discusses a proposal to adjust the parameters of the Aave protocol on Polygon v3. The main changes include increasing the Base rate from 0% to 3%, raising the Slope1 parameter from 7% to 14%, and increasing the Reserve Factor from 10% to 20%. These changes are aimed at optimizing utilization and revenue generation for Aave.

The table below shows the current and proposed parameters for various Aave deployments:
- Polygon v3: Increase SupplyCap, BorrowCap, Slope1, and Reserve Factor; keep Uoptimal, Base, and Slope2 unchanged.
- Polygon v2 (frozen): Keep Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor unchanged; freeze other parameters.
- Ethereum v3 (not yet deployed): Propose new values for Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor.
- Ethereum v2 (frozen): Keep Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor unchanged; freeze other parameters.

The proposal also mentions that the current borrow rate on Polygon v3 still exceeds the borrow rate at the optimal utilization point, but over time, adjustments can be made to optimize for utilization and revenue generation. The graphic provided shows the changes in interest rates with the proposed changes.

References are included for further reading on the current state of Aave on Polygon v3, the methodology behind borrow caps, and the Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication. Copyright is waived via CC0.

text:
1. sfrxETH is a ERC-4626 vault that allows users to earn staking yield on their frxETH by depositing it into the sfrxETH pool. It can be exchanged for frxETH at any time, and as validators accrue staking yield, more frxETH is minted and added to the vault, allowing users to redeem their sfrxETH for a greater amount of frxETH than they deposited.

2. The signers of the Frax protocol contracts are the administrators who have permissions to mint/burn sfrxETH. This was pointed out in the Code4Arena audit 1.

3. The market capitalization of sfrxETH is $60,192,819 and its 24H volume is ~$1.4M (frxETH/ETH on Curve). It is listed on decentralized exchange liquidity pools such as Curve, Balancer, and Uniswap V3.

4. The Frax Finance smart contracts have been audited by Code4Arena and there is a bug bounty program in place. The risk parameters for sfrxETH suggest a non-borrowable asset with a 67% LTV.

5. Social channels data shows that the Frax community has 850 members on Discord, 64.1k followers on Twitter, 14200 members on Telegram, and 67 followers on Github.

6. The date of deployment for sfrxETH was 10-06-2022, there have been 2958 transactions, and there are currently 858 holders (liquidity pools are recorded as 1 address).

7. sfrxETH has the following technical specifications: Isolation Mode: NO, Borrowable: NO, Collateral Enabled: YES, emode: NO, LTV: 67%, LT: 74%, LB: 7.5%, RF: N/A, LPF: 0.10, Debt Ceiling: N/A, Supply Cap: 5k, Borrow Cap: N/A.

text: The Snapshot vote in question presents options for adjusting borrow and supply caps for Aave v3 on various chains. The decision hinges on whether the community prioritizes overall liquidity (aggressive) or native-chain liquidity (conservative). Gauntlet's research indicates that native-chain liquidity has historically played a significant role in successful liquidations and insolvency mitigation. The community must decide if they prefer to maintain safety under current liquidity conditions (choosing Conservative) or foster growth on non-Ethereum chains, hoping for improved liquidity conditions over time due to Aave's presence there. The community's strategy and preferences will influence parameter recommendations.

text:
The summary is about the analysis of various assets on Arbitrum, a layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum. Here are the key points:

   - Aave protocol on Arbitrum is expected to have low bad debt risk due to its design and simulation results. This allows for an increase in LT (Liquidation Threshold) and LTV (Loan-to-Value) for most assets without significantly increasing the bad debt risk.

   - For WETH and WBTC, no "whale" positions or activities were identified that could affect recommendations.

   - USDC has two large positions that supply approximately 45% of USDC on Arbitrum. One of these wallets does not borrow against its position. The on-chain liquidity for USDC on Arbitrum is expected to support its liquidation potential even if there's a change in borrow usage.

   - DAI has one large position that supplies approximately 40% of DAI on Arbitrum and doesn't currently borrow against the position. The on-chain liquidity on Arbitrum should be able to support its liquidation potential even if there's a change in borrow usage.

   - Based on the analysis, recommendations have been made for adjusting various parameters for different assets:
     - WETH: Increase Liquidation Threshold from 82.5% to 85%, and Loan-to-Value from 80% to 82.5%.
     - WBTC: Increase Liquidation Threshold from 75% to 78%, increase Loan-to-Value from 70% to 73%, and decrease Liquidation Penalty from 10% to 7%.
     - DAI: Increase Liquidation Threshold from 80% to 82%, and Loan-to-Value from 75% to 77%.
     - USDC: Increase Liquidation Threshold from 85% to 86%, and Loan-to-Value from 80% to 81%.
label: neutral

text:
The summary is about the integration of Aave's V3 on Ethereum with multi-chain deployments like Hashflow and Wormhole, focusing on the security aspects of these networks.

Wormhole has undergone multiple security audits by companies such as Neodyme, Kudelski, OtterSec, Trail of Bits, and others. It uses a Proof of Authority (PoA) consensus mechanism with 19 guardians, ensuring that more than two-thirds are required to reach consensus and verify a message. These guardians are large and reputable staking providers in the crypto industry.

However, Wormhole has faced an exploit/hack incident in February this year. Since then, it has added multiple security layers to prevent similar incidents, such as Governor, which allows each Guardian to set limits on the notional value of any transfer originating on a supported chain within a specified time period. Other features include the Cosmos-based Wormhole Chain for independent verification of source chain funds and an emergency shutdown module.

Hashflow relies on Market Makers for providing quotes and Wormhole for ensuring cross-chain message accuracy. The security of Hashflow has been audited by Quantstamp, Certik, and OpenZeppelin.

Regarding outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks, there is a mention that Wormhole has faced an incident but has since added multiple layers of security to prevent such occurrences in the future.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a situation where Platypus Finance, a protocol on Avalanche, was exploited and 9 million in stablecoins were stolen. Some of the stolen funds ended up in Aave V3's Pool contract deployed on Avalanche. This ARC (Aave Improvement Proposal) aims to gather community sentiment for a potential recovery of these funds from the Pool contract. The proposed solution involves deploying a recovery contract, which, if approved by the Aave community through voting, will transfer the exploited funds back to Platypus Finance's multi-sig wallet. The text also provides links to analysis and verification documents about the exploit for transparency.

text: The text discusses a situation where Platypus Finance, a protocol on Avalanche, was exploited and 9 million in stablecoins were stolen. Some of the stolen funds ended up in Aave V3's Pool contract deployed on Avalanche. This ARC (Aave Improvement Proposal) aims to gather community sentiment for a potential recovery of these funds from the Pool contract. The proposed solution involves deploying a recovery contract, which, if approved by the Aave community through voting, will transfer the exploited funds back to Platypus Finance's multi-sig wallet. The text also provides links to analysis and verification documents about the exploit for transparency.
label: bullish

text:
The text presents a proposal for deploying Aave V3 on the Metis Andromeda Mainnet. Metis is an Ethereum Layer 2 network aiming to build a hub for the Web3 economy in three stages: scalability, on-chain credentials, and a DAC framework. The network utilizes an upgraded Optimistic Rollup architecture for high throughput while maintaining Ethereum's underlying security.

Metis offers various features such as strong DeFi ecosystem, borrowing/lending capabilities, and is working to improve RPC infrastructure and chain data indexing solutions. Aave V3 deployment on Metis would provide additional revenue through protocol fees and the Metis Builder Mining Program. The proposal includes a 100,000 Metis token liquidity incentivization campaign for six months following deployment.

The text also mentions that risk analysis and recommendations for the deployment have been provided by Gauntlet and Chaos Labs. Assuming a passed deployment vote, the Aave deployment process will begin, followed by the launch of Aave V3 on Metis and the liquidity mining incentive program. The collaboration aims to benefit both the Aave DAO and community as well as the entire Metis ecosystem.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to streamline the governance process within the Aave protocol by introducing clearer distinctions between different types of proposals. The aim is to create a more agile and robust process, with TEMP CHECKs becoming the first step for certain proposals that do not require input from Aave DAO Service Providers. This includes discussions on listing new assets, deploying Aave on new networks, assessing GHO Facilitator candidates, Portals Operators candidates, New Service Provider Candidates, and general community feedback. Mature and significant technical proposals will be regarded as ARFCs, requiring the input of Aave DAO Risk Service Providers. The format for these proposals must align with that of an AIP, which will then proceed to Snapshot and On-Chain Aave Governance.
label: neutral

This action aims to revive the AAVE platform on Harmony, allowing lenders to withdraw their ONE tokens and other assets. The plan includes a temporary pause for one month for withdrawal only before full functionality is restored.

Gauntlet, a risk management provider, offers two strategies to mitigate risks associated with this feature, such as tail risks to protocols, user experience optimization, and maintaining robust on-chain liquidity. The text also mentions a Snapshot vote for users to choose between conservative, aggressive, abstain, or nay options regarding the isolated debt ceiling across Aave V3 deployments on various networks like Avalanche, Polygon, and Arbitrum. If the vote passes, borrowing against EURS on Polygon will cease but won't affect current user positions. After the Snapshot vote, an AIP (Aave Improvement Proposal) will be published for further action. The sentiment of this text is informative and decision-making focused.

text:
This document outlines a proposal for adjusting parameters in Aave v2 on the Polygon network, with the aim of encouraging migration to Aave v3 while complementing the v3 liquidity mining program. The proposed changes include:

1. Uoptimal Parameter: The Uoptimal parameter is adjusted based on the current utilization and Uoptimal values. For example, if utilization is 20% and the Uoptimal is 60%, then the proposed Uoptimal is 40%.

2. Slope 2 Parameter: To maintain the same gradient of the borrow rate between utilisations Uoptimal and 100%, the Slope2 parameter is revised higher when the Uoptimal parameter is reduced.

3. Reserve Factor (RF): As the borrow rate increases, so does the deposit rate to counteract it. To redirect interest paid by borrowers to Aave instead of depositors, the RF is increased. The RF for USDT is adjusted to reduce its deposit rate and encourage migration without substantially increasing borrowing costs.

The proposal suggests that when utilization drops significantly, the Uoptimal value should be reduced in line with other stable coins.

The document also includes tables detailing the current asset configuration on Polygon v2 and the proposed parameter changes. It is important to note that the numbers may need to be updated before any AIP submission to avoid unfavorable parameter configurations.

The next steps include community discussion, where anyone can work with the author to implement the changes. The goal is to maximize the benefits of the rewards distribution programs on v3, especially those coordinated by Llama. It would be beneficial if a risk service provider could confirm that these changes will not adversely affect users.

The proposal is published by TokenLogic, which is not part of Llama's core role within the Aave ecosystem. There are no payments to TokenLogic related to this forum post. The copyright and related rights are waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text:
This recap compares two strategies for Aave to participate in Curve Governance: one involving delegating veSDT through Stake DAO, and the other holding aCRV on v3 Liquidity Pools (NAE).

The first strategy, using veSDT delegated through Stake DAO, offers a 1.14x boost in voting power for 1 year. However, once the delegation period ends, the voting power drops back to 0.61x. The DAO would control 5,403 CRV of emission per week, representing $266.9K per year with 270k veSDT boost delegated. This strategy adds extra smart contract risks and counterparty risk through reliance on ACI and others for veSDT support. It also has a high-risk asset profile due to limited liquidity ($3.8M) of sdCRV, which could potentially depeg.

The second strategy, holding all CRV positions in the form of aCRV, represents the "do nothing" approach and minimizes smart contract exposure to the Aave protocol. This strategy would allow Aave to focus on accumulating active voting power and managing the position. Llama suggests Option 1) for focusing on accumulating active voting power and enabling Aave to determine how to manage the position.

The proposal with the most YAE votes will be presented as an AIP (Aave Improvement Proposal) for further voting. The copyright of this analysis is waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a plan to offboard Aave V1 by implementing new rate strategies for all assets listed on the platform, encouraging users to migrate their assets to Aave V2 or Aave V3. This decision comes after Aave V1 has been frozen since December 2022 and users have had ample time to migrate. The motivation behind this move is to streamline user experience and concentrate resources on the continued development of the Aave ecosystem. The offboarding process will be executed by implementing new rate strategies for all assets listed on Aave V1, making borrowing and supplying less attractive compared to newer versions. Community feedback will be gathered before moving forward with the proposal.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes enabling stablecoins USDC, USDT, DAI, and LUSD for borrowing in Isolation Mode on Ethereum V3. This recommendation is based on the low volatility of these assets, which helps maintain stability in Isolation Mode positions to reduce liquidations and bad debt. The proposal aims to implement a single AIP to allow these stablecoins as borrowable assets.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to adjust risk parameters in two Aave V3 Optimism assets (WBTC and DAI) based on simulations that reveal an opportunity for increased LTVs and LTs. The changes are expected to improve capital efficiency with no impact on projected Value-at-Risk (VaR) or Extreme VaR, resulting in a potential borrow increase of ~$155,000. The analysis suggests increasing the Loan-To-Value (LTV) and Liquidation Threshold (LT) for WBTC and DAI, reducing the Liquidation Penalty for WBTC, and cautioning about a significant concentration of WBTC on Aave.

The author emphasizes that they are not compensated by Binance & BNB for creating this proposal. The next steps involve gathering community feedback and assessing sentiment towards the proposal, followed by further discussion, risk parameter evaluation, network analysis, and finalization of the proposal if positive sentiment is indicated.

text: This text discusses a proposal to add DeFi Saver as part of the FlashBorrowers in Aave V3 on Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Optimism liquidity pools. If approved, this would waive all flashLoan fees for DeFi Saver users using Aave. The motivation behind this is to increase competitiveness, borrow volume, and consequently Aave DAO revenue, as DeFi Saver has a history of synergies with Aave. The proposal consists of a single AIP, utilizing three similar payloads for each network. However, smart contracts that migrate positions outside the Aave ecosystem are not eligible for whitelisting. The Aave-Chan Initiative is not associated or compensated by DeFi Saver for publishing this proposal.

text:
- Can anyone provide liquidity to the protocol? Yes
   - Is liquidity incentivized? Partially, Stargate owns a portion of the liquidity within the protocol and incentivizes the remaining liquidity.
   - Is there a fee model for participants? Stargate charges 6 basis points per transfer plus the cost of gas associated with sending the transaction through the LayerZero network.
   - Does the entity is or is planning to provide available liquidity into Aave protocol? Stargate is exploring research ideas around depositing idle liquidity into Aave.
   - Link to analytics dashboard of protocol (Liquidity, assets, networks, volume): https://stargate.finance/overview, https://stgscan.io/
   - Link to user-focused dapp of the entity: https://stargate.finance/
   - Link to technical documentation: https://stargateprotocol.gitbook.io/stargate/

### Credit Line Request
Stargate would like to request credit lines for the blockchains where both it and Aave exist. These are Ethereum, Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Polygon, and Fantom. They would like to request credit lines there first, with the ability to scale to the other chains as Aave scales Portals.

|Network|Asset|Current Liquidity (USD)|Current 30D volume (USD)|Requested credit Line|Fee Model|Fee requested|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|All|USDC|90.2M|242M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|
|All|USDT|54.3M|100M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|
|All|ETH|22.7M|68M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|

### Incentives
An incentive program may be approved by the Stargate DAO after the proposal is approved. The Stargate Foundation will recommend that the Stargate DAO give 2 bps of every transaction to the Aave DAO to help align economic incentives and create a deeper partnership between the two communities.

### Audits & Security
- List of relevant security audits of the network: https://github.com/stargate-protocol/stargate/tree/main/audit
- Has the Entity experienced outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks? on which Networks? No
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a community preference survey regarding the supply cap limits for LSTs (Liquid Stability Tokens) in Aave V3. The current high-bound is set at 50% of an asset's on-chain circulating supply to manage counterparty and concentration risks. However, some argue that this limit should be reconsidered for LSTs like MaticX and stMatic due to their unique price feeds and redeemability mechanisms. The survey offers three options: keeping the cap at 50%, increasing it to 75%, or not limiting it as a percentage of circulating supply, with the results influencing future recommendations.
label: neutral

If consensus is reached, an Aave Improvement Proposal will be submitted to onboard MAI on Arbitrum Aave V3 pool. It invites feedback from Risk Service Providers and outlines specific risk parameters if the proposal is accepted. The author discloses ownership of QI & vQI, native assets of the Qidao Protocol, but denies any affiliation or payment for this proposal. If consensus is reached, an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) will be submitted to onboard MAI on the Optimism Aave V3 pool. The text is licensed under CC0.

text: The text proposes deprecating the Aave V2 AMM market due to low usage and risk/reward profile. Suggestions include setting liquidation thresholds to zero for all LP tokens and freezing other assets (DAI, USDC, Tether, WBTC, ETH). This feature, powered by Shutter Network, prevents voter intimidation, encourages independent thinking, protects participants' privacy, and enhances overall security. The success of this trial will be measured by reduced vote spread, increased unique voters, and greater vote variety. The Aave community is invited to collaborate on this initiative.

text: The London Business School Blockchain Society, in collaboration with several other universities, proposes a gas fee rebate mechanism for recognized delegates voting on-chain on Aave to address the increasing gas fees on Ethereum. The rebate amount depends on the participation rate over the previous 90 days, with options to claim monthly or in batches. The community is encouraged to provide feedback on the most appropriate gas rebate token. The proposal draws inspiration from MakerDAO's Recognized Delegate Compensation plan.

text:
Title: Aave Proposal to Adjust Slope 2 and Reserve Factor Parameters

   Summary: This proposal aims to adjust the Slope 2 and Reserve Factor (RF) parameters in the Aave protocol. The change in Slope 2 is due to a reduction in the Uoptimal parameter, which lowers the gradient of the borrow rate between Uoptimal and 100% utilization. To maintain the current gradient, Slope 2 is revised higher. This adjustment is made to counteract the increased deposit rate caused by an increase in the borrow rate, without significantly increasing the borrowing cost.

   The proposal also suggests increasing the RF to be the average of proposed DAI and USDC RFs due to abnormally high USDT usage. This change aims to reduce the deposit rate of USDT, encouraging migration while avoiding a substantial increase in the borrowing cost by shifting utilization onto the steeper portion of the yield curve.

   The tables provided detail the proposed parameter changes to achieve these outcomes. It is important to update these numbers before any AIP submission to avoid unfavorable parameter configurations.

   Note: The author, TokenLogic, is only paid by Aave DAO via Butter as part of the Incentivised Delegate Campaign. The work is licensed under CC0.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to increase the Aave Snapshot proposal threshold from its current value to 250 AAVE. The motivation behind this change is to deter scammers and bad actors by requiring proposals to meet certain minimum requirements, in this case holding or delegated 250 AAVE. This change aims to improve the quality of proposals, reduce the risk of fraudulent proposals, and increase efficiency in Aave's off-chain governance process. The proposal is open for community feedback and refinement before implementation.
label: neutral

text: This text introduces a proposal for an Immunefi bug bounty program for the AaveDAO to enhance the security of their protocol. The Aave Protocol currently has over $5 billion TVL and is known for its security-focused culture. The proposed program aims to incentivize white hat hackers to test the protocol's security and report vulnerabilities. Immunefi, a third-party service, will manage the program with a 10% performance fee on rewards paid out to bug bounty hunters. Aave Companies and BGD Labs will engage with Immunefi on behalf of the DAO to review submissions, respond to security researchers, and update the DAO on important information regarding the program. The goal is to ensure a consistent level of responsiveness for security researchers similar to other bug bounty programs on Immunefi.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Migration of Safety Module (SM) Infrastructure to Balancer V2 and Introduction of New Pool Options for Aave's Yield Aggregator

Summary: This proposal discusses the migration of Aave's Safety Module (SM) infrastructure from Balancer V1 to Balancer V2 (BGD). The new pool options will be based on either AAVE/wETH or AAVE/wstETH. If Balancer receives 50% of wstETH yield as revenue, and other conditions are met, Aave could receive a maximum of 250K BAL over the lifetime of the program. The migration process requires users to activate cooldown, unstake BPT v1, withdraw liquidity, deposit on the new pool, and restake.

Voting options include:
- YAE - 80/20 AAVE/wETH
- YAE - 80/20 AAVE/wstETH
- NAE - Rework Proposal
- ABSTAIN

The SM architecture upgrade to support the launch of GHO is currently being progressed by bgdlabs, with details available [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-abpt-balancer-v2-migration-plan/8381). The Llama team has contributed to this proposal but are not compensated by any of the mentioned communities outside of Aave and do hold small holdings in those communities' tokens.

The full details, including technical specifications and references to related Llama publications, can be found in the forum post [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-146-incentivize-8020-bpt-staking-ve8020/4210) and its amendment [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-225-amendment-to-bip-146-incentivize-8020-bpt-staking-ve8020/4543).
label: neutral

The contract address, ticker, and other specifications are provided for reference. The authors are not compensated by Liquity for this proposal. text:
Here's a summary of the information provided about RPL (Rocket Pool):

1. **Current Use**: RPL is used as insurance for node operators, assurance for Oracle DAO members, governance within the RocketPool Protocol DAO, and to provide liquidity on Uniswap and Balancer.

2. **Emission Schedule**: 15% for Oracle DAO members, 70% for node operators as insurance collateral, and 15% for the Protocol DAO Treasury.

3. **Token & Protocol Permissions**: The RocketPool Protocol is managed by the RocketPool Protocol DAO, which shapes its direction through governance votes. The RPL contract address is [0xD33526068D116cE69F19A9ee46F0bd304F21A51f](https://etherscan.io/token/0xd33526068d116ce69f19a9ee46f0bd304f21a51f).

4. **Market Data**: Market capitalization is $917,000,000, with liquidity pools on Uniswap V3. There are 8,351 token holders and 196,206 transactions since its deployment in September 2017.

5. **Social Channels Data**: The community size is approximately 19,778 on Discord and 40.6K on Twitter, with a GitHub activity of 115.

6. **Risk Parameters**: While risk parameters are suggested to be discussed further, initial suggestions include Isolation Mode (NO), Borrowable (YES), Collateral Enabled (NO), LTV (0), LT and LB (N/A), Debt Ceiling (N/A), Reserve Factor (20%), Supply Cap (3M), and Borrow Cap (2M).

text:
The document provides an overview of fUSDC, a stablecoin on the Aave platform. It is controlled by different entities for various actions: the Flux team manages the pauseGuardian, the Ondo DAO controls admin actions for fUSDC, and the InterestRateModel and Oracle contracts are currently managed by the Flux team's 3/n multisig but will soon be under the control of the Ondo DAO.

Key metrics include a market capitalization of $7,091,198, liquidity pools on Curve, a Discord community of 22,304 members, and a Twitter following of 3,283. The token was deployed on February 3, 2023, has had 802 transactions, and has 400 holders.

fUSDC is collateralized by OUSG, which is invested in Blackrock's SHV ETF, reducing risk due to the low-risk profile of the underlying assets and high liquidity of the ETF. Proposed risk parameters for fUSDC include an LTV of 75%, a liquidation threshold of 80%, a liquidation bonus of 5%, a reserve factor of 10%, and an interest rate strategy similar to USDC.

The document suggests adding support for fUSDC on Ethereum v3 in isolated mode could attract new stablecoin deposits, increase stablecoin utilization rates on Aave, and provide additional opportunities for users to leverage their fUSDC positions.

Next steps include gathering community feedback, publishing a temperature check snapshot vote, escalating the proposal to the ARFC stage, consulting with risk assessment teams, conducting an official ARFC snapshot vote, and finally moving the proposal to the AIP stage for final approval and implementation. The document is released under the Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedication.

To become a recognized delegate, one must follow key steps such as informing the community of their intention, posting a Delegate Platform on Aave Governance forum, acknowledging the Delegate Code of Conduct, demonstrating a history of voting, maintaining high participation rate, and reporting voting rationales. Recognized delegates are expected to participate in forum discussions, express opinions in governance processes, and communicate their voting decisions and rationale. They may also take on additional roles and responsibilities as they see fit. If a recognized delegate wishes to step down, they should inform the community and delegators. The proposal encourages feedback from the Aave community for refinement.

text:
The summary discusses the creation of an E-Mode (Ethereum Mode) on Optimism for wstETH (Wrapped stETH), a token derived from stETH (Staked Ethereum). This E-Mode aims to reduce the exposure of the wstETH price on Optimism by using oracles that draw upon the price of wstETH across multiple networks.

The creation of this E-Mode will enable arbitrage opportunities, potentially leading to a tighter correlation between the wstETH price on Optimism and its true value. However, it's important to note that the stETH & wstETH yield is updated every 24 hours, which affects the exchange rate wstETH/stETH, and there are some cautions associated with using wstETH as collateral in E-Mode.

The risk parameters for this E-Mode have been proposed by Llama, with a Loan to Value of 93.00%, Liquidation Threshold of 90.00%, and Liquidation Bonus of 1.00%. The wstETH and wETH contracts on Optimism are also specified in the summary.

The copyright for this information has been waived under CC0 (Creative Commons Zero).

text:
Title: Safety Module Update Part II - Asset Diversity, SM Categories & Slashing Updates

Summary: This proposal aims to introduce new assets (such as BB-A-USD/GHO or 3CRV/GHO) into the Aave Safety Module (SM), diversifying exposure concentration and potentially integrating with Curve Finance. The proposed maximum slashing for stablecoins is set at 60%. If approved, this will involve removing the current BPT 80/20 from the main module and deploying two new modules on the SM for the new categories (45% & 60% slashing).

Voting Options: YAE - Implement Changes, NAE- Rework Proposal, ABSTAIN

Disclaimer: The Llama is not compensated by any of the mentioned communities outside of Aave. The contributors to this proposal are unpaid delegates within the Balancer ecosystem and some hold small holdings in those communities' tokens.

References: This proposal builds upon a series of previous temporary check proposals related to the Safety Module Upgrade, including Part I, II, III, IV, V, and VI. The full details can be found in the linked references.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Aura Finance Integration with Aave Safety Module

   Summary: This proposal aims to implement the integration of Aura Finance with the Aave Safety Module (SM). The integration will involve deploying a wrapper contract to convert BPT into smBPT, enabling gauges on smBPT, and enabling SM staking on Aura for both volatile and stable LP categories. The proposal also includes a rewards management and redistribution mechanism.

   Key Points:
   - No vulnerabilities have been found in the Aura Finance system so far.
   - Aura received an 88% rating from DeFiSafety, with improvements suggested for protocol documentation.
   - Security researchers and developers are closely involved in Aura via its multisig and general protocol oversight.
   - If passed, Aave Governance will have the ability to manage rewards, update slashing parameters, and perform other administrative tasks related to the SM on Aura.
   - The Llama is not compensated by any of the mentioned communities outside of Aave and does not hold significant positions in those communities.

   Technical Specifications:
   - Deploy a wrapper contract to convert BPT into smBPT (BGD)
   - Enable gauges on smBPT voted in Part I & II (Llama)
   - Enable SM Staking on Aura for Volatile & Stables LP categories (Llama)
   - Add rewards management & redistribution mechanism (BGD)

   Voting Options: YAE - Implement smBPT gauges & Aura Staking, NAE - Implement classic BPT gauges, ABSTAIN

   References: Provided links to related Aave governance proposals for the Safety Module update.
label: neutral
