text:
Pyth is a decentralized price feed provider that uses its own blockchain, Pythnet, for data aggregation and a permissionless update model. It utilizes Wormhole to bridge prices from Pythnet to other blockchains like Ethereum and Solana. For Aave integration on Optimism, a push-based approach is chosen due to Aave's existing backup oracle provider structure.

The Pyth Data Association will operate a price pusher that updates the on-chain prices for supported assets (DAI, USDC, USDT, AAVE, LINK, OP, BTC, ETH, stETH) every 30 minutes or when there's a 0.25% price deviation. The integration is expected to result in around 500 transactions per day.

Pyth's performance was simulated for April 2023 with updates every 1200 seconds or during any 15bps deviation, showing strong price-robustness and accuracy. The design aims to support Aave at no extra cost while ensuring price updates for volatile assets are triggered about 100 times per day, and stablecoins updated every 30 minutes.

Overall, Pyth's proven track record, robust design, and reputable data providers make it a strong candidate to support AAAVE's oracle needs.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal to deploy an MVP version of Aave V3 on Scroll mainnet, a scalable Ethereum equivalent zk-rollup. The deployment aims to establish a strategic position for Aave in the Scroll ecosystem while limiting risk exposure. The MVP will initially support three collaterals (WETH, USDC, wstETH) and one borrowable asset (USDC). Risk parameters are proposed based on consultations with Gauntlet and Chaos Labs, subject to finalization in the ARFC phase. The text encourages community feedback for initial assessment before proceeding to further stages.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes adding FRAX, a stablecoin with a hybrid algorithmic and collateralized mechanism, to Aave v3 on Ethereum. FRAX is currently the 7th largest stablecoin by market cap, has never lost its peg, and has been successfully lent out on Aave v2 without issues. The proposal suggests that FRAX could provide an alternative to existing stablecoins on Aave v3, allowing users to borrow FRAX and earn yield across DeFi platforms. The text includes details about the project, token, risk parameters, and social channels data. The copyright is waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to onboard GMX, a popular DeFi platform offering derivatives with high market demand, to Aave's Arbitrum v3 Liquidity Pool. The proposal includes details about GMX, its utility and governance token, and risk parameters for potential integration. The text also provides links to the project's official resources such as GitHub, documentation, social media channels, and Discord server. Overall, the sentiment appears to be informative and business-oriented, presenting an opportunity for collaboration between two well-established DeFi projects.
label: neutral

text: This text presents a proposal to add the FRAX stablecoin to Arbitrum's Aave v3 liquidity pool. The proposal includes detailed information about FRAX, such as its market cap, number of holders, and social media channels. It also provides technical details like the supply and borrow caps, LTV, and liquidation bonus. The text concludes with a statement that copyright and related rights have been waived via CC0. In summary, this is a proposal to add FRAX to Aave v3 on Arbitrum, including relevant details about FRAX and its terms for inclusion in the pool.

text: This text proposes adding the native version of USDC on Arbitrum to the Aave V3 pool, with the goal of making it the primary version of USDC stablecoin on Arbitrum L2. The current USDC onboarded on Aave V3 Arbitrum pool will be considered "USDC.e". The new native USDC will have initial parameters similar to its bridged counterpart but with more conservative caps, and both tokens will be onboarded simultaneously if the proposal is accepted. This strategy aims for a smooth transition and maintaining stability of the Aave V3 pool on Arbitrum.
label: neutral

text:
This text outlines a proposal for the deployment of GHO (Governance Hourly Obligation) liquidity pools on various decentralized exchanges (DEXs), with a focus on Balancer and Curve Finance. The primary pools proposed are:

1. GHO / bb-a-USD - ComposableStablePoolFactory on Balancer
2. LST / GHO (80/20) - Weighted Pool Factory on Balancer
3. GHO / LUSD - ComposableStablePoolFactory on Balancer

The LST/GHO pool is also being considered for integration into the Aave Stability Module (SM), which could lead to long-term liquidity and potential cost savings through reduced SM expenditure over time.

Secondary pools under exploration include GHO / FRAX, GHO / MAI, and GHO / OHM across various DEXs such as Curve Finance, Olympus, Sommelier, Mellow, Maverick, Uniswap, Swaap, and MAI Finance (Qi DAO).

The size of the liquidity pools will be influenced by factors like the GHO supply cap, veBAL support beyond Aave DAO, and vlAURA support. The community is encouraged to provide feedback on this proposal, which will be incorporated into a future proposal for sizing the liquidity pools and growing the liquidity.

The text also mentions that TokenLogic, which receives funding from the Butter Delegate Campaign and contributes to Llamaxyz, has prepared this publication within its delegate platform scope. The work is released under CC0 (Creative Commons Zero) license.
label: neutral

text: Flipside Crypto is a long-time supporter of Aave, providing open-source data, tools, and dashboards for the community. They have been involved in several proposals and initiatives within Aave, including adding various tokens to Aave v3 markets, governance proposals, and maintaining community-generated dashboards. Flipside is requesting a budget of $125,000 USDC (or GHO) for 6 months to continue their work with Aave, focusing on cross-chain analyses, maintaining and building dashboards, analyzing governance participation, and creating educational resources. Their goal is to grow the Governance, increase voter participation, and empower delegates and stakeholders within the Aave ecosystem. They plan to gather feedback from delegates and community members to better equip the community with their services and intentions.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a reduction in Liquidation Threshold (LT) and Loan-To-Value (LTV) for CRV on Aave V2 Ethereum, with the aim of minimizing potential user account liquidations. The suggested approach involves incremental decreases following a previously approved Risk-Off Framework, and public communication of planned amendments. The impact of the proposed 3% LT decrease is currently negligible, affecting only 2 accounts with a total liquidation value of approximately $3. If consensus is reached, an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) will be submitted to implement these updates. The text is licensed under CC0.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a community proposal to adjust parameters for TUSD on Aave v2 Ethereum, aiming to reduce perceived counterparty risk. Two options are presented: iteratively lowering LT and LTV or freezing TUSD supply. This is a multi-select poll, allowing community members to choose multiple options. The proposal carries the disclaimer that Gauntlet may not implement changes if market conditions significantly shift. Approval of this proposal binds users to Gauntlet's terms of service. The sentiment of the text is informative and decision-making in nature.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a community proposal to distribute bug bounties totaling approximately $125,000 to various independent security researchers for discovering vulnerabilities in Aave's system. The issues found include incorrect flash loan premium distribution, misuse of oracle feeds, potential griefing risks, price manipulation, and inconsistent aToken transfers. The funds will be distributed in USD stablecoins to minimize volatility risk.
label: bullish

text: This text presents a proposal to update the risk parameters of USDT in the Aave ETH V3 pool, allowing it as collateral. The goal is to increase borrowing power for users, stimulate volume on Aave, and enhance the protocol's revenue. The proposed risk parameters for USDT will replicate those of USDC (LTV: 74%, LT: 76%, LB: 4.5%). If successful, the proposal will proceed to the AIP stage for final approval. No third-party compensation is mentioned in this text.
label: neutral

text: This text outlines a proposal for incremental increases in Reserve Factor (RF) across all V2 Ethereum assets on Aave, with the aim of encouraging users to transition their positions to V3. The RF will be increased by 5% at each step, with assessments made after each increase before proceeding with further ones. The proposed changes are detailed in a table for various assets, and the process involves community feedback, ARFC vote, AIP submission, and subsequent updates through AIPs to minimize governance overhead.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to lower Liquidation Threshold (LT) and Loan-To-Value (LTV) for CRV on Aave V3 Polygon. The motivation is to address the decline in market liquidity of CRV, reduce risk exposure, and align it with current market conditions. The proposed reduction is more aggressive than a previous one, reducing LT by 5%. Community feedback will be sought before submission for a vote and potential implementation. The text is under a Creative Commons Zero (CC0) license.
label: neutral

text: This text proposes integrating MakerDAO's Dai Savings Rate (DSR) into Aave V3 Ethereum Pool, using sDAI as the integration token. The motivation is to allow Aave liquidity providers to earn savings from the DSR rate without additional costs for Aave DAI borrowers. However, this integration may increase gas costs for DAI users in Aave. If positively received, further steps would involve drafting an ARFC detailing the technical implementation of this integration. The ACI is not compensated by MakerDAO or any third party for publishing this proposal.

text: The text proposes the implementation of a GHO Steward as a dynamic parameter change mechanism for Aave Protocol's stablecoin GHO during its initial stages. This mechanism aims to ensure efficient risk management and maintain the peg by enabling swift adjustments to risk parameters through decentralized governance. The GHO Steward, a 2/2 multisig including Chaos Labs and Gauntlet, can adjust predefined parameters such as bucket capacity and borrow rate. Decisions are made through a lean governance process involving the community. The GHO Steward is intended to be an initial solution for managing GHO's parameters during the launch period, with potential improvements in the future.
label: neutral

text: This text proposes a new dual reward system, Safety Incentives, where a portion of GHO revenue will be directed to Aave Safety Incentives, allowing stakers to earn both AAVE and GHO tokens. The aim is to enhance the sustainability of the Aave protocol by reducing its reliance on AAVE tokens for Safety Incentives and diversifying rewards. The proposal suggests adjusting the distribution percentage quarterly in response to market conditions. If successful, the proposal will proceed to further discussions and implementation stages.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to update risk parameters for FEI on Aave V2 Ethereum, aiming to minimize potential exposure due to its current market situation. The proposed changes include lowering the Liquidation Threshold and Loan-To-Value to 1% and 0 respectively, increasing the Liquidation Bonus to 10%, and decreasing the UOptimal from 80% to 1%. If approved, these updates will be submitted for a community vote and then an Aave Improvement Proposal. The text is licensed under CC0.
label: neutral

text:
Here is a summary of the data provided:

1. The recommended reductions in Liquidation Threshold (LT) have varying effects on the amount of value liquidated and the number of accounts liquidated. A moderate reduction leads to $1,970 being liquidated across 20 accounts, while an aggressive reduction results in $4,900 being liquidated across 34 accounts.

2. Proposed changes include:
   - Lowering the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio to zero, which may curb borrowing by less sophisticated users but can be bypassed due to V2's design.
   - Increasing the reserve factors (RF) by 10% for inactive assets, which would decrease the interest rate for providing these assets and lower suppliers' incentive to supply them.
   - Increasing the Liquidation Bonus (LB) for all proposed assets (excluding BAL and CVX) to 10%, to better incentivize liquidations and accommodate for low liquidity for the given assets.

3. The table below shows the current and recommended settings for various assets:

| Asset | Current LT | Recommended LT (moderate/aggressive) | Current LTV | Recommended LTV | Current RF | Recommended RF | Current LB | Recommended LB |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| BAL | 70% | 60%, 55% | 65% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 8% | 8% |
| BAT | 70% | 60%, 52% | 65% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 7.5% | 10% |
| CVX | 45% | 40% | 35% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 8.5% | 8% |
| DPI | 70% | 60%, 42% | 65% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 7.5% | 10% |
| ENJ | 67% | 60% | 60% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 6% | 10% |
| KNC | 70% | 60%, 1% | 60% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 10% | 8% |
| MANA | 75% | 65%, 62% | 61.5% | 0 | 35% | 45% | 7.5% | 10% |
| REN | 60% | 50%, 40% | 55% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 7.5% | 10% |
| xSUSHI | 65% | 60% | 50% | 0 | 35% | 45% | 8.5% | 10% |
| YFI | 65% | 55% | 50% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 7.5% | 10% |
| ZRX | 65% | 55%, 45% | 55% | 0 | 20% | 30% | 7.5% | 10% |

4. The next steps are:
   - Gather community feedback and submit the ARFC for a snapshot vote for final approval.
   - If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to implement the proposed updates.

5. The disclaimer states that Chaos Labs has not been compensated by any third party for publishing this ARFC.

6. The copyright information indicates that the work is in the public domain due to a Creative Commons CC0 waiver.
label: neutral

text: The text introduces a proposal for reimbursing gas fees to recognized delegates who vote on Aave's on-chain governance. This is aimed at reducing the cost of participation, encouraging active engagement, fostering diversity, and retaining top delegates. The proposal suggests using wETH as the Gas Rebate Token and outlines a process for claiming these rebates. The text expresses benefits such as better decision-making, a more open delegate ecosystem, and competitiveness with other platforms. The proposal is powered by Skyward and thanks a new contributor for developing the GasRebate Script.

text: The text discusses a proposal for Aave Robot v1, an automated framework of smart contracts to perform permissionless actions within Aave's governance system, powered by Chainlink Automation. Key features include multiple robot contracts, admin control for the DAO, and a system for community members to cover execution costs. The text also mentions a Robot Guardian role for controlling automation, with initial guardianship held by BGD. The setup flow involves deployment of the system by a technical service provider followed by governance proposal activation.

text: The text provides a framework for creating and voting on ARFC (Aave Request for Comment) and TEMP CHECK proposals within the Aave DAO community. It outlines a proposal template, voting requirements, and guidelines to ensure fair representation of the community's views. The framework emphasizes the distinction between TEMP CHECK and ARFC, with TEMP CHECK serving as a temperature check on proposals or topics, while ARFC is a precursor to Aave Improvement Proposals (AIPs). The proposal template includes sections for title, author, date, summary, motivation, specification, disclaimer, next steps, and copyright. Voting guidelines specify quorum and voting duration requirements, among others. The framework aims to ensure thorough consideration of all proposals within the Aave DAO community.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses Gauntlet's proposed modifications to risk parameters across multiple assets on various platforms. These changes aim to balance risk and capital efficiency while maintaining overall protocol tolerance. The adjustments include altering Loan To Value, Liquidation Threshold, and Liquidation Bonus for several assets. Gauntlet's simulation engine will continue to optimize these parameters based on factors such as insolvencies, liquidations, borrow usage, and asset volatility. Users are encouraged to use the Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the suggested parameter updates and overall market risk. The proposal is subject to change if market conditions significantly alter.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes adding rETH to Aave v3 on the Optimism network as collateral, specifically in the ETH correlated eMode. This move aims to diversify LST (Liquidation-Secured Token) offerings on Aave, providing users with more choices and potentially increasing TVL (Total Value Locked). The addition of rETH is supported by a Chainlink oracle and suitable liquidity across several DEX pools. If approved, rETH will have specific borrowing and collateral parameters set, and will be added to the Category 1 eMode in the Optimism - Ethereum Correlated eMode. The text is written by Llamaxyz and TokenLogic, and copyright is waived via CC0.

text: This text proposes adding the GMX token to the Aave v3 Liquidity Pool on the Arbitrum Network. The GMX Protocol is a popular DeFi offering derivatives and has a high trading volume on Arbitrum. The GMX token serves as a utility, governance, and fee accrual token for the GMX protocol. It is highly staked, with approximately 78% of circulating GMX staked earning an APR of 2.94%. Adding GMX to Arbitrum Aave v3 would provide greater asset diversification, allowing users to deposit GMX as collateral and borrow GMX for additional revenue opportunities. The text includes risk parameters provided by Chaos Labs and Gauntlet, and the authors are not affiliated with GMX or any other entity.

text:
1. **Aave-Linea Partnership**: This partnership aims to enhance the distribution and adoption of Aave markets and $GHO, boosting Aave's market reach and stimulating user engagement. It aligns with both parties' commitment to advancing decentralized systems and fostering innovation in DeFi.

2. **Linea Mainnet Promotion**: Consensys is organizing a promotion for the Linea mainnet expected in July, which includes marketing initiatives, partner highlights, IRL, and online presence. Aave benefits from these efforts through its testnet deployment and subsequent mainnet approval on Linea.

3. **Existing Collaboration Efforts**: The teams have successfully collaborated on a "First Class Linea Citizen" campaign, integrating the Lens tech stack into the Linea network. This resulted in over 257K Lens handles established, accompanied by numerous posts, follow actions, and comments.

4. **Bridge Security**: The Linea team operates a canonical Open Messaging Service (OMS), ensuring messages can pass between Ethereum and Linea securely. They also plan to decentralize the bridge (relayer) and sequencer, with the priority on decentralizing the prover.

5. **Proposal Details**: This proposal presents Aave governance with the opportunity to deploy Aave V3 on the Linea testnet before its mainnet launch. The asset and market factors will be managed directly through Linea during this testnet phase, with suitable alternatives found for oracles since Linea is not currently integrated with Chainlink.

6. **Governance**: This proposal was a collaborative effort between the Aave community (specifically Flipside) and Consensys/Linea, ensuring transparent, fair, and comprehensive governance procedures that align with the interests of all involved parties.

7. **Next Steps**: Following a 7-day discussion period, Flipside will work with the community to trigger a Snapshot for a vote for testnet deployment. The Linea team will handle all technical deployment activities. Progress will be openly communicated with the community. This partnership aims to make Aave a Linea launch partner in July.
label: neutral

text:
This document outlines a proposal for an update to the Safety Module in Aave, focusing on incentives management strategy. The proposed changes aim to grow the Total Value Locked (TVL) and coverage, improve liquidity for Aave tokens, and optimize voting power and incentives.

Key points include:
- With current market metrics and estimated TVL, the expected APRs on Aura are achieved, along with a reduction in average insurance cost from 30,02% to 17,23% and an increase in cover from $119M to $175M.
- The strategy will also help grow SM (TVL & Cover) and improve liquidity for Aave tokens, allowing other incentive budgets for GHO liquidity or liquidity mining on StakedATokens to be used for the same strategy.
- Voting options include YAE (Update the incentives management strategy), NAE (Continue classic liquidity mining), and ABSTAIN.
- The Llama, an unpaid delegate within the Balancer ecosystem, is not compensated by any of the mentioned communities outside of Aave.
- References are provided to related proposals in the Aave governance forum.

Technical implementations include enabling weekly distribution for Stable & Volatile BPT rewards, whitelisting the AAVE token on Quest as a reward, and defining the Aave voting framework.

The proposal also suggests locking veToken assets into Balancer and Aura to generate increased rewards, creating votes incentives on Quest, updating boost power, delegating or selling it on Warden if unused, voting on gauges & proposals decisions, and claiming protocol fees.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal for the Aave community to establish a voting framework and elect a committee to manage strategic assets, specifically veToken holdings. The proposed committee would be responsible for tasks such as locking/relocking positions, casting votes on gauges, claiming rewards, and updating boosts. The benefits of this proposal include ease of automation and optimization of resources, but issues like the inability to delegate gauge power on-chain and the need to add new functions to the collector contract are also addressed. The text concludes with a call for voting on whether to proceed with the committee or not.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to assign the Metis Foundation wallet as the emission manager for the METIS token on the Aave V3 Metis pool. The aim is to enable the foundation to fund incentive programs, boosting growth and attracting more users to the pool. If approved, this could stimulate activity in line with the broader goals of the Aave community. The proposal is powered by Skyward and follows the CC0 license.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal for community approval of three interdependent projects within the Aave ecosystem: Aave Governance v3, a.DI (Aave Delivery Infrastructure), and Aave Robot v3. These projects are intended to improve the governance system of Aave and enable cross-chain communication. The text emphasizes that these components are interdependent, especially Aave Governance and a.DI. The proposal requests pre-approval for these ideas within the Aave community, with voting options being 'FOR' (support), 'AGAINST' (oppose), or 'ABSTAIN'.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses proposed modifications to risk parameters on various Aave platforms (Ethereum v3, Arbitrum v3, Ethereum v2) by Gauntlet's risk simulation platform. These changes aim to balance insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage while maintaining overall risk tolerance. The updated values for Loan to Value, Liquidation Threshold, and Liquidation Bonus are provided for each asset. It is recommended that the community uses Gauntlet's Risk Dashboard to understand the suggested parameter updates and assess general market risk. The proposal is subject to change based on market conditions.
label: bullish

text: The text introduces a new contract, StrategicAssetManager, designed to manage Aave DAO's strategic assets, particularly veBAL at launch. The contract aims to optimize governance and rewards by automating transactions and minimizing AIP votes. It also has the potential to handle other strategic assets in the future. The contract is upgradeable and controlled by Aave's Short Executor role via governance. Further details will be defined in upcoming ARFC posts.
label: neutral

text: This text proposes the deployment of Aave V3 on the BNB Chain, expanding Aave's presence and tapping into the growing DeFi ecosystem and user base of BNB Chain. The suggested assets for collateral include BNB, WBTC, BETH, WETH, USDC, and USDT. If approved by the community, this deployment aims to enhance growth and collaboration between Aave and BNB Chain communities, providing new opportunities for both ecosystems. The proposal includes a detailed specification of risk parameters for each asset and a checklist for deployment. The author clarifies that they are not compensated by Binance & BNB for creating this proposal and encourages community feedback to refine the ARFC before final approval.
label: neutral

text: This text proposes a dynamic parameter change mechanism for the Aave Protocol's stablecoin GHO during its initial stages. The proposed GHO Steward multisig, if approved, would enable swift adjustments to risk parameters such as borrow rate and bucket capacity. This is intended to ensure stability and transparency while preserving the peg of GHO. The mechanism emphasizes decentralization and community involvement in decision-making processes. If passed, it will be active for 90 days, with potential extension by the DAO.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to reduce Liquidation Threshold (LT) and Loan-To-Value (LTV) for CRV on Aave V2 Ethereum, based on observations of reduced usage and withdrawal of over 12M CRV from V2 Ethereum. Two options are proposed for the community vote: an "Aggressive" option with a 6% reduction and a "Moderate" option with a 3% reduction. The table shows potential liquidation impacts under each option, with more substantial liquidations expected under the aggressive option. The final LT and LTV values will be decided after community voting. The next steps include community feedback, submission of an ARFC for a snapshot vote, and if approved, submission of an AIP to implement the updates.

text: The text presents a proposal for a Peg Stability Module (GHO Stability Module) by AaveCompanies. The module aims to maintain the stability of GHO, inspired by existing models like MakerDAO's. It introduces unique features such as Price Strategies, Debt Ceiling, Capital Allocator, Last Resort Liquidations, and Price Bounds & Swap Freezes for risk management. The community is invited to review the codebase after approval, followed by an audit and governance decisions on configurations. The proposal aims to enhance GHO's stability and peg maintenance.
label: neutral

text:
Summary:

This table compares the current health factor (1.05) with a proposed lower LT of 40% for seven accounts on Aave v3. The total forced liquidations amount to approximately $920k in supply. The new parameters would significantly reduce the health factors, making more accounts eligible for liquidation.

The table shows the current and proposed health factor, total borrows and supply in USD, assets borrowed, assets supplied, and the collateral types for each account. Notably, the account with address 0x16af29b7efbf019ef30aae9023a5140c012374a5 has a current health factor of 1.05 but would have a proposed health factor of 0.54, indicating a significant risk of liquidation under the new parameters.

Disclaimer:
This proposal is powered by Skyward. The Aave-Chan Initiative is not representing this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

Next Steps:
The community is invited to provide feedback, and a snapshot will be initiated on 2023.07.24. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE (Yes And Execute), this proposal will progress to the AIP stage.

Copyright:
Copyright and related rights are waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text: The text introduces a new contract, "Curator" by Llama, designed for efficient asset management in DAOs with MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) and price-impact protection. The Curator will facilitate swapping, acquiring LSTs, and transferring assets. It is intended to interact with specific contracts on Ethereum, such as CoW Swap, Lido Protocol, and Rocket Pool. An AllowList will limit the contract's interaction with other contracts, and a curatorRole can be assigned for controlled interactions. The Curator will provide various functionalities tailored to each network and will undergo governance approval before deployment.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses an update to Reserve Factors (RF) on Polygon Aave v2, aiming to encourage users to migrate funds to v3. By increasing the RF, a larger portion of interest paid by users goes to Aave DAO's Treasury, with minimal risk to user funds and unchanged borrowing rates. Assets like CRV, DPI, GHST, and LINK will receive near-zero deposit yield due to increased RF. The remaining assets will have a 5% incremental increase in RF. The community will provide feedback, followed by a snapshot vote for final approval, and subsequent updates will be made through Aave Improvement Proposals (AIPs). The author is a delegate within the Aave community who receives payment indirectly from Aave Grant DAO.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposed solution by Gauntlet to mitigate insolvency risks in Aave v3 due to price dislocations between market and smart contract prices, particularly for LST (Liquidity Stability Token). Gauntlet suggests a "killswitch" functionality for the LST Emode in case of an LST depeg. This functionality includes four levers (A, B, C, D) that can be activated to limit borrowing power, freeze LST, adjust liquidity, or lower LTV to non-emode LST parameters. The community is invited to vote on their preferred option from the provided set. Gauntlet reserves the right to not implement any changes if market conditions significantly alter.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a reduction in the supply, borrow caps, and debt ceiling for MAI on Aave V3 Avalanche due to its recent depegging. The recommendations suggest setting current supply as the new supply cap, current borrow as the new borrow cap, and a debt ceiling of twice the liquidity within LB range divided by MAI LT. This would significantly limit further usage of MAI as collateral on Avalanche and effectively disable it on Polygon. The proposal is not influenced by any third-party compensation.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Aave DAO's veBAL Distribution Strategy and Future Considerations

Summary: This document outlines the proposed distribution strategy for Aave DAO's veBAL voting weights, focusing on three pools: GHO/bb-a-USD v3, GHO/LUSD, and 80/20 wstETH/GHO. The strategy involves using 40% of the veBAL for each of the first two pools and 20% for the third. The document also discusses future considerations such as TVL in the pools, duration of external support, frequency of re-locks, vote allocation, Aura Boost, and potential solutions like Protocol Owned Liquidity, Treasury Committee, and GHO Liquidity Incentives Budget to reduce dependency on external parties. The document is published by TokenLogic, a contributor to Llama, under CC0 license.

text: The text proposes the deployment of Aave V3 on the Base network upon its mainnet launch, aiming to expand Aave's presence and tap into the growth and unique users of the Base ecosystem. If approved by the Aave community, assets like wETH, wstETH, cbETH, and USDC will be available for collateral. This move is expected to create valuable revenue opportunities for Aave while leveraging Coinbase integrations, fiat onramps, and access to a large user base. For Base, it introduces trusted lending protocols and fosters diversity in DeFi platforms. The text also provides a detailed specification of the risk parameters for each asset involved.

The termination could save up to $240k, which can be reallocated to other initiatives. If approved, an AIP implementation will follow.

The plan aims to reduce liquidity in BUSD, encourage users to switch to other stablecoins, and manage potential risk of protocol bad debt. The proposed actions include modifying risk parameters to increase interest rates and removing aBUSD from the collector contract to increase costs for open positions. The offboarding plan will be carried out in a single AIP with specific parameters. If approved by the community, an AIP implementation will follow. The text clarifies that the Aave-Chan Initiative is not affiliated with Binance and the author does not hold any BUSD at the time of writing.

text: This text discusses a proposal between Aave and Flipside Crypto for a 6-month collaboration aimed at improving operational efficiency, governance structures, and community resources. The focus is on increasing diversity in the delegate base, updating documentation, data availability, and community resources. The proposal seeks to cement Flipside's role and invest in services towards a more sustainable future for Aave. The services offered by Flipside include operational efficiency improvements, DAO operations & community resources development, governance support, data analysis & research, and more. The deliverables will be communicated with the community for transparency.

text: This text proposes to add LUSD as a collateral asset on the Aave V3 ETH pool, similar to USDC. The author highlights LUSD's stability and potential synergy with GHO, enhancing liquidity and peg stability. Risk parameters are proposed at 77% LTV, 80% LT, and 4.5% LP. If approved, the proposal is part of a larger program and does not involve third-party compensation. The next step is to proceed to AIP for final approval if the Snapshot outcome is positive.

text: The text proposes migrating Aave DAO funds from version 2 to version 3 on the Avalanche network, citing higher deposit rates and incentives in v3. The migration tool developed by @bgdlabs will be used for this purpose. This proposal aims to transfer approximately 8.3% of the TVL (Total Value Locked) on v2 to v3. text:
This document provides a summary of the proposed deployment of Aave V3 on the Celo blockchain. Key features include:

- Bonus for providing liquidity: 7.5% (for initial deployment) and 5%.
- Reserve Factor: 15% (initial deployment) and 10%.
- Liquidation Protocol Fee: 10%.
- Borrow Cap: 110 (initial deployment) and 880,000.
- Supply Cap: 140 (initial deployment) and 1,100,000.
- Debt Ceiling: Not defined for initial deployment, to be determined later.
- uOptimal: 80% (initial deployment), 45%, and 75%.
- Base, Slope1, Slope2: 1%, 3.8%, 4%, 7%, 60%, 7%, 300%, 75%.
- Stable Borrowing: Disabled for initial deployment.
- Stable Slope1 and Stable Slope2: 13.00% (initial deployment), 13.00%, 13.00%, 13.00%.
- Base Stable Rate Offset, Stable Rate Excess Offset: 3.00%, 5.00%, 3.00%, 5.00%.
- Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio: 20.00% (initial deployment), 20.00%.
- Flashloanable: Yes for initial deployment.
- Siloed Borrowing, Borrowed in Isolation: No for initial deployment.

Chainlink has been deployed on Celo as part of the Chainlink SCALE Program. Celo has integrations with token bridges like Portal (Wormhole), Allbridge, and Squid, and cross-chain messaging partners including Wormhole, Hyperlane, LayerZero, and Axelar.

The document also includes a disclaimer stating that the information provided is from public sources and may not be accurate, and Michigan Blockchain will abstain from voting on this proposal due to potential conflicts of interest. The next steps involve gathering community feedback, assessing sentiment towards the proposal, proceeding to an ARFC stage for further discussion, risk parameter evaluation, network analysis, and finalization of the proposal, and submitting the proposal as an AIP for voting and on-chain governance approval if the ARFC stage is successful. The document is copyright-free under CC0.
label: bearish

text: The text requests an extension of budget for security reviews of Aave Governance V3 and related projects (a.DI and GHO Stability Module) from the community, citing ongoing work with Sigma Prime in the past year. text:
Title: Chaos Labs' Request for Additional Funding for Continued Services to Aave

Summary: This proposal requests an additional $400K for the remainder of Chaos Labs' current engagement, bringing the total annual compensation to $1.5M. If approved, a stream of 400,000 aUSDT will be created and scheduled to conclude on November 7th, 2023.

Methodologies: Chaos Labs' Research, Chaos Labs - LSD Methodology Update

Specification: The AIP will call the `createStream()` method of the `IAaveEcosystemReserveController` interface to create a stream of 400,000 aUSDT.

Disclaimer: Chaos Labs provides ongoing risk management services to several other borrowing/lending protocols, but their responsibilities concerning Aave are not affected by these commitments. This proposal was not commissioned or paid for by any third party.

Next steps: If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP).

Copyright: Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.
label: bearish

text: The text proposes a gradual winding down of the CRV market on Aave V2 Ethereum, citing ongoing discussions and recent exploits as reasons. This is to be achieved through a series of LT reductions, with bi-weekly risk analyses and recommendations from risk teams. If there's disagreement among the risk teams, a community vote will decide the approach. The plan includes independent analyses by risk teams on Monday, a joint recommendation post by Gauntlet and Chaos Labs on Tuesday, and an AIP or Snapshot vote on Wednesday. Chaos Labs has not been compensated for this proposal.

text:
This document outlines a proposal to adjust the risk parameters for various assets in Aave V2, with the aim of encouraging suppliers to transition to V3. The proposed changes involve increasing the collateral assets by 5%.

The table provided lists frozen assets and their current and recommended LT (Long-Term) and LTV (Loan-to-Value) values, as well as the Current and Recommended Risk Factors (RF). For unfrozen assets, only the recommended RF changes are listed.

After community feedback, this Aave Risk Framework Change (ARFC) will be submitted for a snapshot vote for final approval. If consensus is reached, an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) will be submitted to implement the proposed updates.

It's important to note that Chaos Labs has not been compensated by any third party for publishing this ARFC, and the copyright has been waived via CC0.

It is noted that wGHO is a simple ERC-20 wrapper around GHO and onboarding wGHO instead of GHO is due to technical implementation and risk isolation reasons. The author has both large GHO debt & GHO holdings, and if the proposal is approved, it will move to the AIP stage. The text is licensed under CC0.

text:
Title: TokenLogic Proposal for Aave v3 Migration, Liquidity Committee, and GHO Optimization

Summary: This proposal outlines the work of TokenLogic, a team that includes @MatthewGraham, @DeFiJesus, @Dydymoon, @scottincrypto, @agentmak, and TBA (soon). The team aims to support Aave's initiatives for an initial 6-month period at a total budget of 350,000 USD. The work includes migrating Aave DAO funds from v2 to v3, creating a Liquidity Committee with funding, optimizing GHO liquidity incentives, and more.

Key Points:
1. Migrate Aave DAO funds from v2 to v3
2. Create Liquidity Committee with funding
3. Optimize GHO liquidity incentives
4. Strategic Assets are being actively used
5. Runway funding sustained (>6 months of the correct assets)
6. Convert Treasury assets to LSTs
7. Launch financial statement frontend
8. Continual flow of new GHO Dashboard features
9. Inclusion in Gas Rebate program
10. Commitment to not receiving funds from other entities for creating proposals and publishing AIPs on Aave Protocol

Budget: The budget is 350,000 USD for an initial 6-month period, with a 0/100 split of upfront/streamed payments.

Next Steps: If the proposal is successful, TokenLogic will move forward with a formal ARFC submission to governance and commit to maintaining transparency throughout the process and providing regular updates on their progress.

Copyright: The work is under CC0 license.

text:
This text discusses a potential shift in strategy by the Aave DAO regarding its holdings in the Balancer ecosystem. The current holdings are in B-80BAL-20WETH, but there's a proposal to switch to vlAURA instead.

The reasons for this switch include:

1. Max emission power on DAO-owned strategic assets
2. Shorter lock period (4 months compared to veBAL's 1 year)
3. No decay on vlAURA, meaning no need to relock weekly
4. Fewer votes needed for casting since voting are calculated in rounds (2 weeks)

However, there are also potential drawbacks:

1. Limited liquidity, which could be an issue if Aave DAO wants to acquire AURA on the market but OTC deals can be considered as an alternative.
2. Risk of efficiency reduction if the Aura protocol BAL accumulation doesn't follow the vlAURA supply increase.
3. No veBoost on vlAURA, although Aura deposits are boosted with their veBAL share.

The text also mentions other considerations such as the cost of selling B-80BAL-20WETH BPT, the cost of acquiring vlAURA via OTC deals, potential security and ecosystem risks, dev resources to add vlAURA support to current StrategicAssetManager, and review time by BGD of the vlAURA implementation.

The text concludes with a call for community feedback on this proposal, suggesting three possible voting options: YAE (Update the strategy), NAY (Use veBAL as initially voted), and ABSTAIN. If the community feedback is positive, further analysis and discussion will be conducted in the ARFC stage before submitting the proposal as an AIP for voting and on-chain governance approval. The author of this text is a strategist contributing to TokenLogic & Llama, and this proposal is published independently without requesting compensation from any third party.
label: neutral

text:
This summary discusses a potential shift in strategy by the Aave DAO regarding its holdings in the Balancer ecosystem, specifically B-80BAL-20WETH. The main driver of this change is the introduction of vlAURA, which offers several advantages such as maximum emission power on strategic assets, shorter lock periods, no decay, and less frequent voting requirements.

However, there are also potential drawbacks to consider, including limited liquidity, potential efficiency issues if the Aura protocol BAL accumulation doesn't follow the vlAURA supply increase, and the absence of veBoost on vlAURA. Other factors to consider include the cost of selling B-80BAL-20WETH BPT, the cost of acquiring vlAURA via OTC deals, potential security and ecosystem risks, dev resources required to add vlAURA support, and review time by BGD for the vlAURA implementation.

The proposal is currently a TEMP CHECK, seeking community feedback and sentiment towards updating Balancer ecosystem holdings for a more efficient solution. If the community response is positive, the proposal will move to the ARFC stage for further discussion, analysis, and finalization. If successful at the ARFC stage, it will be submitted as an AIP for on-chain governance approval. The author of this summary has contributed to TokenLogic & Llama but stresses that this proposal is not requesting compensation from any third party.
label: neutral

text:
The provided table outlines the estimated timeline and project phases for the Anemoy Liquid Token Fund (LTF) proposal by k/factory team member, a core contributor to Centrifuge protocol. The project involves the creation of a Foundation Company, deployment of $1M into a US Treasuries Fund, and ongoing operations where DAO can vote on increasing allocations for investments.

The legal setup costs are estimated to be up to 50,000 USDC, which will be returned if unused. The proposal aims to break-even within the first 6 months and generate revenue thereafter. There are fees associated with this project, including a portfolio fee of 0.35% p.a. on assets in Prime up to $50M, 0.2% for $50-100M, and 0.1% for >$100M paid to Centrifuge for maintaining the portfolio. Additionally, there will be an Aave Reward of 500 stkAave streamed over 2 years into the Centrifuge treasury.

Since the Temp Check, more details have been provided on the legal framework, Anemoy LTF, and use of funds. Individual and group calls with active delegates and voting participants were hosted to answer questions and provide further context. A public Twitter Space was also held for discussion. This ARFC (Aave Improvement Proposal) has been modified to focus primarily on an initial 1m RWA investment, with further investments explicitly out of scope.

Upon approval, Centrifuge will work with the DAO to implement and execute the AIP. The proposal is written by a member of the k/factory team and copyright is waived via CC0. For more information, refer to the provided resources.
label: neutral

text:

text:
This text outlines a proposed budget for incentivizing liquidity on various decentralized exchange platforms (DEXs) to support the GHO stablecoin on the Aave platform. The budget is divided into two main categories: concentrated liquidity pools (Maverick & Uniswap v3, Bunni & Liquis) and Balancer/Aura pools.

The budget breakdown assumes that all strategies will begin to be incentivized at the same time with the maximum amount, but this is not necessarily how it will happen in practice. A 20% buffer has been added to the committee budget to account for potential increases in bribe costs or increased liquidity needs on different layers.

The unspent budget will either be deducted from the next budget request if the committee is renewed, or sent back to the Aave DAO treasury. TokenLogic will provide analysis, estimation, and monitoring of liquidity, facilitate the creation of liquidity pools not yet in production, and the Liquidity Committee will implement on-chain transactions on behalf of Aave DAO.

The proposal does not involve any payment to TokenLogic from Aave DAO or external sources for creating this proposal. TokenLogic is a delegate within the Aave ecosystem. The next steps are to gather feedback about updating GHO liquidity for more efficient solutions and post an ARFC snapshot vote.
label: neutral

text:
1. Function: Liquidity Provision
   - KNC holders can provide liquidity for the token by pairing it with another asset (e.g. KNC-USDC) and depositing the tokens into their preferred KyberSwap liquidity pool.
   - KNC liquidity providers earn fees from the trading activity that goes through the pool.

2. Function: Liquidity Incentives
   - KNC may be used by KyberDAO as liquidity mining rewards to incentivize liquidity providers on KyberSwap on top of standard trading fees, thereby providing more value to liquidity providers.

3. Emission Schedule
   - There is currently no automatic emission of KNC. All tokens for founders and advisors from the token sale have been distributed since September 2019.
   - ~14.3M KNC is managed by KyberDAO as part of an ecosystem growth fund to facilitate trade and liquidity mining, and other growth activities.

4. Token (& Protocol) permissions (minting) and upgradability. Is there a multisig? What can it do? Who are the signers?
   - KNC is an upgradeable token. The overall architecture for KyberDAO is largely based on Aaves governance model with some differences/modifications such as the ability to enable the creation and voting of multi-option (generic, non-binary) proposals, and enabling the calculation of KyberDAO voting power based on a system that uses the KNC staking model.
   - The DAO has in-built governance safeguards to ensure that any decision or contract alteration will always be preceded by a suitable time period of preparation and reflection, as well as a minimum voter participation threshold. In addition, we have a 5/9 multisig with the role of a DAO operator that assists with operational tasks and ensuring the integrity of the DAO. The multisig comprises a mix of Kyber team members and founders of external DeFi project representatives.
   - The Kyber team alone does not have the power to implement major changes to the KNC token, DAO, and the protocols in the network, without going through a DAO vote.
   - Changes to KyberDAO and KNC can only be made by the KyberDAO via voting on a Kyber Improvement Proposal (KIP).

5. Market data (Market Cap, 24h Volume, Volatility, Exchanges, Maturity)
   - Circulating market cap (12 September 2023): $90,543,409
   - 24H trading volume (12 September 2023): $10,065,292
   - Etherscan: 0xdeFA4e8a7bcBA345F687a2f1456F5Edd9CE97202
   - Top exchanges are already supporting the latest version of KNC. KNC can be obtained on KyberSwap as well as centralized exchanges such as Binance, Coinbase, Upbit, Bithumb, Bitrue, Crypto. com, OKX, Huobi, Bitfinex, KuCoin, Kraken, Gemini, MEXC, HitBTC, Gate. io, and Tokocrypto.

6. Risk parameters
   - Ticker: KNC
   - Contract Address : 0xdeFA4e8a7bcBA345F687a2f1456F5Edd9CE97202
   |Parameter|Value|
   | --- | --- |
   |Isolation Mode|YES|
   |Borrowable|YES|
   |Collateral Enabled|YES|
   |LTV|40%|
   |LT|50%|
   |LB|10%|
   |Debt Ceiling|TBD|
   |Reserve Factor|20%|
   |Supply Cap|TBD|
   |Borrow Cap|TBD|
label: neutral

The author of the text is a delegate within the Aave ecosystem and receives no payment for creating this proposal.
