text: This text presents a proposal from Aave Labs for a one-year service engagement with the Aave Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO), focusing on the development of Aave V4 and a new visual identity. The key deliverables for Aave Protocol V4 include enhancements such as a modular architecture, unified liquidity layer, fuzzy-controlled interest rates, liquidity premiums, dynamic risk configuration, smart accounts and vaults, automated assets offboarding, an enhanced liquidation engine, automated treasury management, and GHO features. The visual identity deliverables include providing visual identity assets, usage guidelines, and delivering the assets in a GitHub repository. The grant for this project is $12m GHO, with $3m upfront and $9m streamed over the year. Evaluation metrics will be based on monthly contributions to the Aave DAO, feedback from other service providers, and direct engagement with the DAO via the governance forum. Aave Labs must adhere to certain principles, prioritize security and robustness, engage with the DAO like all other contributors, and follow established working relationships and procedures of the Aave DAO for decisions concerning risk configurations, DAO treasury, code audits, and other matters not covered by this proposal. If approved, an AIP vote will be published for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal. The text is released under the CC0 license, with visuals and the new visual identity governed by a future governance proposal by the Aave DAO.

text:
In this text, the author discusses the potential benefits of integrating Aave into the Aptos blockchain. The key advantages include:

1. Adding a mature financial layer to Aptos' ecosystem
2. High transaction throughput (up to 30,000 transactions per second) for DeFi protocols like Aave
3. Enhanced security with the Move programming language used by Aptos
4. Transaction cost efficiency and potentially lower fees
5. Modular and flexible architecture for seamless updates and improvements
6. Economic benefits for the Aave DAO, such as market share growth, revenue growth, and incentives from the Aptos Foundation
7. Integration with ChainLinks Price Feeds as the oracle provider and Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol (CCIP) for enhanced functionality and security
8. The proposal is subject to successful completion of technical reviews, audits, and governance approvals
9. Next steps include escalating the proposal to Snapshot stage, ARFC stage, and AIP vote if consensus is reached
10. A disclaimer emphasizes that this proposal is for community feedback and does not represent a final decision, and actions should consider associated risks.
label: neutral

text:
1. Dashboards will be integrated into the Aave Portal, where they will be maintained and expanded over time.

2. GHO Adoption:
   - Oversight: Continue managing key GHO and GSM configurations, ensure adequate funding for GSM, optimize utilization of strategic voting assets, support GSM integrations with aggregators, and integrate GHO to Centralized Exchanges and fund managers.
   - Liquidity: Adjust liquidity incentives, define and execute direct liquidity incentives, lead initiatives creating utility for GHO, optimize the DAO's strategic voting assets, support GSM Integrations with aggregators, ensure GSM are adequately funded, support future D3M, Facilitator, and Protocol Owned Liquidity (POL) initiatives.
   - Growth: Support new deployments of GHO to maintain peg stability and adequate liquidity, work with teams building with GHO, and contribute to the creation of sGHO when mature enough.

3. Aave Stack:
   - Safety Module Management and Optimization: Transition from AAVE emissions, introduce new categories, amend emission schedules, and progressively align protocol exposure with SM holdings.
   - Aave Liquidity Network: Participate in coordination and consulting to support the streamlined and successful deployment of new features like the Liquidity Network and stablecoin's multichain deployment.

4. Specification: The createStream() method of the IAaveEcosystemReserveController will be called to create two streams with a start time block 1718673864, for TokenLogic and karpatkey, which are included in the Gas Rebate program.

5. Disclaimer: TokenLogic and karpatkey receive no compensation beyond the Aave protocol for the creation of this proposal. They are both delegates within the Aave ecosystem.

6. Copyright: Rights waived via CC0.

text: This text proposes to explore community interest in adding Crypto.com Staked ETH (CDCETH) to Aave V3 on the Ethereum mainnet. The motivation is based on Crypto.com's large user base, regulatory compliance, and the success of its staking product. CDCETH is already listed on Curve, Uniswap, and Balancer, with plans for a pool on Balancer and incentives to grow liquidity. Integrating CDCETH as collateral on Aave V3 aims to drive adoption, improve CDCETH's utility, and increase revenues for both parties. Initial supply-side liquidity of up to $5M CDCETH and liquidity mining programs are proposed. The proposal follows a standard process of escalation if consensus is reached.
label: bullish

text: The text presents an update proposal for the Merit program in Round 7 by Aave Chan Initiative. The aim is to increase efficiency and adapt to new strategies, with changes including expanding rewards to Gnosis Safe users, removing diversity supporter LST boost and GHO minting rewards, and introducing a new Etherfi Aave Market Boost. The proposal requires governance approval before implementation.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to add weETH (an LRT token) to Aave V3 on Scroll, following its successful addition to Aave v3 on Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Base. The proposal aims to increase Aave's ability to serve weETH demand from users. The deposit of weETH into Aave on Scroll will accumulate rewards from Ether.fi, EigenLayer, and Scroll Marks. Risk parameters will be provided by Risk Service Providers. If approved, the proposal will follow the asset onboarding framework and be subject to a discussion period and an AIP vote for final confirmation. The text also mentions that the proposal is powered by Skywards and that the ACI team members are weETH and ETHFI holders.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to increase the debt ceiling for USDe on Ethereum's V3, currently at $40M, to $50M due to high utilization. The current market conditions support this increase, but it is noted that the majority of USDe debt positions are concentrated in one user account, accounting for over 83% of the total debt. This concentration will be monitored and considered in future recommendations. The next steps include community feedback, a snapshot vote, and if approved, an Aave Improvement Proposal to implement the changes. No compensation has been received by Chaos Labs for publishing this proposal.
label: neutral

text:
This document outlines several proposed changes to the Aave protocol, including:

1. Deployment of the StkGHO Umbrella Safety Module, financed by Aave's excess revenue and with rewards set exclusively in GHO. The Safety Target for this module will be defined by Aave Finance & Risk service providers. The legacy StkGHO safety module cooldown is set to zero, and the Merit Program continues as it exists today to incentivize user migration.

2. End of the StkAAVE GHO discount, introduction of the anti-GHO system, and closure of the LEND chapter. This will occur when the GHO supply reaches 175M and secondary liquidity allows a 10M swap size at 1% price impact.

3. Activation of the Umbrella Atokens Safety Module and initiation of the "Buy and Distribute" AAVENomics. This will happen when Aave Collector net holdings are equal to 2 years' service providers' recurring costs for the past 30 days, and Aave protocol annualized revenue is at 150% of all protocol expenses YTD, including the AAVE acquisition budget and Umbrella budgets. This will finance secondary liquidity for AAVE, end the Legacy Safety Module, create aUSDC and aWETH Umbrella Safety Modules (if validated by governance feedback), and initiate a buy and distribute program for AAVE.

The community is encouraged to provide feedback on this proposal, which will then move to the TEMP CHECK snapshot stage if consensus is achieved. The Aave Chan Initiative has not received any compensation from related parties for drafting this proposal. All rights are waived under Creative Commons Zero (CC0).
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to onboard slisBNB, a tokenized version of staked BNB, to Aave V3 on the BNB Chain. The motivation behind this is to increase liquidity and utility for staked BNB by allowing it to be used as collateral within the DeFi ecosystem. The proposal includes risk parameters, eligibility for rewards from Lista's ongoing point system, and specifications such as contract address, supply and borrow caps, LTV, and Liquidation Bonus. The text also provides useful links to learn more about slisBNB and lists next steps in the process. Overall, the sentiment is informative and neutral.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Beyond the SWAMP - ApeCoin and Yuga Labs Focused Magazine NFT Proposal

Description: Beyond the SWAMP is seeking a one-time grant for company development and first issue production. The magazine will be designed by a team of career creatives specializing in layout, illustration, and graphic design. The initial rollout will be 350 copies, with an increase to 500 copies for the second issue and 750 copies from issues three to six, totaling 3850 magazines in the first year at an average production cost of $13.63 per copy. The overall cost is $52,500 USD, broken down as follows:

APE ($30,600.00)
- Advisors: $4000.00
- Columnists and contributors: $3200.00
- Cover/featured artist: $3000.00
- Publishing manager (3 months x $2500.00): $7500.00
- Otherdeed golden cover: $1700.00
- Otherdeed Twitter: $1700.00
- Additional NFTs (for rarity tiers created by artists for Beyond the SWAMP): $2000.00
- Marketing: $2500.00
- Contingency planning & additional marketing (as needed): $5000.00

USDC ($21,900.00)
- Legal (NDAs, releases, copyright review, etc): $5000.00
- Logo and graphic design: $4500.00
- Website w/Web3 + smart contract development: $3500.00
- Third party website and smart contract audit: $1500.00
- Printing: $3500.00
- Packaging: $525.00
- Promo (stickers, posters, etc): $500.00
- Dedicated iMac: $1800.00
- Adobe Create Cloud: $600.00
- Ledger 3 Pack (funds, deployer, giveaway NFTs): $225.00
- Converted to ETH - deploy contract (gas): $250.00

Link to the full proposal: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-169-beyond-the-swamp-bimonthly-apecoin-yuga-labs-focused-magazine-nft/9608
label: neutral

text:
1. The proposed compensation for a **Program Manager** is $100 per hour (estimated $24K per quarter at 20 hours per week).

2. The compensation for a **Domain Allocator** is $80 per hour (estimated $14.4K per quarter at 15 hours/week per domain allocator). This role requires significant expertise and time commitment due to the volume of proposals received and activities such as marketing, project research, calls with proposers, preparing reviews, exchanging info/feedback with other DAs, tracking teams progress, and coordinating milestone-based payouts.

3. **Questbook** will charge 3% of all disbursals made through it as a product fee. This fee is designed to align incentives with delivering value rather than just product usage. The domain allocators and program manager will be required to track their hours and provide weekly reports accessible to the community. Unused funds from each domain will be returned back to the treasury after two quarters if there are fewer grant requests or smaller grant amount requests for a particular domain.

The proposed budget represents the maximum amount needed to ensure the success of the program and avoid frequent community ratification for budgets. The unused fund from every domain will be returned back to the treasury after two quarters, and the proposed spend per quarter is expected to remain constant.

This proposal can be found at: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-252-funding-grant-proposals-using-delegated-domain-allocation/11862
label: neutral

text:

The estimated cost for building, deploying, and maintaining ApeChain for one year is $200,000 USD, with no payments going to Polygon Labs or its affiliates. Instead, these expenses will be used to pay Gateway.fm and cover infrastructure costs. The DAO will decide on funding and maintenance of ApeChain in subsequent years through negotiations with Gateway.fm, contract extensions, or community proposals from experts willing to contribute to ApeChain's maintenance.

The full proposal can be found at this link: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-368-apechain-a-zk-powered-polygon-layer-2-to-support-apecoin-growth/19308. In summary, ApeCoin DAO aims to build a scalable and secure blockchain infrastructure using Polygon Architecture to support its growth and drive culture forward in the metaverse. The estimated cost for one year is $200,000 USD, with potential future funding decisions made by the DAO.

text:
The proposal aims to create ApeSwap, a decentralized exchange (DEX) built on the ApeChain infrastructure, as part of the ApeCoin ecosystem. This move is intended to generate sustainable revenue for the ApeCoin DAO and increase the adoption of the ApeCoin ecosystem.

The project's budget is set at 750,000 APE coins, with the following breakdown:

1. Platform Design & Development: $340K
   - UX/UI Design
   - Tokenomics & Technical Architecture
   - Smart Contract Development & Testing
   - Front-end Development & Integration
   - Back-End Development for Farming Rewards and Charting/Analytics
   - Trading Alerts Features
   - Smart Contract Audits (Internal & 3rd Party)

2. Marketing, Business Development, and Operations: $120K
   - Business Development & Partnerships
   - Marketing & Community Engagement
   - Operations & Miscellaneous

3. Legal & Compliance: $100K
   - Comprehensive legal support and compliance assurance to navigate the regulatory landscape effectively.

4. Infrastructure & Miscellaneous Costs: $190K
   - Hosting Costs
   - Blockchain Indexing/Data Storage
   - Contingency Fund
   - 1-Year Maintenance (Included to ensure ongoing support and updates for the platform)

The plan includes an airdrop or token allocation to ApeCoin holders, the ApeCoin DAO treasury, Sushi Treasury, xSushi holders, team, and rewards for liquidity provision. The details are still fluid and will be solidified over time. Users will need to connect to a site/platform to claim these tokens.

The goal is to create a self-sustaining, cash-flow generative addition to the ApeCoin ecosystem while capturing value that a competitor on ApeChain would otherwise take. The hope is that revenue from the DEX will be sufficient to maintain all operations and maintenance expenses post the initial 1-year term.

The AIP implementation is administered by the Ape Foundation, and any material deviations from the plan will be disclosed to the APE holder community. For more details, you can refer to the full proposal at this link: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-405-resubmission-apeswap-on-apechain/22330
label: neutral

text:
The Governance Working Group (GWG) has outlined its continued commitment to managing the day-to-day operations of the ApeCoin DAO, including AIP processing, Discourse facilitation, and community rewards programs. They aim to scale their team, improve efficiency, and increase output as they expand their initiatives. The total funding request for this budget is $1,271,900 denominated in APE, with 50% of the funds allocated for education and training initiatives being withheld until a DAO-wide vote determines the program's continuation.

The proposal includes the allocation of funds for various purposes such as locking and delegating tokens to the community, distributing back into the ecosystem via small grants and reward programs, general contingency, new initiative development, community rewards, community grants, business and stakeholder development, and in-person ApeCoin DAO Working Group representation.

The APE Foundation will not be required to participate in any other areas of the proposals scope outside of releasing funds and certain steps of the AIP facilitation process. The full proposal can be found at https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-408-q2-q3-2024-governance-working-group-budget/21345. Any material deviations from an AIP, as initially approved, will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

text:
The text provided outlines a proposal called "The Banana Bill" within the ApeCoin ecosystem. This bill involves the allocation of 100 million APE for a program named "Banana Program." Here are some key points:

- Up to 65 million APE can be allocated under the Commercial Agreements Initiative in Year 1, and up to 23 million APE can be allocated under the User Incentives Initiative, with a total of 73 million APE being the maximum for the Commercial Agreements Initiative unless approved by the Special Council.
- The funds must be returned to the ApeCoin DAO treasury if not allocated within two years.
- Up to 3 million APE per year can be spent on administrative expenses, including compensation for Advisory Committee members, Program Facilitator, Strategic Accounts Manager, and other consultants or advisors.
- The Advisory Committee will oversee the Banana Program based on its Charter, and the Special Council will oversee both the Banana Program and the Advisory Committee.
- The initial Advisory Committee members, Program Facilitator, and Strategic Accounts Managers are identified in the text. The Special Council may appoint up to two more Advisory Committee members so that the total number does not exceed 7.
- An endorsement by a majority of the Advisory Committee is required for funds allocation under the User Incentive Initiative or Commercial Agreement Initiative, and the Special Council cannot veto it unless in limited, objective circumstances.
- Within 30 days of the Banana Bill passing, the Advisory Committee must submit its Charter for approval by the Special Council, and the Special Council will publish the Banana Program Rules.
- Each quarter during the two-year term, a transparency report will be published detailing the APE allocated under both initiatives and commercial agreements entered into.
- The APE Foundation may structure the execution of the Banana Program as necessary under applicable law.

The full proposal can be found at this link: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-454-the-banana-bill-apes-gotta-eat/24367
label: neutral

text:
The table shows the price ranges for various cryptocurrencies grouped by their stability type (Stable or Non-Stable) and the number of coins (2, 3, 4, or 5).

For Stable Coins, the prices range from $24,000 to $160,000 for 2 coins, $80,000 to $160,000 for 3 coins, $160,000 to $320,000 for 4 coins, and $800,000 to $1,600,000 for 5 coins. The Stable Coins included are TUSD, USDC, BUSD, USDT, and DAI.

For Non-Stable Coins, the prices range from $45,000 to $90,000 for 2 coins, $150,000 to $300,000 for 3 coins, $300,000 to $600,000 for 4 coins, and $1,500,000 to $3,000,000 for 5 coins. The Non-Stable Coins included are BETH, ETH, BTCB, BNB.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal by Venus for Messari to write quarterly research reports about Venus Protocol's developments and changes. This initiative aims to provide more information to builders, entrepreneurs, and investors, thereby enhancing their understanding of the project fundamentals. These reports will be free resources available on Messari, distributed through various channels including Thomson Reuters, S&P Global, Bloomberg, and Messari's newsletter. The rationale behind this is to address the challenge of staying informed in the crypto ecosystem, which can lead to misallocation of resources due to lack of comprehensive knowledge. Venus plans to fund these reports through its DAO Operation Fund at no extra cost to XVS holders or Venus Treasury.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses DeFi lending protocols that use token rewards to attract users but this can negatively impact token prices due to high emission rates. It suggests reducing emissions could positively affect the token price and provide growth opportunities, especially in unfavorable market conditions. A proposed solution is a reduction of XVS emissions by 50% on supply and borrow markets and removal of XVS emissions for SXP. The link provided offers further details on this proposal.
label: neutral

Key upgrades include Isolated Markets Integration, Stable Rate Borrowing, DEX Integration, new Risk Management, VAI Stability Fee, updated Governance Process, Tokenomics V3, and Venus Bonds to cover shortfall. The proposal requires community approval and further details can be found in the provided link. Overall, the sentiment is optimistic and forward-looking regarding the proposed upgrades for the Venus Protocol.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses Gauntlet's recommendations to optimize risk and capital efficiency for the Venus protocol. Recommendations include reducing the BNB Collateral Factor from 80% to 75%, increasing borrow caps for BCH from 4,331 to 7,000, and increasing borrow caps for FIL from 122,200 to 180,000. The text explains that these adjustments aim to maintain overall risk tolerance while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. It also mentions potential liquidation risks associated with lowering the collateral factor of BNB and provides supporting data on top borrowers and borrow usage. The text encourages the community to view Gauntlet's Venus Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Venus. Overall, the sentiment is informative and focused on risk management and optimization.
label: neutral

text:
The text proposes a revision to the tokenomics of the Venus Protocol to optimize income distribution, focusing on a more equitable split between rewards and treasury reserves. Key changes include:
- Increasing protocol reserve revenue allocation to 40% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserve, 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback), and 10% Venus Prime Token Program
- Adjusting liquidation and product development distribution to 50% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserves, and 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback)
- Doubling XVS vault legacy rewards from 525 XVS/Day to 1050 XVS/Day
- Adjusting Venus Prime program rewards from 20% of accumulated product revenues to 10%
- The changes aim to increase treasury reserves, maintain sustainable reward emission rates, and sustain attractive APYs for XVS Vault stakers. The proposal is based on an analysis of the existing tokenomics, past changes, and market trends. The estimated savings from two rounds of 50% XVS emissions reduction will be used to enhance rewards without affecting the token emission rate. The proposed revisions are expected to benefit the Venus ecosystem by ensuring a fairer income distribution and enhancing platform sustainability.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal by OpenZeppelin for a Security Partnership with Venus Protocol, offering continuous security audits on retainer. The proposed audits include new Liquidator contract, Diamond Comptroller, Automatic allocation of income and Prime contract, and Automated Treasury Management. Over the next 6 months, OpenZeppelin will provide a total of 24 weeks of security research time for these audits, with a cost of $554,400 to be paid in USDC from the Venus treasury. OpenZeppelin is a leading blockchain infrastructure security firm, known for their work with industry leaders like Coinbase and Ethereum Foundation. The partnership aims to improve Venus's smart contract security and provide ongoing security advisory on Web3 best practices.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a proposal by RedStone to integrate their price feeds into the Oracle module of Venus, enhancing security and enabling support for more assets in future isolated pools. The proposed benefits include customizable parameters, transparency in data sources, and reduced infrastructure maintenance burden on Venus. For further details, readers are directed to RedStone's publications on the Venus Community Forum. Overall sentiment: Positive and informative.

text: The text presents a proposal for Venus Protocol to deploy on Polygon zkEVM, a scalable Layer 2 protocol. The deployment is expected to enhance user experience and risk management features, capitalize on Ethereum smart contract compatibility, and benefit from Polygon's scalability features. Incentives include a $100,000 MATIC grant and additional rewards at specific TVL milestones. The proposal aims to leverage the Polygon ecosystem, marketing support, and access to a large community of builders. The legal entity supporting this proposal is Polygon Labs Services (Switzerland) AG. No existing financial or contractual relationships are disclosed between Polygon Labs and Venus's legal entities. The deployment on Polygon zkEVM is considered to pose minimal risks due to its Ethereum Layer 2 nature and previous audits.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes increasing the steepness of the interest rate curve for a digital asset named VAI, aiming to keep its value close to $1. This is achieved by making it costly to borrow VAI when its price is low and offering better rates when it's at $1. The proposed changes involve reducing the baseRate from 4% to 3%, and increasing the floatRate from 225% to 4000%. However, these modifications do not currently enable VAI borrowings, which will be enabled in a future update subject to certain conditions. The potential risks include reduced earnings if VAI stays at $1 and possible decreases in VAI borrowings and Total Value Locked (TVL) due to the increased borrow rate.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal for cross-chain deployment of Venus Protocol to Arbitrum One. Arbitrum is highlighted as a leading Layer 2 solution with advantages such as high TVL (Total Value Locked), number of dApp integrations, gas efficiency, and computational capacity due to the Nitro upgrade. The text suggests that deploying on Arbitrum could offer benefits for Venus Finance's ongoing product development in 2023. The full details can be found on the Venus Community Forum. Overall sentiment: Positive (Proposal for cross-chain deployment of Venus Protocol to a highly regarded Layer 2 solution, Arbitrum One.)
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to reduce emissions of XVS tokens in the Venus Protocol by 75%, shifting towards an organic reward system based on protocol revenues. This change aims to mitigate inflationary pressures, promote long-term user engagement, and ensure the protocol's financial sustainability. The new system is expected to drive user demand while reducing dependency on frequent token emissions, ultimately supporting the protocol's growth and market position.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to implement a "Force Liquidation" mechanism for the BUSD market within the Venus platform. This action aims to liquidate borrow positions holding BUSD, returning the liquidated BUSD to the Venus Core Pool and enabling users to redeem their supplied BUSD. The motivation behind this is to address millions of outstanding borrowed BUSD that have not been repaid despite high APYs, in anticipation of Paxos discontinuing its support for BUSD in February 2024. The text also mentions ongoing efforts to wind down the BUSD market and provides links for further discussion and implementation details. Overall, it suggests a community-approved plan to manage outstanding borrowed BUSD positions within the Venus platform.
label: neutral

text:
The text discusses a proposal by LayerZero for integration with the Venus protocol in three phases:

1. Adoption of LayerZero's OFT standard for Venus' stablecoin VAI and governance token XVS, enabling seamless cross-chain token movement and wider distribution.
2. Integration of a cross-chain governance module powered by LayerZero, allowing the Venus DAO to aggregate votes from multiple chains and execute decisions efficiently.
3. Realization of an omnichain money market vision, allowing users to borrow against collateral located on other chains, further enhancing Venus' innovative status in DeFi.

The sentiment is generally positive, indicating excitement about the potential benefits and opportunities that this integration could bring to both LayerZero and the Venus protocol.

text:
The text discusses the proposal for PLANET token to be listed on the Isolated Lending Market of Venus, highlighting its potential value addition due to its innovative approach and strong market position. PLANET ReFi is a pioneering project in the realm of #ReFi, partnering with global celebrities to introduce Real-World Assets (RWAs) to Web3. It aims to disrupt the $300 billion Green Tech Market by leveraging the Amazon flywheel revenue model and creating a sustainable revenue stream while fostering social change.

The native token of PLANET ReFi, $PLANET, is in the top 10% across several categories, including trading volumes, social engagement, market cap, and token activity. It has gained significant community support and partnerships with major platforms like BNB Chain, Binance Oracle, Uniswap, Pancake Swap, etc., and is listed on various CEXs.

The benefits of listing PLANET on Venus include the flexibility for suppliers to diversify their accumulation strategies by migrating deposited liquidity from Ethereum and BNB Chain. The potential transfer could stem from significant sources such as CEX, single staking, Uniswap LP (Eth/Planet), Pancakeswap LP (BNB/Planet) and Cake Syrup Pool, among others.

To incentivize the listing, Planet ReFi will offer $PLANET token incentives to increase rewards and attract more users to the Venus Platform. The text concludes by providing essential details such as ERC20 and BEP20 tokens, market cap, and website link for further information.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a collaboration between Messari Protocol Services and Venus, where Messari will provide quarterly research and reporting services to Venus. This is intended to enhance transparency and attract stakeholders. Messari is a data analytics company for Web3, with two main units: Messari Enterprise (SaaS) and Messari Protocol Services (open-source data infrastructure). The proposal outlines funding for research, data science and engineering, and distribution of the reports. The total cost is $95,000, including four quarterly reports and an annual enterprise license. The link provided contains further details about the proposal.
label: neutral

text:
The text discusses a proposal to deploy the Venus Protocol on the Ethereum Mainnet, citing Ethereum's high liquidity and capital as a key reason for this decision. The proposal also suggests listing Curve tokens as collateral on Ethereum, offering rewards for Venus community members, Curve ecosystem, and Ethereum as a whole.

The rationale behind the proposal includes filling the gap in lending protocols on Ethereum Mainnet, increasing visibility and brand awareness for Venus Protocol, and enhancing adoption of Curve's stablecoin, crvUSD. The plan outlines details for core pools, isolated pools, liquidity mining incentives, and the creation of pools on Curve.

The proposal further suggests creating various pools on Curve to facilitate liquidity for Venus assets and collaborating with Curve to create beneficial pools for all parties involved. Lastly, it highlights the importance of obtaining a gauge for the curve pool, which would grant voting rights to veCRV or other veCRV liquid token owners.

In summary, the proposal aims to deploy Venus on Ethereum Mainnet, list Curve tokens, incentivize liquidity providers, and collaborate with Curve to create beneficial pools for the Venus community, Curve ecosystem, and broader Ethereum network. The sentiment appears optimistic and collaborative.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes to list the stablecoin FDUSD in Venus Core pool due to its established presence in the BNBChain DeFi ecosystem, 1:1 backing, active reserve management, and monthly attestations. The addition of FDUSD is expected to bring stability, increased liquidity, broader adoption, and a safe haven for users. It aligns with Venus goals of offering a robust, user-friendly, ever-growing DeFi platform. Proposed parameters include a collateral factor of 75%, an initial supply cap of 5,500,000 FDUSD, and IR curve settings similar to major stablecoins on the Venus Core pool. Initial incentives are suggested at 10 XVS/Day.
label: bullish

text: The text proposes a plan to reduce the BTC and ETH debt of an exploiter on the BNB Chain by allowing external providers to repay the debts through a MoveDebtDelegate contract. This contract will borrow equivalent amounts of BTC or ETH from the providers and send them to the external providers as compensation. The BNB liquidity is maintained, and another whitelisted liquidator manages the exploiter's account. The exploiter will carry additional debt in other markets. There is no economic incentive for interacting with the MoveDebtDelegate contract as the received USDT, USDC, BTC, or ETH are equivalent to the provided BTC according to Venus oracles.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the progress and achievements of Venus Protocol in DeFi innovation, security, integrations, and community contributions. Key offerings include Isolated Lending, an multichain XVS bridge, Venus Prime, Resilient Price Oracle, Peg Stability Module for VAI, Reward Distributor, and rapid governance execution. The development team is composed of experienced professionals from global banks, technology firms, and web3 companies. Venus Protocol is the most security audited protocol in its category, the most revenue performant lending protocol in DeFi per $ of TVL, and ascended to be the most highly rated lending protocol in security across nearly every category. The team seeks reimbursement for expenses in Q2, Q3, and Q4 of 2023 totaling $2,100,253.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to add support for wstETH (a wrapped version of stETH) in Venus Protocol, rather than both stETH and wstETH due to the complexity associated with stETH as a rebasing token. The rationale provided is that wstETH is well-established and more composable with DeFi protocols. Integrating wstETH into Venus Protocol would allow users to earn lending APY on their staked ETH holdings, increase liquidity and trading volume, and provide a wider range of investment opportunities.

text: The text proposes a strategy to address Venus platform's outstanding debts by transferring significant bad debt from current debtors to the BNB bridge exploiter account, amounting to approximately $34.7M. This move aims to liquidate the outstanding debts and improve the platform's overall financial health. The plan involves upgrading certain contracts and temporarily increasing the collateral factor of BNB above 100%. After execution, the BNB bridge exploiter's total debt will increase, but the listed debts from current debtors will be removed. The proposed action can potentially improve the health rate of the BNB bridge exploiter to around 0.74.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a strategic plan to reduce XVS emissions by approximately 59%. This is achieved by adjusting emission levels based on two factors: Total Value Locked (TVL) and sensitivity rating. Markets with high TVL but low sensitivity, such as USDT, USDC, and CAKE, are suggested for more aggressive reduction of 75%. Major assets like BTCB, BNB, and ETH will see a 50% reduction. Assets with low TVL, including ADA, XRP, and LINK, will have complete emission reduction due to their minimal impact on protocol reserves. VAI emissions will be reduced by 50%. The goal is to lower total daily emissions from around 502 XVS to 205 XVS.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses an update by PancakeSwap to a governance model (veCAKE design) that offers voting rights and yield boosting benefits. They propose a collaboration with Venus to direct more CAKE emissions towards the XVS-BNB pool in exchange for incentives, aiming to boost rewards for liquidity providers and strengthen their relationship. The proposal includes a bribe offer by Venus's treasury to secure voting support from Cakepie holders.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal by RedStone, a rapidly growing Oracle provider, to expand its partnership with Venus. text:
In the "Unlimited Sale" format for the Duelist King Initial Farm Offering (IFO), participants are required to have CAKE-BNB LP tokens to participate. The participation fee starts at 1% and decreases in cliffs based on the overflow from the "Unlimited" portion of the sale. The final USD price per CAKE-BNB LP token will be set a few minutes before the sale, which is scheduled for October 27th, 2021.

The total number of tokens available in this format will account for 70% of the total sale. If the full $437,500 USD allocation is raised, at least $218,750 USD worth of CAKE tokens will be burned forever.

After the IFO, a Syrup Pool and Farm for Duelist King (DKT) will be running. The Syrup Pool will distribute 170,000 DKT over a duration of 60 days, starting approximately on October 27th, 2021. The Farm will offer 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and then 1x CAKE rewards thereafter.

Please note that all projects come with high market risk and volatility, so it is advised to do thorough research and due diligence before investing funds in any project. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.

The project details include the website (<https://duelistking.com/>), Initial Circulating Supply (9.15% DKT from an initial supply of 10,000,000 DKT), Token Contract Address (to be provided by the project team closer to the IFO date), and completed audits (also to be provided by the project team closer to the IFO date).

The project can be followed on Twitter (<https://twitter.com/duelistkingnft>) and Telegram (EN: <https://t.me/DuelistKingNFT>), with more information available on their blog (<https://medium.com/duelist-king>).

text:
The text discusses a proposal for creating a decentralized finance (DeFi) options market on the PancakeSwap platform to hedge against liquidity pool impermanent loss and short selling risks. Proponents argue that this would provide users with risk management tools, generate additional profit for option writers, increase utility for the platform's native token CAKE, and potentially expand into a new innovative market segment.

However, opponents raise concerns about the complexity of option pricing, smart contract risks, dilution of the platform, and lack of user acceptance for options as a financial instrument. They also highlight the need for extensive research, auditing, and user-friendly design to make the product accessible to the user base. The text suggests exploring various approaches for implementing an options marketplace on PancakeSwap, such as Uniswap-style pools or centralized orderbooks.

text: The text proposes a new cryptocurrency, the "supercake coin" (scake), with a maximum limit of 300 million units. To create one scake, 40 cakes are combined and 40 cakes are burned. Achieving the total supply of 300 million scake requires creating 12 billion cakes, which equates to approximately 85 years of nonstop cake burn at a rate of 386,000 per day. text:
The text suggests that the author is critical of PancakeSwap (PCS) for its current strategies, particularly its promotion of Binance Coin (BNB) over Cake (CAKE). The author recommends that PCS should stop using BNB for predictions and start promoting CAKE instead. They also suggest that PCS needs to expand its operations beyond the Binance Smart Chain (BSC), as other platforms have already adopted a multi-chain approach.

The author is concerned about the speed of the PCS website, the need for PCS to own part of liquidity and strengthen its treasury for development, and the high inflationary pressure due to CAKE emissions. They also advise PCS to focus on its core services such as Launchpad, Initial Farm Offerings (IFO), farming, etc., rather than pursuing trends like Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs). Lastly, they propose that only CAKE pairs should be paid in CAKE, and other pairs should be rewarded with their native tokens.

In summary, the author is advocating for PCS to make significant changes in its strategies, focusing on expanding its use cases, improving its utility, and reducing inflationary pressure to ensure the long-term success of CAKE.
label: neutral

Wolfible is an NFT platform that aims to create a fluid environment for easy and affordable NFT creation. To learn more, visit the project's official channels. The text also includes instructions on how to join the IFO on PancakeSwap. Overall, the sentiment of the text is informative and promotional about the Wolfible Token and its associated platform.

text:
The text discusses Konstellation Network's application for a Syrup Pool on PancakeSwap and encourages CAKE holders to vote "yes" for the proposal. Konstellation is a decentralized cross-chain capital markets protocol built on Cosmos, aiming to create a single interface for interacting with leading DeFi protocols across various blockchain networks. The network's native token, DARC, is required for governance and transactions within the Konstellation ecosystem.

   To incentivize participation, Konstellation offers 5 DARC tokens for every CAKE submitted in favor of the syrup pool application. Additional information about Konstellation can be found on their official channels, including their website, whitepaper, Medium, Twitter, Telegram, and VegaX platform.

After the IFO, there will be a Syrup Pool and Farm for DPT, where users can stake CAKE tokens to earn DPT rewards. The official channels for the project include its website, Medium, Twitter, announcement channel on Telegram, and official Telegram group. text:
The sale consists of two sessions: the Basic Sale and the Unlimited Sale, each with different contribution limits and fees.

1. **Basic Sale**: This session allows a maximum contribution of $100 equivalent in CAKE tokens per person. The final allocation is subject to the total amount raised in this session, but there are no whale participants.

2. **Unlimited Sale**: As the name suggests, this session has no limits on the amount each person can contribute. However, a participation fee of 1% is charged, which decreases based on the overflow from the "Unlimited" portion of the sale. The final price per CAKE token will be announced before the sale starts.

Additionally, there will be a Syrup Pool and Farm for FROYO after the IFO. The Syrup Pool will distribute 5,000,000 FROYO tokens over 60 days, and the Farm will offer 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and then 1x CAKE rewards.

Please beware of potential scams and always verify the token address before buying tokens. The official token contract address is provided in the text.

text:
The text provides information about an Initial Farm Offering (IFO) for a token called ERA on the Binance Smart Chain network. The IFO consists of two sessions: a Private Sale and a Public Sale.

The Private Sale, also known as the "Whitelist Sale," is only open to selected participants with a participation fee and a maximum allocation subject to the total amount raised in that session.

The Public Sale, on the other hand, is open to all participants but comes with a 1% participation fee that decreases based on the percentage of overflow from the Public Sale. Users can subscribe as much as they want during this session, and their final allocation will be based on the amount of funds they put in compared to other participants.

The text also mentions rewards for staking CAKE tokens in a Syrup Pool and Farm after the IFO, with details such as token distribution duration, start and finish times, and maximum stake per wallet.

Additionally, the text provides links to official project channels, warnings about potential scams, and information about audits of the token contract address.

text:
The article provides information about the DUET Initial Farm Offering (IFO) on PancakeSwap, a decentralized exchange on the Binance Smart Chain.

The private sale of DUET tokens is limited to a maximum contribution of $200 per user, with the final allocation subject to the total amount raised in this session. The public sale, which makes up 90% of the sale allocation, is open to all participants but comes with a participation fee that starts at 1%. This fee decreases based on the percentage of overflow from the Public Sale.

Users can subscribe as much as they want during the Public Sale, and their final allocation will be determined by the amount of funds they put in relative to other users' contributions when the sale ends. Any leftover funds will be returned to participants after claiming their tokens.

After the IFO, there will be a Syrup Pool and Farm for DUET. The Syrup Pool will distribute 840,000 DUET tokens over 60 days, with a maximum stake of 100 CAKE tokens for the first 5 days. After that, unlimited CAKE staking is allowed. To participate in the IFO Syrup Pool during the first 5 days, users need an active PancakeSwap Profile.

A DUET-CAKE farm will also be created to host the Syrup Pool, with 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter, 1x CAKE rewards.

The official channels for learning more about DUET include its website, Medium, Twitter, Telegram, and Discord. It is advised to verify the token address before buying tokens to avoid scams. Audits have been conducted by PeckShield and BlockSec, with results expected to be posted by Era7 next week.

A disclaimer reminds readers that all projects are subject to high market risk and volatility, and they should research before investing their funds. Buy with caution, as PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.
label: neutral

text:
The summary of the two different sale sessions is as follows:

1. Private Sale: This session requires participants to own a Pancake Squad bunny and set it as their Pancake Profile avatar. The maximum amount of funds that can be committed per user is $300. The total allocation for this session is $360,000, which represents 20% of the total sale allocation.

2. Public Sale: This session is open to all participants. However, there is a participation fee of 0.5%, which decreases in cliffs based on the percentage of overflow from the Public Sale. The total allocation for this session is $1,440,000, representing 80% of the total sale allocation.

Additional details include:
- A Syrup Pool where participants can stake CAKE tokens to earn DUET tokens. The total tokens for distribution are 840,000 DUET over a duration of 60 days.
- A DUET-CAKE farm will be hosted after the IFO, with 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter, 1x CAKE rewards.
- The final price per CAKE token will be set a few minutes before the sale.
- Participants are advised to beware of potential scams and always verify the token address before buying tokens.
- Audits have been conducted by PeckShield and BlockSec.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposed tokenomics structure for a cryptocurrency named "cake." The author suggests a hard cap of 500 million tokens, with a weekly buyback and burn mechanism to maintain a minimum supply of 300 million. text:
PEEL and SHELL are tokens distributed through Syrup Pools on the PancakeSwap platform, a decentralized exchange (DEX) built on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC). Here's a summary of each:

1. **PEEL**:
   - Total Supply: 7,500,000 PEEL
   - Distribution Duration: 60 days
   - Start Time: Shortly after the Initial Farm Offering (IFO) ends
   - End Time: Approximately 60 days after Syrup Pool launch
   - Token rewards per block: 4.340 PEEL
   - Max Stake per Wallet: 100 CAKE for the first 5 days, then unlimited thereafter
   - Requirement for first 5 days: An active PancakeSwap Profile

2. **SHELL**:
   - Total Supply: 155,000,000 SHELL
   - Distribution Duration: 60 days
   - Start Time: Shortly after the IFO ends
   - End Time: Approximately 60 days after Syrup Pool launch
   - Token rewards per block: 89.699 SHELL
   - Max Stake per Wallet: 100 CAKE for the first 5 days, then unlimited thereafter (no requirement thereafter)

To incentivize liquidity provision, PancakeSwap will create PEEL-BUSD and SHELL-BUSD farms with specific CAKE rewards. The PEEL-BUSD farm will have 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and 1x thereafter, while the SHELL-BUSD farm will have 0.5x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and 0.1x thereafter.

For more information about the projects, visit their official channels:
- Website: https://metaapesgame.com/
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetaApesGame
- Discord: https://discord.gg/metaapesgame
- Medium: https://medium.com/@metaapesgame
- Bridging Instructions: https://bit.ly/MetaApesBridge
- Download Game: [iOS](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/meta-apes/id1621913848) and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mkbanana.gp).

Please beware of potential scams, as PEEL tokens will not be available for trading before or during the IFO. Always verify the token address before buying tokens. If you receive a PEEL or SHELL token airdrop from another address, it's probably a scam. The audit report can be found [here](https://metaapesgame.com/audit.pdf).

Disclaimer: All projects are subject to high market risk and volatility. Please do your own research and buy with caution. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.

text:
1. To own a Pancake Squad NFT, you can participate in the Private Sale or Public Sale of the PancakeSwap platform.

2. In the Private Sale, the maximum amount of funds that can be committed per user is $1250 and the final allocation received will depend on the total amount raised during this session.

3. The Public Sale is open to all but comes with a participation fee which will be fully burned. There's also an overflow multiplier for the WOM IFO.

4. The WOM Syrup Pool allows users to stake CAKE tokens to earn WOM. The total tokens are 6,000,000 WOM and the distribution duration is 60 days. For the first 5 days, you need an active PancakeSwap Profile to stake in the IFO Syrup Pool. After that, there's no requirement for a PancakeSwap Profile.

5. There will also be a WOM-BUSD farm with 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter, 1x CAKE rewards. The rewards will be removed at the end of the 60-day period unless certain metrics are comparable to other farms.

6. To learn more about the project, you can visit their official channels which include their website, Twitter, Discord, Telegram, Docs, Medium, and audit reports from Hacken, Peckshield, and Zokyo.

7. Be aware of potential scams as WOM tokens will not be available for trading before or during the IFO. Always verify the token address before buying tokens. If you receive a WOM token airdrop from another address, it's probably a scam.

8. A disclaimer is given that all projects are subject to high market risk and volatility. Please do your own research and buy with caution. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.

text:
The provided text explains two different sale sessions for a project called HOOP:

1. **Private Sale**: This session is exclusive to users who have accumulated at least 800 points (subject to change in the future). The maximum amount of funds that can be committed per user is $1,000. The final allocation received will depend on the total amount raised during this session.

2. **Public Sale**: This sale is open to all participants but comes with a participation fee that will be fully burned. There's also an overflow multiplier fee structure for the HOOP cIFO.

The text further explains two additional features:

- **The HOOP Syrup Pool**: A staking pool where users can stake CAKE tokens to earn HOOP tokens. The total number of HOOP tokens is 3,710,000 and the distribution period lasts for 60 days. For the first 5 days, users need an active PancakeSwap profile to participate. After that, there's no such requirement.

- **The HOOP Farm**: A farm hosting a HOOP-BUSD pair with increased rewards for the first 2 days, followed by decreased rewards for the subsequent 5 days and then further reduced rewards. The rewards will be adjusted to 0.1x at the end of the 60-day period unless certain metrics (average daily volume, 14-day volume, unique token holders on BNB Chain, and no fundamental token issues) are comparable with other farms.

The text also provides links to the project's official channels for more information and a warning about potential scams related to the HOOP token.
label: neutral

text: This text outlines a three-step governance process for modifying the roadmap development and definition: Temperature Check, Consensus Check, and Governance Proposal. The Temperature Check determines if there's enough support to change the status quo through a majority vote with a 50k CAKE threshold. If no change is suggested, the topic is closed. If it is, proceed to the Consensus Check. This stage incorporates feedback from the Temperature Check and establishes formal discussion around a potential proposal, requiring another off-chain vote with a 100k CAKE yes-vote threshold. The final step is the Governance Proposal, which should incorporate feedback from the Consensus Check, includes executable on-chain code, requires a delegate with at least 2m CAKE to submit, and has a voting period of 7 days with a 40m CAKE yes-vote threshold. Threshold values may vary over time depending on Circulating Supply.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Explanation of the 2 Different Sale Sessions for Kingdom Raids (KRS) Initial Farm Offering (cIFO)

   Summary: The Kingdom Raids (KRS) cIFO consists of a Private Sale and a Public Sale, each with different requirements and allocation percentages. The Private Sale is exclusive to Pancake Squad NFT owners or those with 800 points, with a maximum commitment of $800 per user. The Public Sale is open to all participants but requires a participation fee that will be burned. The KRS Syrup Pool and Farm are also introduced for staking CAKE tokens to earn KRS and participating in a KRS-BUSD farm respectively.

   Key Points:
   - Private Sale: Requirements: Pancake Squad NFT ownership or 800 points; Maximum commitment: $800 per user; Allocation: 40% of total sale allocation.
   - Public Sale: Open to all participants with a participation fee; Allocation: 60% of total sale allocation.
   - KRS Syrup Pool: Total tokens: 8,571,429 KRS; Distribution duration: 60 days; Start time: After cIFO ends; Finish time: Approx. 60 days after Syrup Pool launch; Max Stake per Wallet: 100 CAKE for the first 5 days, then unlimited thereafter (cap to enable high APY); Requirement for first 5 days: Active PancakeSwap Profile; No requirement thereafter.
   - KRS Farm: Hosting a KRS-BUSD farm with 1x CAKE rewards for the first 2 days, then 0.5x CAKE rewards thereafter; Rewards adjusted to 0.1x at the end of the 60-day period unless comparable with other farms in terms of volume and unique token holders on BNB Chain.
   - Official channels for more information: Website, Twitter, Discord, Telegram, YouTube, Medium, Verichains Audits.
   - Warning: Be cautious as all projects are subject to high market risk and volatility; Always verify the token address before buying tokens; Any other KRS token will be a scam and may result in financial loss.
label: neutral

The text outlines a long-term strategy for PancakeSwap, focusing solely on DeFi to increase trust, attract more and larger investors, and boost the utility of CAKE. Key components include:
1. Eliminating the lottery and reallocating rewards to staking pools over a 30-year period, increasing demand for CAKE and attracting real DeFi investors.
2. Establishing a treasury (CakeTreasury) to help the community in emergencies and for development purposes, using 25% of burnt CAKE and fees from the treasury. This aims to protect CAKE from inflation and increase its utility.
3. Adding staking pools for coins like BTC, ETH, etc., allowing users to stake these coins and receive rewards in the same coins while paying fees in CAKE. The APR for well-established coins will be up to 5%, potentially growing the CAKE community by appealing to big investors from other crypto communities.

The CSIX Syrup Pool has a duration of 120 days, starting approximately on February 17, 2023, with a total reward of 30,000,000 CSIX tokens. The farm will offer varying CAKE rewards during this period. $CSIX powers the Carbon ecosystem and grants holders voting rights in the Governance DAO. text:
Hooked is a community-driven Web3 platform with over 250,000 KOC nodes (Key Opinion Contributors). The members actively invite new members to the community. To facilitate onboarding developers and applications into the world of Web3, Hooked is developing middlewares such as one-login DID solution, built-in wallet infrastructure, and social graph integrated interface.

   The platform aims to achieve massive user adoption through gamified learning and onboarding. It will provide a marketplace where community members can connect with applications/businesses, and resource allocation efficiency is maximized with consolidation of on-chain data and assets.

   Hooked's infrastructure includes Rollup applicability as the base layer to consolidate all ecosystem assets and data, ensuring fast and scalable blockchain infrastructure.

   The tokenomics of Hooked prioritizes liquidity and utility while maintaining stability and long-term sustainability. It uses a single token (HOOK) for governance and a utility token (HGT - Hooked Gold Token) within the ecosystem. HGT is non-liquidable, but an unlocking mechanism (uHGT) is applied to ensure sustainability.

   HOOK, the only liquid governance token in the ecosystem, reflects the value of the Hooked protocol and has limited supply with a scheduled emission scheme. Its long-term value is tied to the confidence people hold for the project.

   HGT, on the other hand, is an in-ecosystem utility token that incentivizes and motivates community contributions. It is used for community governance, gas tokens for platform on-chain activities, staking incentives as holding rewards, social elements demonstrations with status signaling and individuality, and for long-range objectives, valuable innovations contributing to the ecosystem thriving.

   In addition, HOOK will be used as the gas token for all economic activities in the Hooked Application Rollup, access token for exclusive NFTs and privileges of community events, and will be put into innovation practices that benefit both individual participants and businesses.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses proposed emission reductions for CAKE token on both BNB Chain and Ethereum, aiming to make CAKE emission neutral or deflationary. The reduction is expected to be 45% on BNB Chain and 32% overall. This change is due to the launch of v3 on both chains, which offers increased capital efficiency for liquidity providers, generating more trading fees organically. The text also highlights that v3 has already attracted significant TVL and trading volumes on both chains, making PancakeSwap a top 10 DEX on Ethereum. The reductions may result in reduced CAKE APR earned by liquidity providers on v2, but overall trading volumes have increased since the launch of v3. text:
1. Peer-to-peer (P2P): Refers to systems that allow individuals to interact directly with each other without the need for a third party, such as a bank. In the context of Bitcoin, this means that users broadcast their transactions to one another, creating a decentralized network.

2. Private Key: A secret piece of data that allows you to spend bitcoins from a specific wallet by providing a cryptographic signature. It is stored on your computer if you use a software wallet or on remote servers for web wallets. Keeping it private is essential because it grants the ability to spend bitcoins associated with the respective Bitcoin wallet.

3. Proof of Work (PoW): The output of any efforts to mine Bitcoin, such as the time and computational power spent hashing a block in the Bitcoin blockchain. A hash block can be considered proof of work.

4. Public Key: A string of digits and letters that serves as your Bitcoin address. When combined with a private key through hashing, it digitally signs online communication.

5. Satoshi: The smallest unit of Bitcoin, equivalent to 0.00000001 BTC or one hundred millionth of a Bitcoin.

6. Output: In the context of a Bitcoin transaction, the destination address used in the transaction.

7. Paper Wallet: A form of cold storage for Bitcoins, where users print out a sheet of paper containing public bitcoin addresses and corresponding private keys to improve security.

8. P2P (repeated): Peer-to-peer refers to systems that allow individuals to interact directly with each other without the need for a third party, such as a bank. In the context of Bitcoin, this means that users broadcast their transactions to one another, creating a decentralized network.

9. Private Key (repeated): A secret piece of data that allows you to spend bitcoins from a specific wallet by providing a cryptographic signature. It is stored on your computer if you use a software wallet or on remote servers for web wallets. Keeping it private is essential because it grants the ability to spend bitcoins associated with the respective Bitcoin wallet.

10. Proof of Work (repeated): The output of any efforts to mine Bitcoin, such as the time and computational power spent hashing a block in the Bitcoin blockchain. A hash block can be considered proof of work.

11. Public Key (repeated): A string of digits and letters that serves as your Bitcoin address. When combined with a private key through hashing, it digitally signs online communication.

12. Satoshi (repeated): The smallest unit of Bitcoin, equivalent to 0.00000001 BTC or one hundred millionth of a Bitcoin.

13. Output (repeated): In the context of a Bitcoin transaction, the destination address used in the transaction.

14. Paper Wallet (repeated): A form of cold storage for Bitcoins, where users print out a sheet of paper containing public bitcoin addresses and corresponding private keys to improve security.
label: neutral

text:
1. The Private Sale for SABLE token is ongoing, with a maximum commitment per user of $1,000. The final allocation received will depend on the total amount raised in this session. There is no participation fee in the Private Sale.

2. The Public Sale for SABLE token will be open to all and will have a participation fee of 1%. This fee will be used to buy back and burn CAKE tokens, with more CAKE tokens being burned as the IFO becomes more oversubscribed.

3. The SABLE Syrup Pool will allow users to stake CAKE tokens to earn SABLE. The total number of SABLE tokens for the pool is 500,000 and the distribution duration is 90 days. For the first 5 days, users need an active PancakeSwap Profile to stake in the IFO Syrup Pool. After that, there is no requirement for a PancakeSwap Profile.

4. A SABLE-BNB v2 farm will also be hosted, offering 8x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter, 4x CAKE rewards. The farm may be adjusted to a lower or zero multiplier after 90 days unless certain metrics are comparable with other farms of a similar multiplier.

5. To learn more about SABLE, visit their official channels: Website, Twitter, Discord, Telegram, Medium, Docs, Audits.

6. A warning is given to beware of potential scams and always verify the token address before buying tokens. SABLE tokens will not be available for trading before or during the Initial Farm Offering (IFO). Any other SABLE token is likely a scam.

7. A disclaimer is provided stating that all projects are subject to high market risk and volatility, and investors should do their own research and buy with caution. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the role of Pi Nodes in the Pi ecosystem, which are responsible for validating transactions on a distributed ledger using a consensus algorithm based on the Stellar Consensus Protocol (SCP). The security circles from mobile miners create a global trust graph enabling Pi Nodes to form these quorum slices.

text:
1. Perpetuals (Perp) are a type of futures contract without an expiration date, allowing users to enter positions on margin using borrowed funds for leverage.

2. In PancakeSwap Perpetuals V2, the interface has been streamlined with the removal of order book and market depth displays, replaced by the ALP pool which provides liquidity for all trading pairs. The ALP pool actively participates in the market-making process for V2 perpetual contracts.

3. $ALP is a liquidity provider token on the ApolloX platform made up of assets like USDC, USDT, ETH, and BTC. Users can become liquidity providers by using these specified assets to buy ALP. The ALP pool serves as the direct counterparty for V2 on-chain perp traders.

4. The price of ALP is influenced by the profit or loss of the pool, income from trading fees, funding fees, and liquidations. ApolloX plans to support more utility for $ALP in the future, such as earning transaction fee rewards, using ALP as margin for perpetuals trading, and participation in DAO governance and voting.

5. To learn more about PancakeSwap Perpetuals V2, visit their official channels: App (https://perp.pancakeswap.finance/en/futures/v2/), Blog (https://blog.pancakeswap.finance/articles/ep-6-5-perpetuals-v2-trading-guide), Twitter (@ApolloX_Finance), Telegram (https://t.me/apolloxchange), Discord (https://discord.com/invite/q5eH3zktcm), Audits (https://apollox-finance.gitbook.io/apollox-finance/about-us/audit-reports), Dune Dashboard (https://dune.com/apollox/alp-v2-arb).

6. To stake $ALP to earn $CAKE rewards, follow this guide: https://docs.pancakeswap.finance/products/syrup-pool/syrup-pool-guide

7. Be aware of potential scams and always verify the token address before buying tokens. The official ALP token contract address on Arbitrum One is: <https://arbiscan.io/token/0xbc76b3fd0d18c7496c0b04aea0fe7c3ed0e4d9c9>
label: neutral

text:
Perpetuals or perpetual swaps are a type of futures contract without an expiration date, allowing users to trade with leverage using borrowed funds. In PancakeSwap Perpetuals V2, the ALP pool provides liquidity for all trading pairs and actively participates in the market-making process for V2 perpetual contracts. $ALP is a liquidity provider token made up of a pool of assets (USDC, USDT, DAI, ETH, BTC). Users can become liquidity providers by using any of these specified assets to buy ALP, which serves as the direct counterparty of V2 on-chain perp traders. The price of ALP is influenced by the profit or loss of the pool and income from trading fees, funding fees, and liquidations.

To learn more about PancakeSwap Perpetuals V2, visit their official channels:
- App: https://perp.pancakeswap.finance/en/futures/v2/
- Blog: https://blog.pancakeswap.finance/articles/ep-6-5-perpetuals-v2-trading-guide
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/APX_Finance
- Telegram: https://t.me/apolloxchange
- Discord: https://discord.com/invite/q5eH3zktcm
- Audits: https://apollox-finance.gitbook.io/apollox-finance/about-us/audit-reports
- Dune Dashboard: https://dune.com/apollox/alp-v2-arb

To stake $ALP to earn $CAKE rewards, follow this guide: <https://docs.pancakeswap.finance/products/perpetual-trading/perpetual-trading-v2/perpetual-trading-faq/arbitrum/alp-syrup-pool-arbitrum>

Be aware of potential scams: The official ALP token contract address on Arbitrum One is: <https://arbiscan.io/token/0xbc76b3fd0d18c7496c0b04aea0fe7c3ed0e4d9c9>. Any other ALP token will be a scam, so always verify the token address before buying tokens. If you receive an ALP token airdrop from another address, its probably a scam, and we advise you to ignore it.

text: The text discusses a proposal for the allocation of CAKE tokens to Position Managers on PancakeSwap. Over the past few months, these managers have driven significant trading volume and TVL (Total Value Locked), enabling users to provide concentrated liquidity in a simplified manner. The Kitchen is requesting 20,000 CAKE for distribution among various Position Manager vaults, aiming to maximize TVL, volume, and CAKE burn. text: The text presents a proposal to modify the token whitelist process in Balancer Finance, aiming to eliminate subjective decision-making and favor technical criteria. The changes focus on protecting liquidity providers from loss of funds and the BAL distribution from centralized actors. A new cap structure is proposed for tokens based on their adjusted liquidity, with a default cap for new tokens reduced to $1M. Tokens can be removed if they are deemed malicious or gaming the BAL distribution. The proposal aims to maintain Balancer's trustless and permissionless vision while mitigating potential attacks on the BAL token distribution.
label: neutral

text:
In the given scenario, the `stakingBoost` is calculated to increase the adjusted liquidity in a desired amount ($90M in this case) by stretching or shrinking the temporary `tempStakingBoost`. The calculation involves comparing the ratio of the final liquidity adjustment (desired - pre-staking liquidity) to the temporary liquidity adjustment (temporary - pre-staking liquidity), and setting the stakingBoost equal to the product of this ratio and the temporary stakingBoost.

Shareholder addresses, which include investors, advisors, and founders of Balancer Labs, will be excluded from participating in liquidity staking to accelerate governance rights distribution. The list of these shareholder addresses can be found at [this link](https://github.com/balancer-labs/bal-mining-scripts/blob/liquidity-staking/src/users.ts). It is important to note that the exclusion only applies to their wallets related to their shareholder allocations, not any BAL they hold from other sources such as market purchases or LP rewards.

The community has agreed to tolerate up to about 10k BAL per week per shareholder being sent to centralized exchanges, acknowledging that shareholders may seek to deleverage their BAL positions over time without attempting to subvert the exclusion list. The list may be updated as needed to reflect any changes in shareholder addresses, such as those moving to third-party custody solutions or multisig wallets. The community also has the prerogative to update this list so that changes are effective before any still pending weekly distribution.
label: bullish

The proposal emphasizes MKR's role in supporting DAI, a stablecoin pegged to USD, within the MakerDAO platform, where users can generate Dai by locking collateral such as ETH, BAT, or WBTC and repay borrowed Dai with interest. text: The text proposes introducing govFactor, an on-chain voting incentive for Balancer Liquidity Providers to encourage active participation in governance. If passed, it will be implemented as a 3-month trial with voter participation acting as the key success metric. The motivation behind this is to align LPs' interests with the protocol by giving them an incentive to vote, improving overall governance participation. The govFactor multiplies BAL rewards for those who voted on the last proposal and normalizes all amounts so that the total remains the same. It operates as an "on/off" switch, affecting liquidity mining allocations. If all LPs vote, rewards remain the same. Some potential drawbacks are discussed, including non-engaged voting, opsec concerns, varying cadence of governance proposals, and the current idle state of Balancer Governance.
label: bullish

text: The text proposes a four-week pilot starting on January 25th, reimbursing up to 7,500 BAL per week for gas costs incurred during swaps performed through the Balancer Exchange Proxy. This is aimed at improving usability and reducing costs for users of the Balancer v1 exchange, with the new UI, while awaiting the launch of Balancer v2. The reimbursement mechanism will be open-source, auditable, and targeted towards transactions made directly to the Balancer Exchange Proxy, excluding most on-chain arbitrage bots. Eligible swaps are limited to specific tokens, with the gas reimbursement being the lowest of either the total gas used by the transaction or 100,000 times the number of eligible swaps in the transaction. The gas price for reimbursements will be the lowest of either the transaction's gas price or the median price of all transactions within the enclosing block. Reimbursements will be made via a MerkleRedeem contract, and claims would be available weekly. The program is funded by the Balancer Ecosystem Fund and will not affect ongoing liquidity mining or Ecosystem Fund Grants.
label: neutral

text:
1. The gas reimbursement amount depends directly on the number of eligible swaps, with 130,000 gas for one swap, 220,000 gas for two swaps, 300,000 gas for three swaps, and 400,000 gas for four or more swaps.

2. The estimated gas price is the median from the last few blocks according to the `getGasPrice()` function from the web3 provider, providing a good approximation of the actual trade block's median gas price.

3. The estimated BAL/ETH price is queried from an 80/20 BAL/WETH pool, acting as a real-time oracle and not used to compute the actual award amount.

4. The final result displayed to the user is the approximate amount of BAL to be awarded for the particular trade, assuming funds are still available in the budget, along with a USD estimate using CoinGecko's API for BAL/USD price.

5. At dispersal time, the number of eligible swaps is determined, and the gas reimbursement amount depends on this count. The actual gas price is the median from the block containing the trade, with artificially low-price transactions filtered out. The actual BAL/ETH price is queried from CoinGecko API for the time closest to the block time of the trade.

6. The only possible sources of error between the estimate and the actual award are minor: the median gas price from the last few blocks may not perfectly match the median of the trade block, and the 80/20 BAL/WETH price may not perfectly match CoinGeckos BAL/ETH price.

7. The user should see a highly accurate estimate of the BAL award at trade time, improving the overall user experience and potentially attracting more traders to the campaign.

References:
- Original proposal: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-balancer-exchange-gas-reimbursement/705
- Expand eligible token list: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-expand-the-exchange-gas-reimbursement-to-all-whitelisted-tokens/799
- Extend program duration: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-extend-the-exchange-gas-reimbursement-program-4-weeks/1121
label: bullish

text:
The summary is as follows:

Balancer V2 liquidity mining will operate in three tiers: Tier 1, Tier 2, and Tier 3. Tier 1 pools will be voted on by governance on a recurring basis, while Tier 2 and Tier 3 pools will be strategically assigned by the Ballers Committee based on community sentiment. The Ballers Committee is a group of active and dedicated members of the Balancer community who have contributed significantly to the protocol. Any engaged individuals in the community can potentially join the committee through elections by fellow community members.

The transition from V1 to V2 will take approximately 8 weeks, with BAL liquidity mining allocations incrementally migrated to V2 on a weekly basis during this period. The weekly BAL distribution will remain constant at 145,000 BAL per week throughout the migration process.

The Ballers Committee aims to provide quick responses according to market conditions and avoid extensive overhead on BAL governance. However, it's important to note that there are potential risks associated with this small group of individuals, such as centralization risks and collusion. The community will constantly assess the participation and decision-making abilities of Ballers, and they can be elected or dismissed by BAL holders through Snapshot votes.

Certain pools may be allocated more than one slot by the committee to tentatively match the APY of specific pools on V1. All community members will always have the ability to signal their support for liquidity mining inclusion for T2 and T3 pools in order to guide the committee.

The upgrade to Balancer V2 is expected to increase gas efficiency, creating a natural incentive for project teams to drive liquidity to Balancer due to its competitive conditions for trading, namely lower gas costs. Some competitors don't offer liquidity incentives at all and still have sufficient liquidity for the long-tail of assets. The upgrade is substantial enough to compete with this market dynamic.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to grant Balancer Labs temporary control over the emergency pause mechanism for Balancer V2 smart contracts during their initial 3 months of operation. This is due to the possibility that gathering 6/11 multisig signers during an emergency may not be feasible or expedient. The control will be given to a single EOA (0x170027069fd114BFF2f57B0FC796df93290C02a6) managed by stakeholders at Balancer Labs across different time zones. After the 3-month period ends, neither the Multisig nor the EOA will have any pause power; Balancer V2 becomes unstoppable. The proposal aims to ensure a quick response in case of vulnerabilities or issues that may put user funds at risk.
label: bullish
