text:
Title: Balancer Grants DAO Proposal for Q3 (August 1st - October 31st)

   Summary: This proposal outlines the establishment and operations of the Balancer Grants Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) for the period August 1st to October 31st, 2022. The Grants DAO will be funded with 25K BAL and managed by a dedicated committee consisting of five members with strong analytical and support backgrounds. The resources will be divided across multiple multi-sigs controlled by the same group. The Grants Committee will work closely with Balancer Labs, Ballers, Fire Eyes, and Kolektivo Labs to amplify and support grantees.

   Specification: If approved, the Grants Committee multi-sig (currently 3 out of 4) will be funded with 25K BAL. The resources will be further divided across different multi-sigs controlled by the same group. All transactions will be recorded in a Sheet and summarized at the end of the Grants Cycle.

   Budget Breakdown:
   - Q3 Grants: 20,000 BAL
   - Committee Members: 2,400 BAL (4 members x 3 months)
   - Grant Lead: 1,500 BAL (3 months)
   - Other Program Expenses: 1,100 BAL
   - Total: 25,000 BAL

   Proposal Timeline:
   - Research and team formation started in July
   - Interviews with key ecosystem members and partners to identify ecosystem needs in early August
   - Finalize Grant Flow and webpage before mid-August
   - Open grants registration in mid-August
   - Provide ongoing support to Grantees from mid-August until the end of October
   - Finalize the first Balancer Grants wave by publishing the Grants Review report at the end of October

   The current WIP Grants Application and Review process can be found [here.](https://www.notion.so/balancergrants/Apply-for-a-Grant-dad1354ee88a4943a010cc9c312785b0)
   If you feel called to fill the open position on the Grants Committee, please let us know. Ideally, someone with a strong technical background is sought for this role.
label: bullish

text:
The provided JavaScript code is using the ethers.js library to encode the function call `grantRoles()` of a contract named `authorizer`. This function takes two arguments: an array of role identifiers and an account address. In this case, it grants the roles `manageUserBalance`, `joinPool`, `exitPool`, `swap`, and `batchSwap` to the account with address `0xdcdbf71A870cc60C6F9B621E28a7D3Ffd6Dd4965`.

The role identifiers are computed using the `solidityKeccak256()` function, which is a way to generate a hash of a given input in Solidity. The input for this function is an array containing the name of the contract method (in this case, the name of the role) and the interface of another contract (in this case, the `vault` interface).

The encoded data for the call can be found at the end of the script:

```

```

This is the ABI-encoded calldata for the function call.

text:
In the given code snippets, two transactions are being described for different smart contracts: StablePools and MetaStablePools.

For StablePools, the Gnosis Safe at `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` is sending a transaction to the Vault Authorizer at `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`. The data being sent is an authorization for the GAUNTLET_SAFE at `0xf4A80929163C5179Ca042E1B292F5EFBBE3D89e6` to set the amplification factor on StablePools. The authorization is granted for two roles:

- `0x8c9b4c1f53b968f62f656d48126bd856c38b0d879974dff5b5d6055c0d2917d4` (startAmplificationParameterUpdate)
- `0xc787be37f98a254065bf8678258de57ce53a2d6814c519063f3003dd9f92dfc3` (stopAmplificationParameterUpdate)

For MetaStablePools, the GAUNTLET_SAFE at `0xf4A80929163C5179Ca042E1B292F5EFBBE3D89e6` is sending a transaction to the Vault Authorizer at an unspecified address (presumably the same as for StablePools). The data being sent is an authorization for the GAUNTLET_SAFE to set the amplification factor on MetaStablePools. The authorization is granted for two roles:

- `0xc108e87eca9f3a0e9a9db0b708e6b15a70c3d0859b02723a7cc4b5ca1fb9fc28` (startAmplificationParameterUpdate)
- `0x2f17310a7a479b437515eb1917c45a5f8d1fc7035462cfc7c7c43825dec621b5` (stopAmplificationParameterUpdate)

In both cases, the roles can be reproduced using pseudo-code that calls the appropriate methods on the pool contract to get the sighash for starting and stopping the amplification parameter update.

text:
This code snippet appears to be a series of transactions on the Arbitrum network involving three contracts: Multisig, Authorizer, and ProtocolFeesCollector. The transactions are as follows:

1. Granting the role to set fees to the current contract address (Multisig) for both networks (0xd2bD536ADB0198f74D5f4f2Bd4Fe68Bae1e1Ba80 and 0x6207ed574152496c9B072C24FD87cE9cd9E17320). The role is granted by the Authorizer contract.

   - For network 0xd2bD536ADB0198f74D5f4f2Bd4Fe68Bae1e1Ba80:
     ```
     Authorizer.grantRole(0xb28b769768735d011b267f781c3be90bce51d5059ba015bc7a28b3e882fb2083, 0xd2bD536ADB0198f74D5f4f2Bd4Fe68Bae1e1Ba80);
     Calldata: 0x2f2ff15db28b769768735d011b267f781c3be90bce51d5059ba015bc7a28b3e882fb2083000000000000000000000000d2bd536adb0198f74d5f4f2bd4fe68bae1e1ba80
     ```
   - For network 0x6207ed574152496c9B072C24FD87cE9cd9E17320:
     ```
     Authorizer.grantRole(0xb28b769768735d011b267f781c3be90bce51d5059ba015bc7a28b3e882fb2083, 0x6207ed574152496c9B072C24FD87cE9cd9E17320);
     Calldata: 0x2f2ff15db28b769768735d011b267f781c3be90bce51d5059ba015bc7a28b3e882fb20830000000000000000000000006207ed574152496c9b072c24fd87ce9cd9e17320
     ```

2. Setting the swap fee percentage to 1% for both networks (100000000000000000 in decimal). This is done by the ProtocolFeesCollector contract.

   - For network 0xd2bD536ADB0198f74D5f4f2Bd4Fe68Bae1e1Ba80:
     ```
     ProtocolFeesCollector.setSwapFeePercentage(100000000000000000);
     Calldata: 0x38e9922e0000000000000000000000000000000

text:
This script is using the Hardhat framework for Ethereum development and it performs the following actions:

1. It defines two interfaces for smart contracts, one for a stable pool (`stable_pool`) and another for a linear pool (`linear_pool`). These interfaces are used to interact with specific functions of these contracts.

2. It also defines three addresses: `GAUNTLET_FEE_SETTER`, `GAUNTLET_AMP_SETTER`, and `BALLERS_MULTISIG`. These addresses represent accounts that have certain roles in the system.

3. It defines two more addresses, `AAVE_LINEAR_FACTORY` and `STABLE_PHANTOM_FACTORY`, which are factories for creating linear pools on the Aave and Phantom protocols respectively.

4. The script then creates roles for each function that can be granted to the specified accounts using the `authorizer` contract. It does this by calling the `grantRoles` function of the `authorizer` contract, passing in an array of role IDs (which are created using the `roleId` function) and the address of the account that should receive these roles.

   - In step 1, it grants the `setSwapFeePercentage` role to the `GAUNTLET_FEE_SETTER` for the stable pool.
   - In step 2, it grants the `startAmplificationParameterUpdate` and `stopAmplificationParameterUpdate` roles to the `GAUNTLET_AMP_SETTER` for the stable pool.
   - In step 3, it grants multiple roles (`setTokenRateCacheDuration`, `setTargets`, and `setSwapFeePercentage`) to the `BALLERS_MULTISIG` account for both the Aave linear pool and the Phantom stable pool factories.

   The script then logs the data that would be sent to the `authorizer` contract if these transactions were to be executed on the Ethereum network.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to authorize Balancer Labs to control the emergency pause mechanism for Boosted Pools, a new feature on the Balancer app, for the first three months following their deployment to mainnet. This is intended to address potential vulnerabilities or issues that may arise during this period. The proposed multisig controlled by Balancer Labs will only have pause power during the initial 3-month period and will not be able to unpause pools afterwards. Users can still withdraw funds even during an emergency pause, but the pause is meant to protect user funds in critical situations. The proposal involves granting specific roles to a multisig controlled by Balancer Labs through the Authorizer contract on Ethereum Mainnet.
label: bullish

text:
In this explanation, we have a description of transactions being submitted to various contracts within the FEI, TRIBE, and MTA ecosystem on the Polygon network. Here's a summary:

1. For TRIBE:
   - An amount of 2,598,000 TRIBE tokens will be minted and delegated to the address 0xd6E96e437b8d42406A64440226B77a51c74E26b1 via the snapshot UI using Wallet Connect.
   - Neither TRIBE nor FEI will be enabled as collateral.

2. For FEI:
   - The DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will approve the spending of 2,454,000 FEI tokens by the address 0xd8553552f8868C1Ef160eEdf031cF0BCf9686945.
   - The DAO Multisig will then mint and transfer 2,454,000 FEI tokens to the address 0xd8553552f8868C1Ef160eEdf031cF0BCf9686945.

3. For MTA:
   - The DAO Multisig will approve MTA to be spent by the stkMTA contract (address 0x8f2326316eC696F6d023E37A9931c2b2C177a3D7) with an amount of 334,000 MTA tokens.
   - The DAO Multisig will stake 334,000 MTA tokens and delegate them to the address 0xd6E96e437b8d42406A64440226B77a51c74E26b1.
   - The Ballers Gnosis Safe (address 0xd6E96e437b8d42406A64440226B77a51c74E26b1) will vote in the dials for Balancer's MTA pool on Polygon.

In summary, transactions are being submitted to mint new tokens of TRIBE and FEI, approve spending of FEI, stake MTA, and delegate voting rights for TRIBE, FEI, and MTA to a specific address (0xd6E96e437b8d42406A64440226B77a51c74E26b1). The Ballers Gnosis Safe will then use these voting rights to vote in the dials for Balancer's MTA pool on Polygon.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal for long-term collaboration between Tempus and Balancer. Tempus is a fixed-rate protocol on Ethereum, enabling users to earn yield and leverage future yield. It has received a grant from Balancer Grants DAO. The proposal suggests that Tempus will not pay protocol fees to Balancer DAO upon launch, but when it implements fees in a pool using a Balancer AMM, 10% of the total fees accruing to Tempus Treasury/TEMP stakers will be paid to Balancer DAO in TEMP tokens. In return, Balancer will continue to support Tempus and provide technical and marketing assistance. The proposal aims to align long-term interests, remove complications, and give both parties flexibility and potential benefits.
label: neutral

text:
1. The Balancer DAO will implement a system where subDAOs handle specific tasks within the organization, operating on quarterly cycles starting from January, April, July, and October.

2. Decisions requiring on-chain execution will be performed by the DAO's multisig (Guardians of the DAO, 6 of 10). Initial signers have been nominated from the existing Balancer DAO community.

3. The subDAOs will create learning and review documents at the end of each cycle, detailing work completed, budget spend, learnings for next cycle, and planning undertaken. This report will determine if the subDAO is funded for the next cycle.

4. Risk assessment/mitigation strategies include holding subDAOs accountable through learning/review documents and ensuring that any changes to existing responsibilities are ratified through a Proposal to the community.

5. The Grants subDAO and DAO Multisig already exist within current Balancer DAO operations, with management practices remaining unchanged. Decisions made by subDAO teams requiring on-chain execution will still be performed by the multisig.

6. SubDAOs are not the only contributors to the Balancer DAO, and new teams can form as needs arise or contributors step forward. A Treasury subDAO is proposed for optimizing management of the DAO's treasury funds, with future functions potentially including tokenomics, reinvestment, and diversification.

7. Delegating any new responsibilities into subDAOs will require a new Proposal to be developed.

8. The initial subDAOs are expected to take full effect from February 2022, allowing a 2-month window for processes to be tested and refined before starting a quarterly cycle beginning April 2022.

9. Voting on this proposal will occur on Snapshot for three days following a one-week posting on the forum. The vote is a single choice between "Yes, let's do it" or "No, this is not the way." Voting "Yes" supports the formation of subDAOs within the Balancer DAO, the delegation of defined responsibilities to each listed subDAO, and the establishment of processes for developing, managing, and dissolving current/future subDAOs.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to increase flexibility in Balancer's liquidity mining program by moving away from tiered systems and towards a more flexible allocation model similar to their Polygon network. This change aims to address challenges in allocating incentives to new pools without impacting others significantly, as the current system has large drops between tiers. The increased flexibility is expected to lead to better BAL per TVL allocation and spread liquidity across many places. There are no suggested incentive changes for any pools as part of this proposal. The text suggests that this change will empower the Liquidity Committee with more control over rewards distribution, potentially leading towards a Curve gauge-like system in the future. The authors see no greater risk in this change than with the current structure, and governance retains the power to intervene if necessary.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposed partnership between GnosisDAO and BalancerDAO, aiming to increase collaboration and integration for mutual benefits. Key aspects include joint technical developments, marketing efforts, and a token swap to align governance interests. The partnership is open-ended and managed by representatives from both organizations. If approved, 200,000 BAL will be exchanged for an equivalent value of GNO, with both parties holding the received assets for at least one year. The agreement can be terminated through respective governance systems.
label: neutral

text: The text is a proposal for the budget allocation of Balancer DAO for Q1 2022, authored by the Ops SubDAO. It outlines compensation for February and estimates for March, totaling 19,500 BAL for compensation. The proposed budget excluding compensation amounts to 2,605 BAL. The proposal suggests that Ops will custody both compensation and general budget funds for the first quarter due to small budget requests. A transaction will be initiated from the DAO Multisig to send the total budget to the Ops Multisig if the proposal is approved. The sentiment of the text is informative and formal, discussing a budget proposal within the Balancer community.
label: neutral

text:
This text appears to be a proposal for implementing veBAL (Voting Escrow Balancer) governance in the Balancer Protocol, similar to how veCRV works in Curve Finance. The goal is to allow token holders to vote directly on proposals and decisions affecting the protocol, rather than delegating all their power to a multisig.

The proposal suggests a 1-week discussion period followed by a 3-day voting period on Snapshot. The vote will be a simple "Yes" or "No" choice regarding the implementation of veBAL governance.

The text also references several other resources for context, including the original Curve documentation and a YFI tokenomics proposal from Yearn Finance. It's important to note that this is just a proposal at this stage, and it will be up to the community to discuss, improve, and eventually vote on its implementation.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes increasing the Balancer protocol fee from 10% to 50%. This change is motivated by the belief that it will accelerate the adoption of the platform, as it would increase the APR for lockers and potentially boost DAO earnings. The author acknowledges potential risks such as loss of swap fee-focused users and impact on partners, but suggests these are acceptable given the expected benefits. The text concludes with a specification for implementing the fee change across different networks.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal for Balancer's DAO to implement a standardized protocol revenue sharing model for all liquidity pool creators. The goal is to incentivize developers building innovative solutions on Balancer and minimize governance overhead. The proposed model would be permissionless, allowing any type of pool to divert a share of its protocol fees to the pool's owner or another dedicated address. This is intended to align the interests of the Balancer community with ecosystem partners and encourage growth within the ecosystem. Potential drawbacks include anyone being able to be a "partner" and liquidity fragmentation, but benefits include aligning incentives between the protocol and its partners, offsetting pool creation gas costs, and incentivizing new markets on Balancer. Future improvements may involve veBAL staking/voting for deciding the amount of the rev share and maintaining a blocklist of pool factories for which revenue sharing should be disabled.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal by Balancer's Treasury subDAO to allocate BAL tokens and FEI from their holdings into Turbo, a platform offered by Tribe DAO, to enable users to borrow against their Balancer Pool Tokens (BPT). The aim is to gauge market demand for this service while still allowing users to earn incentives. The proposal outlines the potential risks, such as smart contract bugs or liquidation of BAL collateral, and proposes mitigation strategies. It also mentions that Tribe DAO will manage the pool but Balancer retains decision-making authority. The Treasury subDAO seeks governance approval to allocate up to 500,000 BAL for this purpose. Overall, the sentiment is one of exploration and potential risk-taking to expand services and user benefits.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a concern about the current governance process in Balancer, where the Governance Council acts as gatekeepers and has control over what proposals move to a vote. The author suggests that "soft consensus in the community" should not be a factor when considering a proposal for a vote, to avoid situations where large token holders support a proposal but the active community does not. The proposed solution is to change the criteria for a "well defined" proposal, and implement a required minimum quorum of 100k BAL for any snapshot vote to be valid. If the Governance Council fails to execute their duties in good faith, a proposal to replace them with a different mechanism should be made.
label: bullish

text: The text proposes that Balancer should join Messari Hub to commission quarterly financial reports, providing valuable insights into major developments and changes within the crypto ecosystem. This move aims to attract more builders, investors, and traders by increasing the availability of quality research. The reports would be free resources, distributed through Messari's newsletter and social channels, and would include key data points, analysis, and a real-time data dashboard. The rationale behind this proposal is to educate stakeholders about project health and aid decision-making in the DeFi space, particularly for traditional institutions entering the sector. A payment of 125,000 USDC is requested for this initiative.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to refund liquidity providers in the wstETH pool on Balancer due to an error in the displayed APR. The error occurred because the protocol fee collection design and the rebasing nature of wstETH resulted in the collection of fees for the wstETH appreciation. The proposed solution involves refunding the collected fees over a specific period, with 221 recipients receiving the refunds via an airdrop. The estimated gas cost is around 6 million gas, and if approved, 28.36086356 wstETH would be transferred from the protocol fee collector to the Balancer liquidity mining distributor multisig for distribution. The sentiment of this text is informative and transparent, with a focus on addressing an issue and compensating affected parties.
label: neutral

text: In summary, the Hexagon Finance project is seeking support from BalancerDAO for marketing activities in exchange for tokens. The token distribution includes allocations for the team, strategy investors, liquidity bootstrapping, marketing, partners and advisors, and liquidity mining incentives. The SWOT analysis highlights strengths such as partnerships with Avalabs and Terra Labs, but also weaknesses like potential overexposure to UST and competition from established players in the DeFi landscape. Despite these challenges, Hexagon Finance presents an opportunity for BalancerDAO to have a stake in a project with strong backing on the Avalanche network. The Hexagon team has offered Andrea a token allocation as a thank you gesture.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal by the Treasury subDAO to manage the investment of Balancer DAO's share of collected protocol fees. The proposal aims to reduce selling pressure on BAL, ensure operational runway, maximize risk-adjusted yield, and build Protocol Owned Liquidity (POL). It also outlines measures to mitigate potential risks such as misuse of funds. If approved, the Treasury subDAO will have discretion over trading assets, providing liquidity, etc., on behalf of the DAO. The proposal requires a "Yes" vote to grant this power.
label: neutral

text:
This text discusses proposed changes in the compensation structure for contributors within the Balancer Protocol Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO). The changes include:

1. Recognizing and rewarding leaders within subDAOs/working groups through a platform called Coordinape, where fellow contributors can recognize good leadership and reward it. This initiative is planned to receive increased budget going forward.

2. Transitioning compensation to stablecoins to protect against Balancer (BAL) volatility and offer more security for core contributors. Each subDAO/working group will be asked to provide 1-3 Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that can be used to measure their performance over each quarter.

The proposal suggests that these changes would make the DAO more sustainable, add structure, and increase accountability. The decision is left to a vote, with a yes vote implementing the new system in Q2 and a no vote keeping the existing system for another quarter.

The text also includes projections of how much compensation might change under the new system compared to the current one. If all contributors engage at 75% and do not participate in veBAL discount, the monthly compensation would decrease from $74,800 to $63,750. However, if half of total contributors choose to max lock discounted veBAL, the monthly compensation could increase to $95,625, with a yearly expense of $1,147,500, reducing the DAOs expected yearly profit from ~$1.3M to ~$1.1M.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to deploy a new tokenomics system for BAL, veBAL, using the ve system pioneered by Curve. The deployment is planned for March 28th, with liquidity mining starting on April 7th. The governance multisig needs to grant permissions to the coordinator smart contract before March 28th for successful deployment. The coordinator's address will be available on Balancer's github by March 25th. The proposal aims at executing the already well-discussed and approved veBAL tokenomics, hoping for unanimous community approval.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal from SymmetricDAO, a Balancer fork currently on Gnosis Chain and Celo, seeking to establish a friendly relationship with the BalancerDAO. SymmetricDAO offers 20,000 SYMM (6.9% of circulating supply) and proposes to send 10,000 BAL for liquidity pools on both platforms. In return, they seek a strategic grant of $100K USDC for further development and marketing. The proposal aims to make Symmetric the first official friendly fork on Celo and Gnosis Chain, with a commitment to support the development of the Balancer Protocol and subsequent friendly forks. Both parties agree to share knowledge, collaborate on technical roadmaps, and engage in co-marketing activities. The agreement is effective immediately but can be terminated with a one-month notice period by either DAO.
label: neutral

text:
The text provided appears to be a proposal for modifying the list of owners of Gauntlet's Gnosis Safe, which is related to the management of liquidity mining distribution and dynamic fee pools in the Balancer Protocol. The new list of owners includes several addresses, some of which are already in charge of the Liquidity mining distribution safe at a different address.

The proposal references several articles and resources for further information on the partnership between Balancer and Gauntlet, the trading fee methodology for Balancer V2 pools, the optimization of capital efficiency using Gauntlet, veBAL tokenomics, an explanation of dynamic exchange fees, and a previous proposal regarding Boosted Pools.

The two hashes provided (0xafFC70b81D54F229A5F50ec07e2c76D2AAAD07Ae and 0xc4591c41e01a7a654B5427f39Bbd1dEe5bD45D1D) do not seem to have a clear connection with the content of the proposal, but they may be related to transaction hashes or other technical details that are not explicitly mentioned in the text.
label: neutral

text:
DAOhaus is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) that operates within the Ethereum blockchain, focusing on facilitating ecosystem grants and utilization of its native token $HAUS as a coordination mechanism. The key activities of DAOhaus include:

1. Granting funds in $HAUS to increase the stability of the token price.
2. Utilizing $HAUS for more than just voting within the DAOhaus ecosystem, with future plans to use it as a coordination mechanism.
3. Supporting the utility and value of contributor compensation denominated in $HAUS.

The platform does not rely on external oracles and has been audited by ConsenSys Diligence. The most used smart contracts are instances of the MolochV2.1 contract framework, which was audited, and none of the contracts are upgradable. There have been no hacks to date.

DAOhaus aims for decentralization and has made organizational design choices to avoid concentrating power. Key aspects include:

- Non-upgradable on-chain assets distributed across multiple entities.
- Governance power over key on-chain assets is distributed among various DAOs, with no single DAO controlling more than 10.5% of voting shares.
- Centralization vectors are being addressed by migrating the entire stack to decentralized infrastructure.

The front end hosting is currently centralized, but user assets remain secure on the blockchain. The pool has been active since March 8, 2022, with a current TVL of $2.1M and historical volume of $248k. For more information, visit the provided links for the Balancer Pool, Pool Gauge, and Dune Analytics.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist the COW/ETH pool gauge for veBAL voting, strengthening ties between the COW and BAL communities. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets at best exchange rates using batch settlement layer on top of popular AMMs and DEX aggregators. Solvers bid for the best possible exchange rate to settle trades, creating CoWs (Coincidence of Wants) to save gas costs, fees, and execution risk. The proposal aims to increase BAL rewards for COW liquidity providers by using COW tokens as a reward for veBAL voters. The text also mentions that the COW Protocol is governed by its token holders, audited, and has potential risks related to centralization and censorship of orders.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist the COW/ETH pool gauge for veBAL voting, strengthening ties between the COW and BAL communities. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets at best exchange rates using batch settlement layer on top of popular AMMs and DEX aggregators. Solvers bid for the best possible exchange rate to settle trades, creating CoWs (Coincidence of Wants) to save gas costs, fees, and execution risk. The proposal aims to increase BAL rewards for COW liquidity providers by using COW tokens as a reward for veBAL voters. The text also mentions that the COW Protocol is governed by its token holders, audited, and has potential risks related to centralization and censorship of orders.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist the COW/ETH pool gauge for veBAL voting, strengthening ties between the COW and BAL communities. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets at best exchange rates using batch settlement layer on top of popular AMMs and DEX aggregators. Solvers bid for the best possible exchange rate to settle trades, creating CoWs (Coincidence of Wants) to save gas costs, fees, and execution risk. The proposal aims to increase BAL rewards for COW liquidity providers by using COW tokens as a reward for veBAL voters. The text also mentions that the COW Protocol is governed by its token holders, audited, and has potential risks related to centralization and censorship of orders.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist a specific COW/GNO pool gauge for veBAL voting, aimed at strengthening the COW and BAL communities by providing COW tokens as rewards for veBAL voters while increasing BAL rewards for COW liquidity providers. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets with MEV protection at optimal exchange rates using a batch settlement layer on top of popular AMMs and DEX aggregators. Solvers bid for the best possible exchange rate, leading to lower gas costs, fees, and execution risk. The proposal is part of CowDAO's governance, with no use of oracles, and audits available for the settlement contract and COW token. Centralization risks are acknowledged but being addressed, mainly concerning censorship of orders. The COW token was launched with incentives to provide liquidity on Balancer pools, and CowDAO is considering using veBAL voting to boost BAL rewards for COW pools.
label: bearish

text: The proposal aims to add a veBAL gauge for the NOTE/WETH 80/20 pool on Balancer, Notional's staked NOTE Balancer pool. This action is intended to deepen liquidity for NOTE on Balancer, reinforce Balancer as a prime DEX for trading NOTE tokens, and encourage NOTE token holders to stake their tokens in the 80/20 sNOTE pool. The proposal is part of Notional's governance mechanisms, which are still centralized but aiming towards decentralization. The NOTE token has been traded on Balancer since mid-November 2021 and the new 80/20 pool has already attracted significant TVL and trading volume.
label: neutral

text:
This proposal outlines changes for the veBAL Gauge Fix Coordinator on Balancer's mainnet. The coordinator will perform actions based on the chosen community option:

1. Option 1: The coordinator will mint missing BAL tokens for veBAL holders, Polygon and Arbitrum LPs, and distribute them to gauge recipient contracts. It will also set all gauge type weights equally and disable the Liquidity Mining Committee gauge.

2. Option 2: The coordinator will mint BAL tokens for veBAL holders, LPs, and airdrop unminted BAL tokens from L1 LPs. It will revoke minting permission from the current Balancer Minter contract, grant permissions to three new contracts, and set up a new GaugeController. This would require veBAL holders and LPs to recast their votes and unstake/stake in new gauges (gas costs would be reimbursed).

Regardless of the chosen option, the coordinator will honor promised BAL distributions for liquidity providers on Polygon, Arbitrum, and veBAL holders until the proposal is discussed and voted upon. The coordinator may mint additional BAL if needed to cover the period between April 4th and April 21st.

References: [Introducing veBAL Tokenomics](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x9fe19c491cf90ed2e3ed9c15761c43d39fd1fb732a940aba8058ff69787ee90a)
label: neutral

text: The text proposes allowing the Tribe DAO to lock their BAL into veBAL for governance participation in the Balancer DAO, citing their existing relationship and the minimal risks involved. The contract address for the vote-locking smart contract is provided.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal by BadgerDAO to add a gauge for the BADGER/wBTC pool on Balancer's platform. This move aims to incentivize liquidity migration to the Balancer ecosystem and increase opportunities for users to earn fees and yield on their tokens. BadgerDAO is a well-established DeFi protocol focused on building infrastructure for Bitcoin, with over $700m TVL and launched ibBTC as the number 5 Bitcoin synthetic in defi. The proposal mentions that Badger has undergone multiple audits by top-tier audit agencies and has been actively trading since December 2020 without severe price issues.
label: neutral

text:
Here is a summary of the provided text:

* The focus for Q2 is to improve BalancerDAO brand awareness and voice.
* Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Q2 include sponsoring 2 physical crypto events, holding at least 5 AMAs per month, growing the Balancer DAO account to 5k followers, and submitting 3 entries for Balancer Bounties.
* The plan for Q2 includes putting more order in everything done, creating new campaigns, looking at reward-based NFTs/POAPs, continuing Pools of the Week posts, progressing with veBAL campaign, establishing #BALbattles, incorporating YouTube videos into various posts, and being more active in IRL events.
* The budget for community development is $900 per month, which will be extended through Q2.
* Successes include onboarding a new Baller, launch of community docs, great progress on balancer.tools v2, multi-chain support for Balancer Analytics, and deployment of community subgraphs.
* Learnings include that development always takes longer than expected and writing good documentation is time-consuming.
* KPIs for Q2 include launching info.balancer.fi (analytics), launching balancer.tools v2, writing first community developer documentation on the DAO gitbooks, maintaining, expanding, and supporting further development of documentation as new technologies are implemented.
* BalancerDAO is requesting $127,500 in stables and 21,250 BAL for compensation, $44,900 in stables and 65,925 BAL for budgets outside of Compensation (with 46,425 BAL going to Grants), leaving approximately 500 BAL from the unspent Q1 budget.
* If this vote is approved, the following transactions will be initiated from the DAO Multisig: a transfer of 46,425 BAL to the Grants Multisig, a transfer of $172,400 of bbaUSD to the Ops Multisig, and a transfer of 40,250 BAL to the Ops Multisig.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal suggesting that Balancer protocol fees collected in BAL tokens should be paid directly to veBAL holders instead of being converted to stablecoins. This is proposed to incentivize reinvestment and avoid additional gas costs for veBAL holders. The current 10% BAL emissions reserved for veBAL holders will continue, making this change cause no extra complexity or gas costs.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to establish the Balancer Foundation, a real-world entity directed by the DAO, to further decentralization efforts and scale operations. The foundation will act as an 'Agent of the DAO' and provide benefits such as engaging with service providers, building resilience within the ecosystem, and interacting with meatspace engagements. The proposal is developed by a working group and has been in development since January 2022. Voting on this proposal will be open for three days following its posting on the forum.
label: neutral

text: The text describes a proposal to whitelist an OHM-ETH-DAI pool gauge for veBAL voting, submitted by Olympus DAO on Balancer's forum. Olympus DAO is a decentralized reserve currency protocol based on the OHM token, backed by a basket of assets and introducing novel economic dynamics through staking and bonding. The proposal aims to grow the pool further for deeper integration with Balancer, attract additional third-party capital, and participate in governing the Balancer ecosystem. The governance of OlympusDAO is handled by OHM and gOHM token holders through snapshot votes and forum proposals. No oracles are used within the protocol, and they are currently working toward full decentralization.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to replace four current signers in Balancer's DAO Multisig, responsible for governance and treasury management across multiple chains, due to their busy schedules. New candidates from Stablecoin Labs, 0xMaki, Gnosis, former Aave, Tempus, CopperLaunch have been proposed as replacements. If approved, the changes will be announced on Discord and Twitter. The sentiment is informative and administrative in nature.
label: neutral

text: The FIAT DAO community is seeking to gain influence in veBAL governance by proposing the deployment of several pools, including FDT/ETH and nested pools FDT/OHM-ETH-DAI and FIAT/staBAL3. These pools require support from the Balancer team for deployment. The FIAT DAO aims to deepen $FDT secondary liquidity by acquiring a veBAL gauge for these pools, to engage in the Hidden Hand marketplace and potentially conduct a DAO token swap in the future. The proposal only covers approval of FDT/WETH 80/20.
label: neutral

text: The proposal aims to delegate the power to add approved gauges to a Gnosis Safe for streamlined process, reducing workload from the DAO Multisig. The safe will ensure only approved and correctly set up gauges are added to the voting list. This includes checking pool legitimacy, L2 gauge setup, and adhering to factory guidelines. The proposal involves granting roles to specified accounts and initiating transactions to add approved gauges to the voting list post-approval vote success.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposed strategic partnership between Aave DAO and Balancer, where 200,000 BAL tokens will be swapped for AAVE. The swap is intended to strengthen the relationship between the two communities and increase their influence in each other's governance processes. If successful, the Aave community will deposit BAL into a Balancer pool, with veBAL voting influence used to direct rewards to liquidity pools utilizing Aave markets. The proposal is significant enough for both parties to become influential holders of each other's tokens. The agreement can be terminated by either party through their respective governance systems.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes whitelisting a Gnosis Safe multisig owned by the Aave Companies to participate in Balancer DAO governance using their veBAL tokens. The Aave Companies are software developers who support and use the Balancer Automated Market Maker, holding approximately 252k BAL. They aim to engage in governance due to their long-term support for Balancer. The text acknowledges the risks associated with smart contracts voting and commits not to tokenize veBAL using this safe.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist Tracer DAO's Treasury Management Fund (TMF) in Balancer's VotingEscrow contract. This will allow TMF to lock BAL tokens for participation in Balancer's governance and direction of BAL emissions towards the Balancer ecosystem. Tracer DAO, a decentralized derivatives infrastructure platform, values its relationship with Balancer, particularly for facilitating secondary market liquidity for their Perpetual Pools product. The TMF currently owns ~$158k worth of BAL tokens in the BAL/ETH pool on Balancer V2. If successful, the TMF will lock its BAL holdings to gain access to veBAL and direct rewards towards Perpetual Pools secondary markets on Balancer, as well as the TCR/DAI pool on Balancer. The Tracer DAO team is globally distributed with experience in DeFi, Tradfi, and blockchain data infrastructure. They have undergone audits from several firms and plan for further audits.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal for BeethovenX, a recognized contributor to the Balancer ecosystem, to deploy and manage a Balancer DEX on Optimism. This collaboration aims to establish Balancer as the leading DEX on Optimism before a potential growth spurt. BeethovenX offers an incentive by allocating up to 3M BEETS for bribing veBAL voters in the first six months, ensuring governance power and maintaining their usual emissions on Fantom. The partnership is expected to benefit both protocols significantly.
label: bearish

text: The text presents a proposal for whitelisting Tetu contracts in Balancer's voting escrow, introducing tetuBAL - a liquid version of veBAL with benefits such as low gas costs, governance participation, and potential rewards. The process for governance discussions is through Discord, with audits available on Tetu's website. Security measures include a time lock, multi-sig wallet, and adherence to security best practices.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to fund the integration of Balancer's Boosted Pools into the 1inch Aggregation Protocol. This integration is seen as beneficial due to the efficiency and innovation offered by Boosted Pools, with a current value of $350mm in the bbaUSD pool. The proposal requests 20,000 BAL or its equivalent in stablecoins from BalancerDAO for this integration, which is contingent on the same proposal passing through the 1inch DAO. The success of the Boosted Pools is considered crucial for their growth, given that a significant portion of trade volume on the Balancer protocol is driven by DEX aggregators, with 1inch driving a substantial part of this volume.
label: bearish

text:
1. Tiered Bribe Deployment: To qualify for a Reactor vote in CoRE, 12 million votes are required. The current cost for one TOKE via bribing is ~$0.75, and LUNA has deployed only $257K worth of bribes so far. This proposal suggests sending out tiered bribe amounts starting at $0.35/TOKE and scaling up to $1/TOKE using $2MM of BAL for bribing.

2. Reactor Farming + Potential Token Swap + Business Development Efforts: Securing the BAL reactor and token swap with Tokemak would lead to a net gain in all scenarios plus additional TVL captured. This proposal includes engaging in a token swap with Tokemak to seed the initial reactor, developing default 80/20 pools for deployment on each reactor, exploring veBAL program as an alternative to veCRV on Toke/WETH, discussing boosted pools and stable pools as options for exchange assets to increase capital efficiency, and using the Balancer reactor as a means to acquire TOKE for Balancer.

3. Targeted veBAL Education: An educational campaign will be run to dissuade Hidden Hand users from instantly dumping the BAL. This could include an AMA with Tokemak/Redacted communities and targeted Twitter threads.

Risks associated with this plan include bribe insufficiency, smart contract risk, and potential exploits. However, these risks are mitigated by the current market conditions, previous audits of both projects, and insurance coverage via InsurAce.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist Aura Finance in Balancer's VotingEscrow contract, allowing Aura Finance to participate in Balancer governance and provide additional rewards to ecosystem participants. Aura Finance aims to incentivize Balancer LPs and BAL stakers through social aggregation of BAL deposits and its native token, $AURA. The proposal also outlines the use of $AURA as a governance tool within the ecosystem, with locked $AURA tokens releasing over time according to a specified schedule. The team behind Aura Finance has a track record in DeFi and is undergoing audits. If approved, the Balancer multisig will add a smart wallet checker on the veBAL contract and whitelist the depositor contract provided by Aura Finance following a successful proposal.
label: bearish

text: The proposal suggests adding a gauge for the Matic<>MaticX pool on Balancer, with MaticX being a liquid token for Matic staking provided by StaderLabs. This move aims to build deep liquidity for staked Matic within the Polygon DeFi ecosystem and establish Balancer as the prime DEX for Matic<MaticX pool. The incentivization of this pool would help unlock large liquidity currently locked in staked Matic, bring significant liquidity and trading volumes to Balancer, and make liquid staking an asset class of interest to both Polygon and Balancer communities. StaderLabs' experience in building strong liquid staking solutions on multiple chains makes it a leading candidate for this task. The unique metastable pool technology of Balancer is considered ideal for liquid staking assets.
label: bearish

text: The text presents a proposal to whitelist the Aave Mainnet Reserve Factor on Balancer's VoteEscrow, allowing the Aave community to participate in Balancer DAO governance. This is motivated by the strong working relationship between the two communities and the potential benefits for both. No significant risks have been identified, and the proposal includes whitelisting a specific address to interact with the veBAL contract.
label: bearish

text: The text presents a proposal to whitelist the BadgerDAO Gnosis Safe multisig for vote-locking B-80BAL-20WETH into veBAL and participate in governance for the Balancer DAO. The motivation behind this is that BadgerDAO, a well-established DeFi infrastructure builder for Bitcoin, is a fan of the Balancer ecosystem and seeks to contribute to its governance and incentivize more liquidity. The risks associated with this action are acknowledged by the multisig signers, who commit not to use the safe for tokenizing veBAL.
label: neutral

text: The text introduces a proposal to whitelist the DAOhaus LPDAO Gnosis Safe multisig for vote-locking B-80BAL-20WETH into veBAL, allowing the LPDAO community to participate in Balancer governance. The motivation behind this is that LPDAO coordinates HAUS liquidity provision and aligns with the Balancer ecosystem. The risks involve potential issues with tokenizing veBAL using the safe, but the signers acknowledge these risks and commit not to use the safe for this purpose.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal for whitelisting the VitaDAO Gnosis Safe multisig to participate in governance for the Balancer DAO and vote on increased rewards for VitaDAO-related pools. The motivation behind this is that VitaDAO, a community DAO focused on longevity research, has been a supporter of Balancer and intends to engage further by participating in Balancer's governance through veBAL. The text also acknowledges the risks associated with vote-locking veBAL and commits not to tokenize it using this safe.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes to whitelist Index Coop's Investment Account on Balancer's VotingEscrow. This will enable the Index Coop community to participate in Balancer DAO governance by vote-locking BAL and earning rewards. Index Coop has previously invested in Balancer and aims to continue building financial products on Balancer v2, with a recent deployment of a delta neutral Flexible Leverage Index pool on Polygon network. The proposal intends to maximize the veBAL holding potential for future product launches and increase participation in Balancer's governance process.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to add a gauge for the WNCG/WETH Pool on Ethereum mainnet, which is part of Balancer's decentralized finance (DeFi) platform. The pool involves Nine Chronicles Gold (NCG), an in-game currency from the fully decentralized free-to-play RPG game, Nine Chronicles. The proposal aims to attract more liquidity and deeper liquidity for trading on Balancer by offering incentives through veBAL gauges. The game protocol is currently managed by a multisig system, with open-source codes and operations discussed in Discord. No oracles are used, and the Ethereum bridge has undergone security audits. However, the governance systems are not yet fully decentralized, and the bridge operates using an own Ethereum node along with Infura. There is no DeFi protocol history using WNCG, but there has been a Sushiswap pool for WNCG/ETH since August 2021.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist a CRE8R gauge on Arbitrum, a Layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum. CRE8R is described as a decentralized Web3 content marketing agency DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization). The motivation behind this proposal is to expand their liquidity to L2s and potentially to OP if it goes live. The governance of CRE8R DAO is handled by its founding 100 NFT holders through snapshot votes and forum proposals, with specific treasury functions controlled through a multisig. There are no oracles within the CRE8R DAO at this time, and there's no need for market history as CRE8R doesn't run a DeFi protocol with smart contracts. The text does not express any sentiment, but it suggests an expansion and growth strategy for the CRE8R DAO in the L2 ecosystem.
label: neutral

text: The proposal aims to address an issue where certain tokens (SNX and sBCT) were transferred into the ProtocolFeeCollector due to a double-entrypoint token problem. To resolve this, a new contract called ProtocolFeesWithdrawer is proposed, which will manage protocol fees while keeping SNX and sBTC from LPs safe. The multisig will regain the ability to manage protocol fees but will be unable to withdraw any SNX or sBCT. This contract will become part of permanent infrastructure due to its minimal overhead and potential future use in similar situations. The execution details involve granting roles to the ProtocolFeesWithdrawer and original Safe, allowing for withdrawal from the FeeCollector and initiation of withdrawals on the Withdrawer, respectively. However, there is a risk that the mitigations may not be effective if one of the entrypoints is updated before it can be added to the denylist. Plans to fix the SNX and sBTC issue are ongoing.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to add a governance gauge for the CREAM/WETH Pool on the Balancer platform, aiming to deepen liquidity and increase trading volume. CREAM Finance is a decentralized lending protocol that offers a wide range of tokens, including stablecoins and other cryptocurrencies. The proposal aims to leverage BAL incentives to achieve these goals. CREAM tokens serve as the governance token for the network, with holders voting on proposals through CREAM's snapshot and forum. The protocol has undergone audits and currently functions optimally across multiple platforms, although it previously suffered a flash loan attack on its ETH platform. The total value locked in the CREAM protocol is $318.06 million.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for an Emergency subDAO, a small group empowered to manage malicious activity or potential loss of funds in decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms. This specific proposal is aimed at addressing a situation with three expired pools on Balancer that have been unfairly benefiting one LP by collecting all emissions. The Emergency subDAO will be a 4-of-7 multisig, and it will only have the power to kill gauges in this case. The proposal also includes an additional power for the Emergency subDAO to add tokens to a deny list on the ProtocolFeesWithdrawer contract if necessary. The sentiment of the text is one of concern regarding unfair distribution of funds and the need for swift action to rectify the issue.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal by Pickle Finance to collaborate with Balancer Protocol, aiming to enhance the utility of deposits for Balancer LPs and the overall utility of Balancer's Gauge system. This collaboration is expected to create synergies through an easy mechanism for aggregating `veBAL` boosts and benefits for prospective Balancer LPs. The proposal includes incentives for those who vote to whitelist Pickle and join early, with around 2-3% of the PICKLE supply allocated for Balancer Brinery incentives. The design involves a seamless user experience for joining `veBAL` through a system called the Brinery, which guarantees liquidity for Pickle's `veBAL` derivative and provides rewards to users. The text also highlights Pickle's history, team, and governance structure, emphasizing their collaboration with Balancer in the past and future.
label: bearish

The proposal includes incentives for those who vote to whitelist Pickle and join early, with around 2-3% of the PICKLE supply allocated for Balancer Brinery incentives. The design involves a seamless user experience for joining `veBAL` through a system called the Brinery, which guarantees liquidity for Pickle's `veBAL` derivative and provides rewards to users. The text also highlights Pickle's history, team, and governance structure, emphasizing their collaboration with Balancer in the past and future.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to amend an agreement with 1inch for integrating boosted pools, due to a discrepancy between the expected payment in stables (300k bbaUSD) and the originally agreed upon BAL. The author believes it is important to honor the original understanding as 1inch represents significant trading volume for bbaUSD. They also acknowledge a lapse in follow-up communication regarding the proposal text amendment, promising to be more diligent in future discussions. The treasury holding ~4.2M stables would be affected if this vote passes, representing ~7% of their stable reserves.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for allocating 31,250 BAL (worth $250k) from the Balancer treasury towards incentives on Optimism for a period of two months. This is in response to the upcoming launch of Balancer on Optimism by BeethovenX. The funds will be managed by five individuals and coordinated with their counterparts at BeethovenX. If both proposals pass, the BAL will be transferred to a liquidity mining multisig wallet. The proposal aims to quickly proceed with the launch for strategic long-term value, despite not being an ideal method of liquidity mining.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal to whitelist Stake DAO on Balancer's platform, allowing them to lock BAL tokens and create a liquid locker and associated strategies. The rationale behind this is that Stake DAO has recently introduced Liquid Lockers, a feature designed for ve model tokens, enabling users to maintain a liquid position while earning yield and voting power. The liquid locker will allow users to lock B-80BAL-20WETH and receive sdBAL, which can be staked or used for liquidity provision in the strategy. The strategy requires a gauge for the sdBAL/B-80BAL-20WETH pool on Balancer to ensure token liquidity. Additionally, it suggests that Balancer could help seed the liquidity pool to benefit from revenues generated. Overall, the sentiment is positive and forward-looking, indicating potential collaboration and growth opportunities for both Stake DAO and Balancer.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist a PAL-USDC pool gauge on Balancer's platform, aiming to attract more users and grow the pool. Paladin is introduced as a governance lending protocol with a history with Balancer, having previously conducted an LBP on Balancer via Prime Launch. The proposal highlights the benefits of Paladin, such as its active DAO, audited dapps, and existing liquidity on various DEXs. The text concludes by providing relevant links for further information. The sentiment appears to be optimistic and collaborative, with a focus on growth and partnership between the two platforms.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a problem with the Tribe DAO's interaction with the veBAL system due to its current 2-contract setup. The author suggests a solution of deploying a new version of the `VotingEscrowDelegation` contract, which would allow the Tribe DAO to delegate its boost from the existing contract to the BalancerGaugeStaker proxy. The Balancer Labs team has already deployed a version of this contract with fixes and preseeding for existing boosts. However, a migration is yet to happen as it requires an authorized account to call the `setDelegation` function. The author expresses hope that this migration will occur before Convex-like platforms launch, making the migration harder. The sentiment of the text can be summarized as a request for action from the Balancer DAO to improve the Tribe DAO's interaction with the veBAL system.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a safety measure for adding reward tokens to child chain gauges on Ethereum networks like Polygon and Arbitrum. The `ChildChainGaugeTokenAdder` contract is introduced as a module that enhances safety in this process. Permissions are to be granted to this contract, the LM multisig, and an Authorizer for executing specific functions. This setup will be implemented across multiple networks, with different deployment addresses provided for each network. The text also highlights potential risks such as incorrect or faulty tokens being added to gauges, which could necessitate a gauge migration, or a distributor setting overly long distribution durations, making distributions unusable. No funds are at risk in this process, but potentially affected are those being distributed, which could be diluted by a malicious distributor. The overall sentiment is informative and precautionary.
label: neutral

text: The text introduces Stake DAO, a decentralized platform that helps users grow their crypto portfolio by staking tokens and receiving returns. However, due to complications with a Balancer Pool and sdveCRV contract, 83,053.205742818150358418 CRV rewards were stuck and could not be claimed by Stake DAO. To resolve this issue, an agreement was made between Balancer and Stake DAO to move the stuck rewards to a Balancer ProtocolFeesCollector address, then transfer them back to Stake DAO's multisig address for redistribution to eligible users. The text does not mention any specific risks associated with this process.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal for the Balancer DAO to invest 500k BAL into a Ribbon Finance treasury vault, selling monthly call options with cash settlement. The expected yields are 38% APY and 10.92% APY, potentially leading to gains of $1.5M and $436k respectively. However, there are risks involved such as potential exploitation of the Ribbon Vault and significant price increases in BAL which could result in losses. The community is advised to consider insurance for the vault from Nexus Mutual at a cost of 50.79 ETH for one year's coverage.
label: neutral

text:
1. The community has the responsibility to ensure SPs receiving treasury funds are acting in the best interest of the Balancer ecosystem.
2. Any community member can propose stopping funding for an SP, but large veBAL holders have a stronger incentive to ensure SPs deliver value.
3. A delegate system is being created for transparent and productive dialogue between proposers and large voting power holders.
4. Delegates and token holders should not vote in favor of or against funding/defunding an SP they are working for or affiliated with, and SPs should not bribe voters.
5. A new "Abstain" voting option will be added to Snapshot for cases where an SP is affiliated with many large veBAL holders.
6. Risks to the ecosystem include conflicts of interest, SPs not following through on objectives, and unsustainable burn rates from funding multiple SPs.
7. Mitigating these risks involves fostering an active community, declaring conflicts of interest, requesting lower funding amounts or utilizing milestone-based payments as a trial period, and overseeing the Grants Service Provider if milestone-based payments are used.
8. The Ops subDAO will dissolve at the end of the second quarter, returning all powers to veBAL governance.
9. Future funding proposals must adhere to the guidelines described above, and a new tracking system, BIP or Balancer Improvement Proposal, will be implemented.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to allowlist GnosisDAO's treasury in Balancer's VotingEscrow contract, enabling participation in Balancer's governance. GnosisDAO has previously contributed liquidity to Balancer and holds a significant amount of BAL. It also has a partnership with Balancer as stated in the linked forum post.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to allocate BAL from the treasury for liquidity provision on Multichain, a platform that enables cross-chain asset transfers between Ethereum and Optimism networks. This move aims to circumvent a 7-day withdrawal period on the official Optimism bridge, allowing for necessary arbitrage loops with Ethereum. The text also highlights potential risks such as exploitation of Multichain and imbalanced usage of the bridge, and provides information about the current BAL balance in the treasury.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a concern about potential manipulation of Balancer's gauge system for distributing BAL emissions. It suggests new guidelines for gauges, including requiring Balancer Governance as the owner, communicating proposed swap fee changes to the community, and seeking community approval before making such changes. If these rules are not followed, there is a risk of a governance attack and the possibility of the Emergency subDAO killing the gauge. The guidelines aim to prevent malicious actions that could affect liquidity and BAL rewards farming.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses an issue with the Tribe DAO's contract for claiming BAL rewards associated with gauge staking on Balancer. Due to a mistake in reusing contracts from Angle Protocol, the Tribe DAO was unable to interact with the BalancerMinter and claim the BAL rewards. As a result, 34,344 BAL tokens will be forever unclaimable. The Tribe DAO is requesting the Balancer DAO to OTC these BAL tokens back to them. The text also mentions a new gauge staking contract will be deployed shortly. The sentiment of the text is regretful and hopeful, as the Tribe DAO acknowledges the mistake was theirs but expresses a need for assistance from the Balancer DAO to recover the lost BAL tokens.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to address a medium severity bug in Synthetix by executing a contract initiated by the DAO Multisig, aiming to restore normal operation. The contract grants roles to an account, allowing it to allowlist tokens and withdraw collected fees. The account and roles can be verified from their respective GitHub links. The sentiment is informative and action-oriented, suggesting a proactive approach to resolving the identified issue.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses proposed changes to the governance structure of Balancer, a decentralized finance platform. The changes include integrating Aura's snapshot system, increasing the quorum for votes, and streamlining the proposal submission process. These adjustments aim to simplify the voting process and reduce the frequency of signing requests. However, there are potential risks such as delaying time-sensitive proposals due to the weekly vote schedule and the possibility of not meeting the increased quorum requirement. The control over the balancer.eth ENS will be passed to the DAO Multisig, with future updates to snapshot being handled by the Emergency subDAO.
label: neutral

text:
The summary of roles and responsibilities in the provided text includes:

1. Director Responsibilities:
   - Making decisions on issues affecting the DAO, strategy, policy, resources, performance, and regulatory matters.
   - Providing advice and direction on all matters concerning the company.
   - Planning, developing, and enhancing the future strategic direction of the DAO.
   - Sharing responsibility with other directors for effective management of the company.

2. CEO/Management Responsibilities:
   - Liaising with the board on budgets, project proposals, and matters related to service providers (including a BVI subsidiary).
   - Reporting to the board on important matters such as financial status, funding projections, policy setting, planning, program operations, employee matters, and the long-term health of the ecosystem.
   - Managing finances, service providers, and overseeing the organizational structure and systems.
   - Involving the board, ecosystem participants, service provider staff in developing organizational goals, a strategic plan, and projections for supporting the mission.
   - Overseeing vendors, software and product developments, funds, and ensuring that projects have clear objectives within the resources and mission of the Foundation.
   - Ensuring compliance with necessary filings, responses to inquiries, AML Compliance vendor management, and other Cayman Foundation compliance and risk-related matters.

3. Legal Counsel: Providing advice on matters of Cayman law as required by the Foundation.

4. Self Insurance: Requesting $500,000 for self-insurance to protect against legal, regulatory, and operational risks, and personal liability for carrying out duties.

5. Bank Fees: Estimate/placeholder for monthly fees associated with establishing a bank relationship.

6. Accounting Software: Monthly software subscription fees estimate.

7. Domain hosting, email document management solution: Minor operating budget to cover domain hosting, email, and related items.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses FIAT DAO's proposal to deploy two new stableswap pools, specifically for the pairs FIAT-USDC-DAI and FIAT-FEI-FRAX. This follows a successful migration of their governance token liquidity to the Balancer platform over the past month. The FIAT protocol is a DeFi solution that provides liquidity for fixed income assets, with competitive borrowing power for holders of collateral assets. The success of FIAT depends on attracting secondary liquidity and providing boosted liquidity through pools like staBAL and FEI-FRAX-DAI on Balancer, increasing TVL for Balancer and trading fees for LPs. The text invites the Balancer DAO to share their opinions about varying levels of potential A coefficients regarding these pools.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to add new candidates to the DAO Multisig's replacement signers list on various blockchains (Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Fantom). The current approved candidate is Evgeny Yurtaev from Zerion. Kain is leaving due to time constraints and will be replaced by Mounir from Paraswap immediately. Future updates will be announced on Balancer's Discord and Twitter channels. The sentiment of the text is informative and administrative, with a focus on governance changes within the DAO Multisig.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal for the Balancer DAO to swap USDC for BAL from its treasury, in order to pay contributor salaries (Balaries) in June. This is due to insufficient BAL in the ops multisig to cover the expected costs, as a result of the recent market downturn affecting the value of BAL. The swap would help preserve USDC for the DAO and ensure that contributors receive their discounted veBAL compensation. However, there are risks involved such as potential fluctuations in the price of BAL and an uncertain number of contributors receiving their Balary.
label: bullish

text: This text describes a service provider named Balancer Maxis, a group of contributors within the Balancer community who manage various aspects of the Balancer ecosystem. Their responsibilities include multisig management, governance, user/project support, community engagement, and record keeping. They have a strong track record in these areas and aim to continue their work for the next three months, with a budget of 32,925 BAL per month. The text also mentions that one member, Zen Dragon, will be replacing mkflow on the Governance Council.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to create a "core" designation for Balancer pools that generate yield, aiming to incentivize voters to prioritize these revenue-generating pools. The core pools would receive fees as bribes in USDC, with the allocation depending on the percentage of veBAL controlled by each major player. The proposal aims to boost adoption of L2 networks within the Balancer ecosystem and offset potential decline in swap fee revenue. However, it raises concerns about dependency on a single marketplace, complexity, barrier to entry for projects intending to bribe veBAL, and erosion of incentive to lock veBAL directly. If approved, the system would operate with changes in fee collection, distribution, and bribing schedules.
label: neutral

text:
1. BadgerDAO will initially distribute free votes controlled by the Treasury among three pools, including one for graviAURA, to help build liquidity and trading history for these new tokens focused on the Balancer ecosystem.

2. All POL farming BAL will be moved from the BADGER/WBTC pool to the BADGER/graviAURA pool, assuming all three gauges pass.

3. Any future bribes will be directed only to graviAURA pools, and if possible offered on an Aura-focused bribe market.

4. BadgerDAO operates under a hierarchy of multisig accounts for various operations, with the highest risk operations controlled by a timelock address that needs a 2-day time delay to perform any actions. The Badger Multisig maintains governance over the contract and can redelegate votes to a new EOA if necessary.

5. Badger does not rely on external oracles, but its API and frontend are hosted by centralized entities. They are developing a fully permissionless IPFS-hosted access point primarily intended for strategy development.

6. Voting is currently controlled by an EOA due to the snapshot voting element of AURA, with access limited to two senior members of the Badger team and the bot that runs the voting script. Badger will work with Aura over time to decentralize snapshot voting as much as possible.

7. AURA, graviAURA, and auraBAL are new tokens without significant liquidity or trading history. The purpose of these gauges is to help build that. Eth is a well-known token with proven market history.

8. Badger is the governance token of BadgerDAO, currently traded in an 80/20 BADGER/WBTC Balancer pool. The treasury maintains additional Protocol-owned liquidity on Curve and Uniswap V3, and BADGER is well-traded across various centralized exchanges.

9. The proposed gauge is a 33graviAURA-33WETH-33AURA pool with the address: 0x7598a96271700f20a542fa69857f0b59d6c162e4.
label: neutral

text:
1. The natural yield of graviAURA and underlying vlAURA in Balancer pools is based on their fixed weight, without the need for external voting. However, initial capital or incentives may be required to bootstrap pools.

2. Changes to BadgerDAO's voting and farming strategies around Balancer will include:
   - Splitting free votes controlled by the Treasury between graviAURA pools initially.
   - Moving POL farming BAL from the BADGER/WBTC pool to the BADGER/graviAURA pool (if all gauges pass).
   - Directing any fucoolture bribes only to graviAURA pools, and offering them on an Aura focused bribe market if possible.

3. BadgerDAO's governance structure includes a hierarchy of multisig accounts with specific use cases, the highest risk operations being controlled by a timelock address with a 2-day delay. The potential risk is misdirection of all graviAURA votes for one voting round due to this centralized element.

4. Badger does not rely on external oracles and has undergone several audits, including the Quantstap audit for Vaults 1.5 and C4 contests for graviAURA strategy and bveCVX strategy (results pending). Additional audit results can be found on badger.com under "Security & Audits".

5. Badger utilizes upgradeable contracts, protected by a 2-day timelock, and centralized entities host the API and frontend. However, they are developing a permissionless IPFS hosted access point for strategy development.

6. The EOA controlling voting in AURA is currently only accessible to 2 senior members of the Badger team and the bot which runs the voting script. Badger will work with Aura to decentralize snapshot voting as much as possible.

7. AURA, graviAURA, and auraBAL are new tokens focused on the Balancer ecosystem without significant liquidity or trading history. The purpose of these gauges is to help build that. Eth has proven market history and is well-traded.

8. Badger is the governance token of BadgerDAO, currently traded in an 80/20 BADGER/WBTC Balancer pool. The treasury maintains additional Protocol owned liquidity on Curve and Uniswap V3, and BADGER is well-traded across several centralized exchanges.

9. A new gauge (33auraBAL-33graviAURA-33WETH) will be introduced.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal within the Balancer ecosystem's Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) to bolster its stablecoin reserves using Ribbon Finance treasury vault for BAL. The DAO is considering depositing BAL into this vault and selling monthly calls, with two potential yields provided: 38% APY using a strike 25% out of the money, and 10.92% APY using a strike 50% out of the money. The text also mentions risks associated with this strategy, such as potential exploitation of the Ribbon Vault or significant price increases in BAL during the month, which could lead to losses. The DAO is considering purchasing insurance for the vault from Nexus Mutual and has proposed allocating 200k BAL for this purpose. Overall, the text presents a strategic financial decision with potential gains but also associated risks within the Balancer ecosystem.
label: neutral

text: The text provides information about Aura Finance, a DeFi protocol centered around vote-escrowed tokens on Balancer Labs' veBAL. It aims to boost yield potential and governance power of liquidity providers, token stakers, and voters. The protocol has set aside 10% of its total AURA supply for rewards over 4-5 years, which can be diverted to provide additional rewards on top of existing BAL & AURA. The Balancer pool has not been active for long, but rewards are expected to flow soon and liquidity is likely to develop. The gauge address for Aura Finance can be found on Etherscan. text: Orb has submitted a funding request for 12 months starting August 2022, with quarterly payments totaling approximately $4 million USD in USDC. They will hold exposure only to BAL and stablecoins to align with Balancer DAO's interests. In case of offboarding during the 12-month period, a transition buffer of 3 months is requested for completion of projects and smooth handover of responsibilities. Additionally, Orb plans to request BAL through a governance proposal from Balancer Labs without additional cost to the DAO. The text conveys a confident and organized approach by Orb in their funding request.
label: neutral

text:
This proposal is for the Ecosystem Operations and Development Workstream, which aims to streamline contributor rewards and project management for PrimeDAO, DAOhaus, The DAOist, Kolektivo, and BalancerDAO.

The team consists of Luuk (Senior Ecosystem Developer), Will (Strategic Consultant and Project Manager), Jaap (Senior Graphic Designer), and CryptoComical (Designer). They have extensive experience in the DAO space, DeFi, and ImpactDAO.

The budget for this proposal is $108,000 per quarter, distributed across Ecosystem Development, Design, and Expenses. The Ecosystem Development will have an 0.8 FTE equivalent of contributors, while the Design team will have a 1 FTE equivalent.

The proposal includes Balancer vests for fixed contributors equal to 50% of their fixed rewards. These vests are valued in absolute BAL numbers and will be distributed pro-rata based on their fixed rewards. The veBAL incentives will also be issued based on the milestones accomplished by the Ecosystem Ops and Development Workstream.

The team plans to follow an iterative proposal process, absorbing learnings in the coming months and actively supporting BalancerDAO in creating a multi-year ecosystem strategy for 2023. They will document their learnings and publish them to the wider community, similar to the process they followed in the Grants Sub-DAO.
label: neutral

text: The text outlines a budget proposal for Balancer Grants DAO operations from July 1st to September 31st, 2022. It details the compensation structure for team members based on their level of contribution and the allocation of funds for grants, co-leads, committee members, program expenses, and service provider pledge. The budget request totals 101,500 BAL plus $60k USD. The proposal also includes accountability guidelines and the ETH address to receive the allocated funds. Overall, the text suggests a well-organized plan for managing grants and resources within the Balancer ecosystem.

text: The text describes a proposal by BadgerDAO to add a gauge for the DIGG/wBTC/graviAURA pool on Balancer. This is intended to incentivize migration of liquidity to the Balancer ecosystem, as DIGG enthusiasts within the Badger DAO community aim to make Balancer the primary exchange and source of liquidity for DIGG. text: The text discusses a proposal to remove the CREAM/WETH gauge from Balancer due to its large size and lack of fee revenue, despite being the largest recipient of BAL emissions. The proposal will be sent to the Governance Council for approval next week. If approved, the DAO Multisig will have the ability to kill the gauge. The community is split on this issue, with some arguing that it's necessary for Balancer's sustainability.

text: The text discusses an upgrade to the GaugeAdder, a piece of veBAL infrastructure, to support expansion onto new networks. The coordinator contract deployed by Balancer Labs will manage this upgrade, granting permission for parameter control on Arbitrum and Optimism bridges, creating a new gauge type 'Optimism', revoking permissions from the old GaugeAdder, and granting permissions to the new GaugeAdder v2. The new version also supports zksync and gnosis gauges but they are not yet created or have gauge factories. The DAO Multisig will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer for this upgrade, which can be verified on GitHub. Overall, the text suggests a planned improvement and coordinated action within the veBAL system.
label: neutral

The text outlines a marketing strategy for the Balancer Protocol, which aims to increase brand awareness and attract developers and engineers. The strategy involves publishing long-form content on Medium, leveraging the services of a graphic designer (Cryptocomical) for design work, and using various platforms like Twitter, YouTube, and events/conferences to reach a wider audience.

   Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for measuring success include:
   1. Medium blog visits
   2. Twitter engagement & followers
   3. Youtube growth in views & followers
   4. Success of event sponsorships and presence
   5. Media mentions & campaigns success
   6. Brand impressions and social impact of swag

   The text also highlights some of the team's past achievements, such as Balancer Labs Twitter growth, conference sponsorships, video strategy, and successful partner and product launches.
label: neutral
