The proposal includes a budget of 60,000 USDC and 7,000 BAL, with payments contingent upon approval and completion of deliverables. The initiative aims to improve governance effectiveness and attract developers to create new products on Balancer.

The team behind TempleDAO has been sourced from community contributors, with a plan for more decentralization. The proposal concludes that TempleDAO aims to be a major adopter of Balancer technology and bribe incentivizer for BAL emissions.

text: The text discusses the allocation of BAL towards Ethereum-Optimism, Polygon, and Arbitrum bridge liquidity on Multichain, highlighting its good usage so far. It suggests adding support for these networks to facilitate easier transfer of BAL between Balancer's deployments. The author believes this action will put idle BAL in the Treasury to work, earning bridging fees, and anticipates increased demand due to BIP-19 driving more adoption on Polygon and Arbitrum. If approved, 40,000 BAL will be sent to a liquidity mining multisig for distribution across the three networks. The sentiment is optimistic and forward-looking, focusing on growth and expansion opportunities for the BAL ecosystem.

text: The text discusses a proposal for Orb Collective to receive 398,527 BAL tokens from the Balancer DAO Multisig. This allocation is intended as compensation for current and future team members on a 4-year vesting basis with a 1-year cliff. Notably, this action would not incur any additional cost to the DAO, as the BAL supply has recently increased via a transfer received by the DAO on July 29, 2022. The tokens will be sent from the DAO Multisig to the Balancer Foundation if the proposal is approved.

text: The text discusses a permanent loss of 3100 BAL tokens due to a logic issue in the previous version of Balancer's FeeDistributor contract. The Aura Treasury manually deposited the missing BAL to ensure system functionality, and now it is proposed to repay this BAL back to the treasury.

text:
The text presents a proposal for whitelisting a gauge for a pool on Balancer.fi, specifically a FOLD/WETH pair. The proposal is from Manifold Finance, a platform that provides access to high-value transaction pools through their infrastructure called SecureRPC. They aggregate multiple endpoints and mining pools. The motivation behind this proposal is to deepen liquidity as current onchain liquidity is low but volume incentives and bribes have been high in recent days.

The governance model of Manifold Finance uses an elected dictator system, where FOLD token holders delegate control to one address (the dictator) in exchange for rewards. The protocol fees are collected in a vault and distributed over time to prevent MEV attacks. They also maintain a multisig address for voting in governance proposals of other DAOs, which will be migrated to a vault-based permissive action list structure.

The pool in question has seen significant volume since its activation and currently offers a high APR. The proposal includes links to Manifold Finance's website, documentation, GitHub, forum, and Twitter for further information. However, it also mentions potential centralization risks such as the use of a centralized service for governance discussions and the presence of certain account addresses with large amounts of FOLD tokens.

Overall, the text presents a proposal to whitelist a gauge for a pool on Balancer.fi from Manifold Finance, highlighting its benefits and potential risks.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a request by THX Network to whitelist its Gnosis Safe multisig address for interaction with the veBAL contract. The purpose is to enable THX Network to lock B-80BAL-20WETH into veBAL and participate in governance and gauge voting. THX Network is a project that allows creators and communities to create and embed ERC20 and ERC721 tokens, and has received funding from the European Union's Horizon 2020 research program. The project's governance token, $THX, was launched in December 2021 using a Balancer Liquidity Bootstrapping Pool (LBP) and its main source of liquidity is on Balancer's Polygon deployment with approximately $900k TVL. The emerging DAO of THX Network is planning to diversify its treasury into BAL and participate in Balancer's governance.
label: bullish

text: This text discusses a proposal by BeethovenX to bring rETH (a token representing liquid staked ETH) to Optimism, following collaboration with Rocket Pool team. The proposal aims to ensure the price of rETH updates correctly as it earns staking revenue on Optimism. The pool parameters are identical to those on Ethereum. The text also mentions the deployment transactions and relevant links for further information about Rocket Pool, its documentation, GitHub page, and communities. The motivation behind this proposal is to capitalize on the popularity of liquid staked ETH on L2s, as it's one of their most profitable pools in terms of fees earned per dollar of emissions on Ethereum. The specifications include details about governance, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, market history, and value, with a goal to make this the highest TVL (Total Value Locked) pool for rETH on Optimism.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to convert FEI tokens into USDC in the Balancer DAO treasury. The conversion will be done through a series of transactions involving multiple contracts, including FixedPricePSM and DssPSM. The purpose is to have USDC readily available for operational expenses without needing frequent conversions. The author requests independent verification of the process before execution.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes a change in the Snapshot strategy for space-based snapshot delegation, aiming to simplify it by using only one layer of delegation instead of two. This is motivated by reasons such as ease of measurement, flexibility for vlAURA holders, and potential use with voting marketplaces. The risk involved is minimal as the new strategy has been tested thoroughly. The current strategy uses three sub-strategies, while the proposed strategy simplifies it by changing the vlAURA parts to map the vlAURA balance directly to the underlying veBAL balance, allowing vlAURA holders more flexibility in their voting power.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for the Balancer community to allocate a portion of their BAL holdings towards the Mycelium MLP liquidity pool. This move is intended to diversify the Balancer treasury, generate yield on liquid assets, and seed liquidity into Mycelium's Perpetual Swap product. The MLP pool will use BAL as collateral for leveraged traders, with a target weighting of 1%. Risks associated with this proposal include smart contract risk, oracle risk, trader profits, and single-sided asset supply. The goal is to encourage discussion within the community about this potential investment opportunity.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses Silo, a lending market that allows risk-isolated lending and borrowing of various assets. The protocol is operated as a DAO with full decentralization, using Uniswap v3 and Balancer v2 oracles for asset pricing. The governance structure includes token holders making proposals, voting on Tally, and gauging temperature through snapshot votes. The SILO:ETH Balancer pool will receive incentives to build a primary source of liquidity for the token, as it is more widely integrated by price and DEX aggregators compared to the current SILO:FRAX v2 gauge. The text also mentions an upcoming proposal to allocate ~130k vlCVX to incentivize the SILO:ETH Balancer pool.
label: neutral

text:
The case study presented here compares the performance of the Balancer Automated Market Maker (BAL) pool on Multichain and hypothetically on Across, a cross-chain liquidity protocol.

In the Multichain BAL pool, there were 34 transfers over a period of 53 days, with 14 withdrawals. The sizes of the 6 largest withdrawals ranged from 12,323 to 1,339 BAL, and the other 8 were less than 1,000 BAL. The pool is now effectively shut down due to low liquidity (only 484 BAL available).

If Balancer were using Across, all 14 withdrawals would have been completed without issue, and the relayer would have been rebalanced within 2-4 hours, ready for more transfers. For 12 of the 14 transfers, users would have received their BAL on Ethereum in 1-4 minutes. For the two largest transfers, it would have taken 2-4 hours. Over the 53 days, the Across LP would have been replenished approximately 7 times, allowing for significantly higher volumes of transactions compared to Multichain.

The Balancer treasury currently holds 80k BAL in Multichain. If they switched to Across, the treasury could take back 40,000 tokens, support over five times the volume at a fraction of the cost, and maintain operational status. The fees on Across are approximately 0.12%, compared to a 12% fee (100x more) on Multichain for moving 100 BAL from Ethereum to Multichain. If Balancer treasury wanted Across to have a fee of 0.10% or lower, they could specify a lower LP fee.

Across has three fees: the LP Fee (configurable via a rate model), the Relayer Fee, and the Destination Gas Fee. The total Across fee mentioned earlier is approximately 0.12%, which is the sum of the LP Fee and the Relayer Fee. This number will be higher when going to Ethereum due to gas costs that scale up quickly as a percentage of the transfer amount for smaller transfers.
label: neutral

text: The text suggests a proposal to end support for FEI liquidity with BAL emissions due to uncertainty about FEI's future, as Tribe DAO is proposing to close operations. The action involves interacting with an AuthorizerAdaptor and calling 'performAction'.
label: neutral

text:
Here is a summary of the functions and their parameters related to Optimism Composable and Optimism Linear contracts:

1. **Optimism Composable**
    - `stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`: Function to stop the amplification parameter update, with no parameters.
    - `setTokenRateCacheDuration`: Function to set the token rate cache duration, with no parameters.
    - `pause`: Function to pause the contract, with no parameters.
    - `unpause`: Function to unpause the contract, with no parameters.

2. **Optimism Linear**
    - `setSwapFeePercentage`: Function to set the swap fee percentage, with no parameters.
    - `setTargets`: Function to set targets for the linear market, with no parameters.
    - `pause`: Function to pause the contract, with no parameters.
    - `unpause`: Function to unpause the contract, with no parameters.

The addresses provided are the function selectors for these functions in the respective contracts on the Optimism network. The address `0x09Df1626110803C7b3b07085Ef1E053494155089` is common to both contracts, indicating they are deployed by the same account. The other address `0xd4c87b33afcE39F1E3F4aF1ce8fFFF7241d9128B` appears to be a timestamper contract on Optimism.
label: neutral

text:
1. The address `0xacAaC3e6D6Df918Bf3c809DFC7d42de0e4a72d4C`, which is the `ProtocolFeePercentagesProvider` on Optimism, will be granted the roles for setting swap fee and flash loan fee on the `ProtocolFeeCollector`. This transaction will be initiated by the Authorizer at address `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`.

2. The DAO Multisig at address `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will be granted the role for calling `setFeeTypePercentage` on the `ProtocolFeePercentagesProvider`. This transaction will also be initiated by the Authorizer at address `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`.

3. The DAO Multisig at address `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will call the function `setFeeTypePercentage` on the `ProtocolFeePercentagesProvider` at address `0xacAaC3e6D6Df918Bf3c809DFC7d42de0e4a72d4C`. This transaction will set the fee on yield to 50%, which corresponds to the `Yield` fee type. The new value will be `500000000000000000`, or 50%.
label: neutral

text:
This proposal outlines the migration of gauges for three pools in Ethereum, Polygon (1), and Polygon (137) networks. The DAO Multisig will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptor to kill the existing gauges and deploy new ones.

The current gauges associated with the specified pools will be terminated three voting epochs after this proposal's approval, allowing for adequate time for liquidity migration. The new gauges will take effect as soon as possible, applying BIP-19 core pool incentives to the new pool addresses. All transactions will be executed by the LM Multisig and DAO Multisig as needed.

The risks associated with this migration include potential vulnerabilities in the new contracts under audit and inefficient liquidity migration that could impact overall revenue of the Protocol. However, the complexity of the updates is relatively low, making it a worthwhile step forward for Balancer, showcasing its commitment to facilitating liquidity provision and swapping on yield-bearing assets. The process will last several weeks to ensure a gradual transition and minimize any impact on LPs.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to allocate Balancer Protocol's treasury liquidity to Aave markets on Ethereum and Polygon. The motivation is to diversify the treasury, earn Aave, and potentially increase returns with minimal downside due to smart contract deployment longevity. However, there is a risk associated with smart contract usage as reported by DeFi Safety. If approved, the BAL would be sent to a multisig address and deposited equally on each network's Aave market.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the proposal to enable cross-chain gauges on Balancer using the LayerZero protocol, an omnichain interoperability messaging system. This move aims to maximize veBAL utility across networks by incentivizing BAL locking for LPs deploying capital on various chains. LayerZero is currently live on multiple chains and offers a secure and credible solution for cross-chain interactions. If approved, BalancerDAO will collaborate with LayerZero Labs for development work to integrate the protocol, potentially expanding use cases beyond cross-chain gauges.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to grant the DAO Multisig the ability to call a function in the Optimism network, enabling timely distribution of incentives. This function is currently only accessible by the AuthorizerAdaptor on Polygon and Arbitrum. The role to be granted is verified in the Balancer Labs monorepo, and the corresponding Gnosis Safe has the same owners as the mainnet multisig mentioned in a previous proposal.
label: neutral

text:
1. Improve the reliability and security of the Balancer app:
   - Implement End-to-End (E2E) tests for critical functionality.
   - Increase unit test coverage and improve existing ones.
   - Keep app dependencies up to date.

2. Ensure seamless cross-chain compatibility:
   - Consolidate all networks into a single domain (app.balancer.fi) with network switching capabilities.
   - Make it easy to add new chains by adding a config file.

3. Provide better statistics and information to users:
   - Improve Balancer APRs, graphs, and other investment performance data.
   - Support pools and tokens that generate yield or rebase in various ways.

4. Implement new features from the Balancer Ecosystem:
   - Single asset investing, withdrawing into boosted pools, managed pools etc.
   - Continually refine these features based on user feedback.

5. Adhere to the DAOs Code of Conduct and Accountability Guidelines.

6. Engagement period and budget:
   - One year from July 2022 through June 2023, divided into four quarters.
   - Requests for USDC transfers and a BAL transfer are outlined in the provided table.

The proposed budget is divided among various expense categories, including people costs (engineering), infrastructure, marketing, legal, and compliance fees. The budget is subject to change via snapshot vote if necessary.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal for re-whitelisting the CREAM<>WETH pool gauge, citing historical precedents and perceived inconsistencies in the BalancerDAO governance process. The author argues that a previous vote to "kill" the gauge was reversed without sufficient reasoning, creating a problematic precedent. They request a new vote to re-establish the CREAM<>WETH gauge, citing similarities with a previous vote and considering the reversal of the initial vote as a valid precedent. The proposal includes technical specifications for implementing the change and outlines potential risks associated with the BalancerDAO governance process.
label: neutral
neutral
neutral

A proposal is made to increase the quorum to address this issue, with openness to discussion on the appropriate level of increase. The author acknowledges their personal trust in the individual but believes the current quorum is inadequate due to its lack of effectiveness.

text: The text presents a proposal to add a gauge for MAI/USDC on Ethereum. MAI is described as a decentralized stablecoin overcollateralized by various assets, currently the top external use case for BAL on Polygon. The proposal aims to capture volume from whales bridging in and out of Ethereum. The protocol uses Chainlink oracles, has been audited twice, and is controlled by a DAO. The proposed gauge will be the only initial incentivized liquidity on Ethereum for MAI. The sentiment of the text is positive and informative, presenting an opportunity to increase volume and capture whale activity on Ethereum through the addition of a new gauge for MAI/USDC.

text: The text discusses Xave Finance, a platform designed to help financial service companies utilize DeFi for practical applications such as real-time remittance transfers and high-yield consumer savings. It achieves this by creating an FX accurate Automated Market Maker (AMM) through a custom "FXPool" and eventually a stablecoin lending market that shares liquidity with the Balancer V2 Vault via a BoostedFXPool. The primary motivation is to enable liquid FX trades, instant on-chain cross-border remittance, and sustainable fee generation for the BalancerDAO. The text also mentions governance, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, tokens, and value related details.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to prevent DAOs from freely transferring their locked veBAL positions. The concern is that if contracts can lock and transfer veBAL, it may undermine the concept of locking in the first place. A solution suggested is to deny further relocking of veBAL from TribeDAO's contract, allowing them to continue receiving rewards and boosting LP positions but preventing free transfer. The author invites opinions on this topic to establish a precedent for handling contract-locked veBAL positions transfers.
label: neutral

text:

text:
This proposal outlines the process for killing current Gauges and activating new ones across multiple networks (Ethereum, Polygon, and Arbitrum). Here's a summary:

1. The DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptor` (0x8F42aDBbA1B16EaAE3BB5754915E0D06059aDd75) to kill current Gauges associated with specific pools. This will result in 5 transactions.
   - Ethereum (1): bb-a-USD  0x68d019f64A7aa97e2D4e7363AEE42251D08124Fb
   - Polygon (137): BPSP (USDC/DAI/miMATIC/USDT) - 0xFBf87D2C22d1d298298ab5b0Ec957583a2731d15
   - Polygon (137): B-stMATIC-STABLE - 0xc3bB46B8196C3F188c6A373a6C4Fde792CA78653
   - Polygon (137): B-MaticX-STABLE - 0xf01541837CF3A64BC957F53678b0AB113e92911b
   - Arbitrum (42161): VST-USDC-USDT-DAI-BSP - 0xB0de49429fBb80c635432bbAD0B3965b28560177

2. New Gauges will be activated for all pools except the VST stable pool (0x7bceaa9c5e7f4836fec3bce2d5346637c9b13970). These new Gauges will be incentivized as core pools outlined in BIP-19.

3. The transactions to activate the new Gauges will be executed by the LM Multisig via the gaugeAdder V2 (0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860).

4. The current gauges will be killed 3 voting epochs after this proposal's approval, allowing adequate time for liquidity to migrate to the new pools.

5. The next round of BIP-19 core pool incentives will apply to the new pool addresses respectively.

6. All transactions will be executed by the LM Multisig to approve the new gauges, and all transactions to kill the obsolete gauges will be executed by the DAO Multisig.
label: neutral

text:
1. **Lending Market:** Inverse Finance's new lending market is set to release later this year after audits and will utilize ChainLink price oracles. The old lending market has been disabled since June 2022 with no current plans to re-enable.

2. **Audits:** Audit reports can be found at [this link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LWNG08mib2GcI1WqnMt5IdFoW73QU2F8/view?usp=sharing) and an audit of relevant legacy code is in progress. The DAO also has a dedicated Risk Working Group overseeing security practices, more information can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/blog/posts/en-US/Introducing%20the%20Inverse%20Finance%20Risk%20Working%20Group).

3. **Centralization vectors:** The protocol has certain centralized components, such as Multisig wallets for various working groups (Treasury Working Group, Risk Working Group, Policy Committee, and Fed Chair) that have limited allowances to carry out specific tasks. However, all privileges can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance. DOLA stablecoin is fully decentralized with no possibility to pause or blacklist addresses.

4. **Market History:** DOLA stablecoin was launched in February 2021 and has shown resilience in maintaining its USD peg even during times of extreme stress. The DOLA-3Pool experienced bank runs twice, on April 2nd and June 16th, causing brief depegging events.

5. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for INV on decentralized exchanges.

6. **Expected Value Add to Balancer:** The pool can generate consistent fees as it serves as the primary source of liquidity for INV on decentralized exchanges. [Direct link to the pool](https://app.balancer.finance/#/pools/0x8312b4f6e75c9a9d7b046b63fa26280f96804abf) and [gauge link](https://app.balancer.finance/#/governance/gauges).
label: neutral

It is launched collaboratively by TRON DAO Reserve and top-tier blockchain institutions, running on the TRON network but also accessible through cross-chain protocols like Ethereum and BNB Chain. The USDD Protocol's Peg Stability Module (PSM) allows for stable and fee-free swaps between USDD and USDT at a 1:1 ratio, helping maintain the USDD price close to $1 USD during demand surges.

The text also mentions Balancer, an automated portfolio manager, with veBAL gauge added to attract more liquidity from the USDD community. The pool owner is set up as the Balancer DAO governance, and audits have been conducted by SlowMist. The token is not upgradeable or pausable, and the team behind it is known and accountable for any abuse. The pool has already been set on various platforms like Curve, Convex, Ellipsis, SUN.io, and JustLend DAO, with trading available on UniSwap, Curve, Ellipsis, PancakeSwap, SUN.io, and SunSwap as well.

text:
The text discusses a proposed policy change for projects building on Balancer regarding paying protocol fees to the Balancer DAO. The key points are:

1. Balancer DAO should only receive fees if the integrator is also making fees, to avoid stifling traction and growth.
2. Integrators can discuss and agree with Balancer DAO on the percentage of protocol fees they pay to Balancer protocol, considering the specifics of their project.
3. Integrators can add a "kill-switch" to protect themselves from being rug-pulled by Balancer governance.
4. The benefits of paying fees to Balancer include active support, inclusion in the Balancer SDK, SOR (smart order router), and subgraph, and streamlined integration with leading liquidity aggregators.
5. A new fee provider, ProtocolFeePercentagesProvider, has been deployed to manage the agreed-upon fees between Balancer DAO and integrators.
6. The kill-switch can be implemented by integrators in a way that avoids two SLOADS, with control over setting the kill-switch lying completely with the integrator.
7. Fairness across different integrators and handling of integrators that have already deployed code and are paying fees are open questions for future work.

The sentiment of the text is informative and proposes a change in policy to make Balancer more attractive as a destination for AMM innovation and protocols creating other non-AMM programmable liquidity solutions, while ensuring fairness across different integrators.
label: neutral

text:
Inverse Finance is preparing to launch a new lending market later this year, following audits and using ChainLink price oracles. The old lending market has been disabled since June 2022 with no current plans to re-enable. Inverse DAO has established partnerships with security firms Peckshield and Defimoon for audits, and a Risk Working Group has been formed to oversee risk management.

The DAO has multiple multisig wallets for different working groups, each with limited roles and allowances that can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance. text:
The proposal outlines a partnership between Balancer DAO and Karpatkey DAO, where Karpatkey will manage a portion of Balancer's funds using a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) model. The metrics included in the portfolio management include Portfolio Summary, Revenues, Positions, Loans Management, Portfolio details, Improvement Proposals, and Incentives program.

Karpatkey will charge a yearly management fee of 0.5% and a monthly performance fee of 20% of the yield obtained during the last month in BAL tokens, with a vesting period of 1 year. The agreement can be terminated by either party with notice, and Karpatkey will be entitled to an exit fee if terminated without proper notice.

The funds will always remain in Balancer's possession, and Karpatkey is not responsible for any loss due to hacks, attacks, or smart contract vulnerabilities. The plan is subject to discussion and may need to be adjusted based on legal, regulatory, or technical developments.

Karpatkey will operate within the boundaries set by Balancer DAO, without needing a DAO-wide vote for each trade. Alternatively, at least one trusted signer appointed by Balancer can approve each transaction. The proposal emphasizes risk management and has a multi-level approach to curate yield strategies, assess protocols, and carry out transactions safely.
label: neutral

text:
1. Centralization Vectors: The token is not upgradeable or pausable, the owner has limited minting capabilities and no control over contract blacklisting, and the team behind the token has a clean record regarding integrity in building TempleDAO.

2. Market History: TempleDAO initiated its token presale in October 2021, with public trading starting on its own custom AMM on December 19, 2021. It currently has partnerships with major protocols like Convex, Yearn, Aura, Frax, and Balancer.

3. Value Statement and Conclusion: TempleDAO has been a significant adopter of Balancer technology, generating volume on the Balancer platform through its LBP buyback program. It has also provided bribes for veBAL holders to deepen its liquidity pool. If the 50/50 TEMPLE/bb-a-USD pool becomes whitelisted for BAL rewards, it would continue to promote trading, bribing, LP farming activity on Balancer, and in particular bb-a-USD liquidity paired against TEMPLE.

4. Contract Addresses: The address for the TEMPLE/bb-a-USD 50/50 Weighted Pool is `0x173063A30E095313eEe39411f07E95A8a806014e`. The gauge with a 10% emissions cap is at `0x973fb174Cdf9b1652e4213125a186f66684D899c`.

text:
The text presents a proposal for a Whitelist for a veBAL voting gauge associated with the WETH-T Pool Gauge on Ethereum, which has a 2% emissions cap. The proposal is from Threshold Network, a decentralized network formed in 2022 by the merger of NuCypher and Keep. Threshold provides cryptography primitives for data privacy, access controls, condition-based encryption, and cross-chain asset bridges.

The motivation behind this proposal is to attract more users to provide liquidity, boosting the pool's liquidity and helping Threshold establish itself as a significant participant in the Balancer ecosystem. The proposed gauge would earn BAL, which would benefit the pool and the network. The text also mentions the upcoming tBTCv2 bridge, a trust-minimized Bitcoin bridge that allows BTC holders to participate in DeFi on Ethereum.

The governance of Threshold Network is handled by its DAO, with T token holders making decisions through Governor Bravo votes, snapshot votes, and forum proposals. The protocol has undergone audits by ChainSecurity and Certik. There are no significant centralization vectors in the protocol, with upgradeable contracts controlled via Governor Bravo and an emergency veto power held by the Threshold Council multisig in case of malicious proposals.

The asset has displayed volatility comparable to similar assets of similar market cap and depth, with the primary source of liquidity for T being Curve. The Balancer pool is currently the second largest source of liquidity for the token after Curve. The proposed gauge has a 2% emissions cap (0x7Fc115BF013844D6eF988837F7ae6398af153532).

Now, Symmetric aims to expand onto the Celo network and become one of the top three DEXs by the end of 2023. If successful, SYMM tokens will be distributed to BalancerDAO and veBAL holders as a gesture for becoming the Friendly Fork on Celo. The motivation behind this move is the growing interest in the Celo ecosystem, with projects like Toucan protocol and Uniswap moving onto Celo, and PrimeDAO launching a DeFi Launchpad program on Celo.

text:
1. Action #1 - "Collect Fees": This action involves collecting fees from various DEXs, including Uniswap, Sushiswap, and Balancer. The collected fees are then converted to USDC.

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum
   - Automatic execution: Yes, by Mimic bot when the total value of fees exceeds a certain threshold. Manual execution is also possible by the Manager.
   - Primitives: Includes functions for calling external contract functions (withdrawCollectedFees from ProtocolFeesCollector), swapping tokens at the best rate, and transferring USDC to the Smart Vault.

2. Action #2 - "Gather and convert to BAL": This action gathers BAL and BAL-like assets from the Balancer ProtocolFeesCollector and swaps them to BAL (except for BAL itself).

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes functions for calling external contract functions (withdrawCollectedFees from ProtocolFeesCollector), swapping tokens at the best rate, and transferring BAL to the Smart Vault.

3. Action #3 - "Bridge": This action bridges USDC and BAL between different networks, specifically from Polygon and Arbitrum to Mainnet.

   - Smart Vaults: Polygon and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes a bridge function for transferring assets between layers (in this case, between different blockchains).

4. Action #4 - "Withdraw": This action allows the Manager to withdraw any asset from the Smart Vault to an external wallet configured by the owner.

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes a function for transferring assets to an external address.
label: bullish

text:
1. Gnosis Chain, BSC, Avalanche, Optimism, and Transfero are the supported blockchains for jBRL and BRZ tokens. The respective addresses for each chain are provided.

2. jBRL uses BRLUSD Chainlink price feed while BRZ does not have a price feed.

3. Audits for jBRL were conducted by Jarvis, with the results available at this link: [Jarvis Audit Report](https://app.gitbook.com/o/-MlHWTFf2MofxCAFbR4l/s/-MeLxeE9i1iOeDR_J-tQ/risks-warning/audits). No audit information was provided for Transfero.

4. jBRL is mainly collateralized by USDC, while BRZ is a fiat-backed stablecoin issued by a centralized entity.

5. jBRL has been live since February 2022 on the BNB Chain and experienced issues during the FTX crisis due to supply imbalance. The issue was resolved by withdrawing jBRL from the money market, forcing users to repay their loans by buying jBRL from the Liquidity Pool. BRZ also faced peg issues due to its primary off-chain market being on FTX. Both stablecoins have maintained their peg since the pool launch.

6. The 2brl pool will act as the main route for arbitrages and provide use cases such as on-chain liquidity, credit without FX risks, etc. This is the first step towards moving the ecosystem to Balancer's.

7. Contract details:
   - 2brl Balancer Pool (Polygon): 0xE22483774bd8611bE2Ad2F4194078DaC9159F4bA
   - jBRL token (Polygon): 0xf2f77FE7b8e66571E0fca7104c4d670BF1C8d722

2. Oracles: jBRL uses the BRLUSD Chainlink price feed, whereas BRZ does not have a price feed.
3. Audits: Jarvis has conducted an audit (GitBook link provided), but there is no information about an audit for Transfero.
4. Centralizing vector: jBRL is mainly collateralized by USDC, while BRZ is a fiat-backed stablecoin issued by a centralized entity.
5. Market history: jBRL has been live since February 2022 on the BNB Chain and experienced some deviations from its peg during the FTX crisis due to supply issues. BRZ had issues with its peg because its primary off-chain market was on FTX, and it uses a wrapped BRZ from Solana. Both stablecoins have maintained their peg since the pool launch (on the BNB).
6. Value: The 2brl-bb-am-usd pool will act as the main secondary liquidity source for BRZ and jBRL, producing a higher natural yield for its LP due to its role in arbitrage and other use cases. This move is the first step toward moving the ecosystem to Balancer.

text: The text discusses a proposal to reconcile the state of Balancer's Gauge system, which was intended to remove unused pools. A total of 9 active gauges were found that should have been removed according to BIP-120 but were missed. To rectify this, the DAO Multisig will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptor` and call `performAction` using the kill_gauge command for each of the 9 active contracts listed in the text. The aim is to remove these remaining active gauges from the system.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the creation of a pool on Balancer, which includes two boosted stable pool tokens: bb-a-USD and bb-a-TUSD. This pool is more efficient for TrueUSD as it has previously deployed liquidity with Balancer. The pool will earn yield on both boosted portions, making the token pairing more efficient for both parties. The gauge will be a "core pool" under BIP-19, meaning protocol fees earned by this pool will be used to bribe for votes on it. The gauge can be uncapped based on the nature of the pool and market cap of TrueUSD. This move is part of Balancer's strategy to dominate the yield bearing token space and increase capital efficiency. USDC and TUSD are centralized and do not have a governance forum, but this implementation will draw in new volume and showcase the power of these pool types.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the creation of a new pool on Balancer protocol, which includes two boosted stable tokens: bb-a-USDC and bb-a-FRAX. This pool is beneficial for both Frax and Balancer as it allows for increased efficiency and yield earning opportunities. The pool will be governed under BIP-19, allowing Balancer to earn fees from the pool and use them to incentivize TVL growth. The gauge can potentially be uncapped based on the nature of the pool and market cap of FRAX. The text also mentions the governance, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, market history, and value associated with USDC and FRAX.
label: neutral

text:
1. The `TimelockAuthorizer` address can be found in its deployment on the Balancer Labs GitHub repository.

2. The `claimRoot` function cannot be called until January 5th, 2023.

3. Any account in the network can call `finalizeMigration` on the `TimelockAuthorizerMigrator` to complete the process once the two steps mentioned above are done.

4. No new permissions will be granted after the migration, but any permissions granted after Nov 30th will have to be re-granted post-migration.

5. The following actions have initial delays associated with them:
   - `Vault.setAuthorizer`, 30 days
   - `SmartWalletChecker.allowlistAddress`, 7 days
   - `VotingEscrowDelegationProxy.setDelegation`, 14 days
   - `GaugeAdder.addGaugeFactory`, 14 days
   - `BalancerTokenAdmin.mint`, 30 days
   - `ProtocolFeesCollector.withdrawCollectedFees`, 30 days
   - `GaugeController.addGauge`, 14 days
   - `BALTokenHolder.withdrawFunds`, 7 days
   - Vault relayer permissions, 7 days

6. The creation of the full list of permissions and their delays can be inspected in this script.

7. The `TimelockAuthorizer` is a complex contract that will manage all permissions on the Balancer ecosystem, including the Liquidity Mining program and management of Protocol Fees. It has been audited by ABDK and is currently being reviewed by Certora.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses an upgrade to the boost delegation system within the veBAL liquidity mining program. The current system is considered complex and limited in use cases, so a new contract called VeBoostV2 has been developed for simplification and increased compatibility. This new contract is already being used by Curve and supports EIP 1271 for delegation of boosts. Users can migrate existing boosts to the new system, and any newly created boosts can be permissionlessly migrated as well. The upgrade requires permission from the Governance DAO Multisig and has been in use by Curve since July 19th, 2022, with minimal modifications made by Balancer Labs.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to authorize the PoolRecoveryHelper contract to place ComposableStable-V2 pools in Recovery Mode. This is due to an issue where rate providers can cause operations to revert, which goes undetected by most order routing algorithms. To prevent such pools from interfering with these algorithms, the PoolRecoveryHelper contract has been developed. It checks all rate providers of a given pool and puts it in Recovery Mode if one reverts. When a pool enters Recovery Mode, it forfeits any protocol fees owed at that time, and a new exit kind is enabled to bypass updating the rate cache. The PoolRecoveryHelper contract can only interact with pools deployed from a set of factories, which now includes the ComposableStable-V2 pool factory. Balancer Labs has been granted the ability to add/remove factories from this set, as per a previous proposal.
label: neutral

text:
The ReserveLending Core is a decentralized, overcollateralized Pool-to-Peer lending and borrowing protocol owned by Residual, based on Compound Protocol. It's non-custodial, permissionless, and users can access it through various front-ends (interfaces).

Residual provides a front-end to the Core (ReserveLending) and offers licenses to third parties (Licensees), who can customize their interfaces for seamless integration with their existing branded ecosystems. Residual will build, maintain, and not charge development or maintenance fees for these customized front-ends.

The accumulated reserves from the Core are allocated between rewards for Licensees and licensing fees collected by Residual Token, Inc. (aka unFederalReserve). Rewards for Licensees are based on the percentage of total TVL borrowed through their front-end, with greater amounts borrowed resulting in higher rewards.

Licensees benefit from hosting a Core front-end by receiving rewards, avoiding out-of-pocket licensing and whitelisting fees, no development or maintenance charges, expanded product offerings, reduced need to build similar platforms, increased security due to the Core's extensive audits, and in-house access to the Core, eliminating the need for users to visit third-party lending services.
label: neutral

text:
Here is a summary of the proposed budget for the Balancer Grants program:

- Q1 Grants: 70k BAL ($350k USD) to be distributed based on milestones following the full review process.
- Grant Co-Leads: $5k x 2 x 3 months (6,000 BAL) for managing the grant processes and coordinating with Committee Members.
- Committee Members: $1.75k average x 5 x 3 months (5,250 BAL) to support and review grantees, as well as mentor them.
- Fjord Top Up: 19,310 BAL ($77k USD) to account for the drop in BAL price since approval.
- Other Program Expenses: 600 BAL for any additional expenses required for the smooth execution of the grants program.
- Uncommitted Treasury: 16,369 BAL including Fjord overrun.

The total request for the quarter is 84,791 BAL. The Grant DAO service provider agrees to operate under the Balancer DAO's Code of Conduct and Accountability Guidelines. The funds will be sent to the Grants Treasury (0xE2c91f3409Ad6d8cE3a2E2eb330790398CB23597) and delegated to grantees by the Grants Committee multi-sig. The current treasury balance is ~178,807 BAL + 22,078 USDC, with a committed BAL of ~162,438 BAL + 20,000 USDC and an uncommitted BAL in the treasury of 16,369 BAL + 2,078 USDC.
label: neutral

text:
1. Governance: The Maxis serve on the Governance Council, participate in Discord and Forum discussions, act as delegates, advise projects on Balancer's governance process, manage the Governance Forum, and pursue strategic initiatives such as BIP-19. They ensure proposals are put up for a vote according to schedule and executed upon approval.

2. Partnerships: The Maxis manage Balancer's Discord, help projects use Balancer, deploy new pools, whitelist and maintain token lists, UI test for Balancer, seek out new opportunities in DeFi, manage relationships with partners, and coordinate partner needs with other teams in the Balancer ecosystem. They aim to expand boosted pool offerings, encourage adoption of ve80/20 or similar systems, and increase utilization of the veBAL flywheel.

3. Community: The Maxis manage a monthly Coordinape circle open to all DAO contributors, provide an onboarding framework for new contributors, and handle offboarding for contributors transitioning from the DAO or between SPs. They aim to retain talents in the Balancer ecosystem as Ballers, Grantees, or shaping their own Service Provider.

4. Record Keeping: The Maxis will maintain a Notion page detailing the activity of each controlled multisig and provide documentation on how to use the powers of the multisig for future SPs.

5. Length of Engagement & Budget: 3 months, with a budget of 10,800 BAL per month for salaries (1,800 per person), additional monthly allocations of 200 BAL for gas costs and 5,000 BAL for Coordinape. The total for the 3-month engagement is 48,000 BAL.

6. Impact on the Treasury: Funding the Balancer Maxis for Q4 would cost around 1% of the treasury's BAL holdings, which annualizes to ~4% of the treasury's BAL.

7. ETH Address to Receive Funds: 0x166f54F44F271407f24AA1BE415a730035637325

8. Link to SLA (if going through the Foundation): N/A
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for a new program within the Balancer ecosystem aimed at incentivizing the adoption of ve8020 systems, which involve locking 80/20 BPT tokens. This program offers BAL grants to projects meeting certain TVL and revenue milestones, approved by Balancer governance vote. The benefits are intended to drive high TVL and protocol revenue for Balancer. The proposed milestones offer increasing BAL grants as the TVL and revenue of the participating projects grow significantly over time. The program aims to encourage ve8020 adoption in 2023, with annual renewal requirements for continued participation.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to add a gauge for an RBN/USDC pool on Ethereum, primarily by Ribbon Finance migrating liquidity from Uniswap v2/v3 pools to a Balancer pool. If approved, the Ribbon DAO will provide incentives in the form of 25,000 RBN bi-weekly for two months as voting incentives. The pool is proposed as a "core pool" under BIP-19 due to its significance and potential for generating swap fees. The RBN token is the governance token for the Ribbon Finance protocol, which offers decentralized options vaults for various assets, with TVL of ~$60M. The incentives are expected to be more capital efficient than typical liquidity mining due to Aura Finance's boosted BAL emissions and supplemental AURA emissions.
label: neutral

text:
The Hats.finance platform's Vaults contract has been reviewed by DefiMoon, a boutique auditing firm serving as Inverse Finance's official security partner. DefiMoon has also played a role in the deployment of various Fed products like FraxBP Fed, Aura Fed, and Velo Fed. Following a price manipulation incident, PeckShield was hired to audit the renewed INV oracle and the bad debt repayment product.

The Inverse Finance DAO has formed dedicated teams to oversee risk, known as the Risk Working Group. The Treasury Working Group, Policy Committee, Fed Chair, and other working groups have Multisig wallets with limited roles and allowances that can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance.

Inverse Finance DAO launched DOLA stablecoin in February 2021. Despite two bank runs on April 2nd and June 16th due to oracle exploits, DOLA's Fed mechanics have proven resilient at maintaining its USD peg. The deepest liquidity pool for DOLA is currently DOLA/FRAXBP on Curve with a TVL of ~$28m.
label: neutral

text: The text presents a proposal from an individual named Andrew Forman, offering to conduct a 3-month research project and develop a project management framework for Balancer, a decentralized finance platform. The goal is to understand the needs and challenges of web3 developers and projects that could benefit from Balancer technology, and to create a report detailing market analysis, customer needs, and value proposition opportunities. Additionally, Andrew aims to define an operating framework for cross-service provider project management. The proposal includes a payment structure in BAL and USDC, and contact information for the individual. Overall, the sentiment is professional, collaborative, and solution-oriented.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses the enablement of a gauge on the wUSDR bb-am-usd Stable pool, which is backed by tokenized Real Estate and offers an 8-10% yield. This stablecoin, called Real USD (USDR), was created by Tangible, a RWA tokenization protocol. The text highlights two competitive advantages: the rental yield paid out daily to holders and the potential appreciation of the backing Real Estate. The USDR has only been around for a few months but is looking to grow deep liquidity, with Balancer's mechanism for automatically bribing pools being particularly appealing due to its potential to highlight the structural advantages of backing a stablecoin with yield-producing Real Estate. The text also mentions governance, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, market history, and value, but these details are not extensively discussed.

text:

  4. Oracles: jEUR uses EURUSD and computed ETHUSD (ETHUSD / EURUSD) Chainlink price feed; PAR uses EURUSD, Chainlink price feed.

text:
This text appears to discuss the deployment of a new 2 EUR stablecoin pool on various blockchain networks, including Polygon, Ethereum, Gnosis Chain, Binance Smart Chain, Avalanche, and Optimism. The pool will be either a single pool with multiple assets (2 EUR - bb-am-usd) or a multi-currency pool (2 EUR - 2 EUR - 2 EUR - 2 EUR - bb-am-usd), depending on the liquidity and risk tolerance of the liquidity providers (LPs).

The governance for these pools will be handled differently based on the platform:
- Jarvis has no on-chain governance, with decisions being executed through a  multi-sig.
- Angle Protocol uses a 4/6 multisig and does not currently have on-chain governance.

The pools will use Chainlink price feeds for EURUSD and computed ETHUSD and EURMAI (ETHUSD / EURUSD and EURUSD * MAIUSD) for jEUR, while agEUR uses only the EURUSD Chainlink price feed.

The pools will be audited by Jarvis (https://learn.jarvis.network/risks-warning/audits) and Angle (https://docs.angle.money/resources/audits).

The centralizing vector for these pools is that jEUR is mainly collateralized by USDC, while bridged agEUR is partially collateralized by USDC.

These pools have been live since August 2021 (for jEUR) and have never traded off their peg. The purpose of the pools is to act as a main route for arbitrages and to facilitate on-chain liquidity, credit without FX risks, etc.

The contracts for the 2 EUR Balancer Pool (Polygon), jEUR token (Polygon), jEUR Synthereum Liquidity Pool, agEUR token (Polygon), and Gauge are provided in the text.
label: neutral

The current pool is not properly compensating the DAO for fees generated, leading to the activation of recovery mode and streaming BAL incentives without proper compensation. The new pool will activate its gauge and kill the current pool's gauge to encourage migration of liquidity. cbETH and wstETH are liquid staking derivatives from Coinbase and Lido respectively, each with their own governance, oracles, audits, centralization risks, market history, and value details provided. The links to the pool, gauge, killing current gauge, and relevant addresses are also included. The sentiment of the text is informative and action-oriented, discussing a proposal for pool migration in a DeFi context.

The current pool is not properly compensating the DAO due to recovery mode activation, causing it to stream BAL incentives without fair compensation. The new pool will activate its gauge and kill the current pools gauge to encourage migration of liquidity to the preferred pool. text: Xave Finance, a new DeFi platform, aims to integrate decentralized finance (DeFi) into financial services companies for real-time remittance transfers and high-yield consumer savings. The platform achieves this by creating an FX accurate Automated Market Maker (AMM) via the custom "FXPool" and eventually a stablecoin lending market. This will enable liquid FX trades, particularly for cross-border remittances between Europe and Asia. Xave seeks to work with the BalancerDAO to incentivize this initial pool with BAL rewards towards real-world DeFi use cases. The platform is currently governed via Snapshot, with plans to deploy its own governance structure later. It utilizes Chainlink oracles for FX accurate swaps and has undergone audits. The platform aims to minimize centralization vectors while ensuring efficient market operations.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes to enable Balancer gauges for two new pools on the Ethereum network, specifically an SD-USDC pool and an 80% SD - 20% WETH pool. These pools are intended to deepen liquidity for the SD token, support low slippage transactions, and provide low impermanent loss for liquidity providers. Stader Labs has a partnership with Balancer DAO and has already established two pools on the platform. The proposal aims to incentivize liquidity through bribes and could potentially drive value to Balancer through trading volume and rewards to veBAL holders via bribes. The SD token is currently live since March 2022, with a significant trading volume across various exchanges and DEXes. The proposal includes two votes for the creation of these pools.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a vote on four proposals regarding the distribution of protocol revenue in a DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization). The options include changing the revenue split to 50/50, selling 250k BAL for USDC via OTC within 30 days, raising 1.5M USDC via Arbor bonds using BAL from the treasury as collateral, or requiring more discussion before making a decision. The winning proposal will be determined by the percentage of votes each option receives. If "More Discussion" wins, the community will continue to discuss the topic in an RFC thread and re-assess the current state of affairs by the end of July.
label: neutral

text:
1. The Snapshot poster is responsible for creating a Snapshot proposal with the following details:
   - A link to the transaction payload PR on GitHub. (If the proposal requires no on-chain actions, the payload is not required.)
   - The full text of the BIP. If it's too long, it can be truncated.
   - A link to the forum discussion (optional)
   - The title should follow the format "BIP-[XXX] Title from Forum" where XXX is the next number in the BIP sequence.
   - The Original Forum Poster should update their post to match the title from the snapshot and include a link to it at the bottom of the body of the Forum Post.
   - The vote type should be "Basic Voting" with choices being [**Yes, lets do it** - **No, This is not the way** - **Abstain**].
   - The proposal should run for 96 hours starting on a Thursday (GMT).
   - It requires a quorum of 2 million veBAL.

2. If the BIP passes, the Balancer Maxis will make every effort to confirm that the payload and the English definitions match, load the specified payloads into the appropriate multisig, and coordinate with signers for execution. They will also comment on the forum post for the proposal and include a link to any transactions relevant to execution at the bottom of the body.

3. The Maxis may send the proposal back to the proposer for revision and a new snapshot (with the same BIP number) for the following reasons:
   - The Payload does not match the English specification
   - The Payload is not in a recognisable/verifiable form by the Maxis.
   - The Payload does not simulate successfully in tenderly and/or produce the desired results on fork. In this case, the Maxis will help to fix the payload and facilitate a revote to approve.
   - The snapshot did not conform to the guidelines defined above.

4. The Gov Council is dissolved with this vote.

5. If this vote passes, the proposal validation setting in the balancer snapshot space settings should be configured according to the provided technical specifications.

6. Over the next week or two, the community will discuss and adapt the text of this BIP. Resources explaining Balancer On-chain Governance will be created and linked in the forum post as they become available.

7. It would be helpful to work with some Governance Proposers to demonstrate the new BIP format in upcoming governance. If youre interested, please get in touch via this forum or the Balancer Discord.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes depositing additional BAL tokens into Aave Polygon v3 to earn yield, utilizing currently idle funds in the Balancer Treasury. The proposal builds on a previous one (BIP-52) and suggests depositing 44.5k BAL into the Polygon v3 deployment. This move is motivated by high BAL yields on Aave v3 and the opportunity to increase utilization of the BAL Reserve, thereby increasing yield for deposits and reducing rate variance. The proposal does not propose an increase in the SupplyCap, necessitating another proposal for additional deposits into the Reserve on Aave. Balancer's long-term view and large BAL holdings make this a manageable proposition, despite the need to consider exit liquidity requirements.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal by Ankr to create an aMaticC/Matic Gauge for the Balancer community, utilizing their liquid staking product, ankrETH. This product offers instant liquidity for staked ETH, allowing connection with DeFi platforms and earning additional rewards. Ankr is a well-established provider of RPC nodes with notable clients like Aave, 1inch, and SushiSwap, and has approximately $200M TVL across their liquid staking offering. The proposal aims to qualify ankrETH for BAL distribution by adding it as a gauge in the Balancer ecosystem, allowing it to participate in automated market-making. The technical specifications detail the steps required to add the new gauge to the Balancer controller.
label: neutral

text:
The text discusses a proposal by StaFi Contributors, with support from Aave Governance, to add a new gauge to the Aave protocol. The gauge will be used to track the performance of a specific pool in the Aave system. The proposal involves three steps:
1. Granting the DAO Multisig the necessary role to add gauges to the controller.
2. Adding the new gauge to the controller using the granted role.
3. Revoking the ability for the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller after the new gauge has been added. The proposal is being executed by the DAO Multisig 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to temporarily bypass the usual method of adding gauges due to ongoing migration to a new authorizer, and adds approved gauges directly from the DAO Multisig. This is necessary because the current process cannot accommodate this transition. A 14-day window for no new gauge additions will begin around Feb 13th. The proposal involves three transactions: one granting the DAO Multisig the ability to add gauges, and three more adding specific gauge addresses (EURS/USDC, SD/USDC, SD/WETH) to the controller using their corresponding type. After these actions, the ability for the DAO Multisig to add gauges will be revoked again.
label: neutral

text:
The DOLA/CUSD Balancer pool was recently established as a collaboration between Coin98 and Inverse Finance to introduce users to the Balancer ecosystem. Here's a summary of the steps taken:

1. The DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will grant itself the ability to directly add gauges to the controller by initiating a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6) and calling grantRole with the role for calling add_gauge on the gaugeController.

2. The DAO Multisig will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptor (0x8F42aDBbA1B16EaAE3BB5754915E0D06059aDd75) and call performAction with the GaugeController (0xC128468b7Ce63eA702C1f104D55A2566b13D3ABD). The target address is the GaugeController, and it uses 0x3a04f900 followed by the gauge address (0xFc4541437265945F13368F9F61c19dA427D41A02) and the corresponding gauge type for the data argument.

3. The DAO Multisig will remove its ability to directly add gauges to the controller by initiating a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6) and calling renounceRole with the role for calling add_gauge on the gaugeController. This step removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller.

The provided image (cusd.jpg) seems to be an IPFS link, but it's not accessible as I don't have the necessary tools to view IPFS content directly.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Balancer Governor Note Analysis Proposal

Objective & Success Metrics:
1. Surfacing on-chain metrics and protocol developments: Provide data-driven research reports to inform stakeholders about the economic, financial, and social health of Balancer. The success of this objective will be measured by the number of stakeholders reached and engaged through Messari's channels, Bloomberg Terminal, S&P Global Capital IQ, and Refinitiv.
2. Growth: Increase the exposure and professionalization of Balancer to major funds, banks, financial service companies, and large corporations worldwide. The success will be measured by the number of users consuming the information and acting on it, driving meaningful activity to the protocol.

Key Features:
1. Qualitative Analysis: In-depth analysis of governance design, structure/process, quorum, and exploration of governance opportunities. Highlight contentious proposals or noteworthy governance events.
2. Proposal Analysis: Provide a 1500-3000 word proposal-specific analysis to educate stakeholders on the impacts of important DAO proposals.

Retainer for a Balancer Governor Note:
- $80k total budget for four quarterly reports, at least one tweet on each report, and an AMA with the DAO on SP calls about quarterly take-aways and inspiration for new analysis.
- Funds will be used for research, data science and engineering, and distribution efforts.
- Payment can be made in stablecoins or BAL based on market price at time of payment (with a 5% premium to account for additional costs).

Payment Address: messari.eth
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to expand a self-insurance fund for the Balancer protocol ecosystem, primarily intended to cover unbudgeted legal and regulatory costs incurred by major participants and service providers. The Ecosystem Council, a group of active members, will delegate the task of seeking independent legal counsel to confirm the use of funds from this insurance fund. If approved, the fund will be increased by $750,000 USD, protecting a broader range of entities within the Balancer ecosystem. The funds will be managed and disbursed without additional governance votes, provided they are related to Balancer work and not covered under other insurance policies.
label: neutral

text:
This BIP (Balance Improvement Proposal) aims to enable automation for moving pools into a recovery mode, reducing risks in situations where there might be concerns about their functionality. The proposal is based on the recent experiences of some high AUM V2 pools that were in Recovery Mode due to discovered and patched reentrancy issues.

The use of recoveryMode has been shown to have no negative effects or create new risks, although it may cause minor UX problems for exiting pools and result in less revenue being earned by the DAO.

The following table provides details about the poolRecoveryHelper function calls on various pools across different networks:

| Contract Name                     | Network   | Function                  | Address (Pool Recovery Helper)                               |
|-----------------------------------|----------|---------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|
| 20230206-composable-stable-pool-v3 | mainnet  | enableRecoveryMode()      | 0x1b300C86980a5195bCF49bD419A068D98dC133Db                |
| 20230206-weighted-pool-v3          | optimism | enableRecoveryMode()      | 0x26743984e3357eFC59f2fd6C1aFDC310335a61c9                |
| 20230206-composable-stable-pool-v3 | optimism | enableRecoveryMode()      | 0x26743984e3357eFC59f2fd6C1aFDC310335a61c9                |
| 20230206-weighted-pool-v3          | polygon  | enableRecoveryMode()      | 0x495F696430F4A51F7fcB98FbE68a9Cb7A07fB1bA                |
| 20230206-composable-stable-pool-v3 | polygon  | enableRecoveryMode()      | 0x495F696430F4A51F7fcB98FbE68a9Cb7A07fB1bA                |

For more information, you can refer to the following resources:
- [Directory of Addresses used by script which generated the table and multsig payloads](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/blob/main/tools/python/brownie/helpers/addresses.py)
label: neutral

text:
1. The DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will initiate a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6), granting it the role for calling add_gauge on the GaugeController (as seen here: https://github.com/balancer-labs/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L358). This allows the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller.

2. The DAO Multisig will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptor (0x8F42aDBbA1B16EaAE3BB5754915E0D06059aDd75) and call performAction with the GaugeController (0xC128468b7Ce63eA702C1f104D55A2566b13D3ABD) for the target(address) argument. The data(bytes) argument will be 0x3a04f900 followed by the gauge address (0x56124eb16441A1eF12A4CCAeAbDD3421281b795A) and the corresponding gauge type.

3. The DAO Multisig will initiate a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6), renouncing the role for calling add_gauge on the GaugeController as seen here: https://github.com/balancer-labs/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L358). This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller.

text:
This data summarizes several transactions related to the "20230223-protocol-id-registry" deployment in the Balancer V2 monorepo, which is used for registering and renaming protocol IDs on various blockchain networks such as Optimism, Polygon, Goerli, etc.

The transactions involve two parties: Orb Collective and Balancer Maxis. When a protocol wants to get its protocolId registered, it will coordinate with the Orb Collective. The Balancer Maxis are responsible for making on-chain changes to the registry at the instructions of the Orb collective without requiring individual veBAL governance around each change.

Here's a breakdown of the transactions:

1. Optimism network: registerProtocolId and renameProtocolId transactions were executed with different protocol IDs (0x8630bf555a7a5baabd493fc2afc07b7baa6ea598eaea016acd0d926a6a6962fa and 0x5dd6754fa5d8d56f6177c0265c35ab00ee57aa8a190975f1fba56a18796f0aeb, respectively).

2. Polygon network: registerProtocolId and renameProtocolId transactions were executed with different protocol IDs (0x8f64bed4b4e908316d1d51abae6d2ca2c0f6ac132d219882be578341027b587b and 0x397a10db2c15733cdb7c0fad6226786d83e216ed46c740257186765f4018bec5, respectively).

3. Goerli network: registerProtocolId and renameProtocolId transactions were executed with different protocol IDs (0xdfc349d88d311b76af85f0bdc6a81be0e30485d488472e3813359f8e26fc1c95 and 0x397a10db2c15733cdb7c0fad6226786d83e216ed46c740257186765f4018bec5, respectively).

In summary, the Orb Collective and Balancer Maxis will work together to manage the registration and renaming of protocol IDs across various blockchain networks. The Balancer Maxis are responsible for making on-chain changes without individual veBAL governance around each change.
label: neutral

text:
Title: Balancer Governor Note Retainer Proposal

Proposal Overview:
This proposal outlines a retainer agreement for a recurring, data-driven analysis of important DAO proposals related to the Balancer protocol. The aim is to provide actionable insights to various stakeholders, enhancing their understanding of the economic, financial, and social health of Balancer.

Key Objectives & Success Metrics:
1. Surfacing on-chain metrics and protocol developments:
   - To fill the gap in long-form research and analytics within the crypto industry.
   - Reports will be distributed through Messari's channels, reaching 300,000 crypto-natives, as well as major traditional research platforms like Bloomberg Terminal, S&P Global Capital IQ, and Refinitiv.

2. Growth:
   - To professionalize Balancer to a wider audience of institutional players, driving meaningful activity to the protocol.

Success Metrics:
- Difficult to directly attribute benefits due to the nature of this proposal; however, anecdotal evidence suggests that institutional players are consuming reports on these platforms and using them as part of their diligence for capital allocation.

Length of Engagement & Budget:
- Base Quarterlies option for the current cycle:
  - $80k for 1 year
    a. 4 Quarterly reports
    b. At least one tweet on each quarterly report
    c. AMA with the DAO on SP calls about quarterly take-aways and inspiration for new analysis
    d. Open sourcing our BAL report and model

Payment:
- Stablecoins or BAL based on market price at time of payment (with a 5% premium to account for additional costs of accepting native tokens)

Funds will be allocated towards:
- Research
- Data Science and Engineering
- Distribution

ETH Address to Receive Funds: messari.eth
label: neutral

5. This gauge is a traditional gauge, not a single recipient gauge used as part of the ve80/20 program. BAL incentives will be paid out directly to addresses depositing tokens in the Balancer Gauge.

6. The pool contains a 0.5% fee with an intention to participate in the BIP-19 boosted pool program, and all fees earned by this pool are requested to be used for bribing the RDNT/WETH pool directly instead of distributing bribes by TVL as specified in BIP-19.

text:
Here is a summary of the information provided:

- The Balancer Grant DAO has different tiers for contributors based on their level of involvement and assistance provided to grantees. These tiers are Low Contributor, Medium Level Contributor, and High Contributor.
- The Low Contributor tier requires a payment of $1,250 USD in BAL and involves contributing to weekly grants meetings, following up on 1-2 grant applications, and mentoring at least one grantee with low level assistance required.
- The Medium Level Contributor tier requires a payment of $2,500 USD in BAL and involves contributing to the weekly grants meeting, following up on 2-4 grant applications, mentoring 1-2 grantees, and providing either low or high assistance as needed.
- The High Contributor tier does not have a specific monetary requirement mentioned but involves providing extensive mentorship and high levels of assistance to multiple grantees.
- The Q2 Grants budget is set at $334k USD, to be paid in BAL based on milestones achieved by grantees following the full grants review process.
- The Grant DAO service provider agrees to operate under the Balancer DAO's Code of Conduct and Accountability Guidelines. They will hold open community calls quarterly, develop a monthly report detailing key objective progress, attend and present during the Baller weekly meeting, and maintain the Medium and Notion pages for the grants program.
- The Grant treasury currently holds approximately 172,082 BAL + 20,236.61 USDC, with around 106,612 BAL + 20,000 USDC already committed to grantees. The uncommitted balance in the treasury is approximately 65,469 BAL + 236.61 USDC.
- The ETH address for receiving funds is the Grants Treasury (0xE2c91f3409Ad6d8cE3a2E2eb330790398CB23597).
label: neutral

text:
The text provides an overview of the roles and responsibilities of Maxis within the Balancer ecosystem. Maxis is involved in governance, partnerships, community management, project management, and record keeping. In terms of governance, anyone with at least 200k veBAL can now post proposals to Snapshot. Maxis acts as a verifier of last resort for multisig payloads.

In partnerships, Maxis manages Balancer's Discord, assists projects in using Balancer, deploys new pools, whitelists and maintains token lists, performs UI testing, seeks out new opportunities for Balancer technology, and manages relationships with partners across the entire lifecycle.

In community management, Maxis runs a monthly Coordinape circle, provides an onboarding framework for new contributors, and handles offboarding for contributors transitioning from the DAO or between Service Providers (SPs).

As project managers, Maxis leads weekly meetings with team leads across the ecosystem to align on projects in flight, drives the ecosystems top roadmap priorities, tracks project dependencies across teams, and coordinates among relevant parties.

In record keeping, Maxis maintains a Notion page detailing the activity of each controlled multisig and provides documentation on how to use the powers of the multisig for future SPs.

The text also includes details about the length of engagement (3 months), budget (8,550 BAL per month for salaries, with 60% max locked in veBAL by contributors, additional allocations for Coordinape, dev bounties, and gas expenses), impact on the treasury (around 1% of the treasurys BAL holdings annually), and ETH address to receive funds (0x166f54F44F271407f24AA1BE415a730035637325). There is no link to an SLA as it's not mentioned that they are going through the Foundation.

text:
Title: Announcement: UnshETH Liquidity Gauge Whitelisting on Balancer

Summary:
- UnshETH, an early liquid staking solution, has announced the whitelisting of its liquidity gauge on Balancer, marking a significant step towards deeper collaboration with the Balancer ecosystem.
- The gauge is intended to be a primary source of liquidity for USH on Ethereum and will distribute BAL incentives to addresses depositing tokens in the Balancer Gauge.
- The gauge emissions are capped at 10%, with fees collected being paid back into the gauge via Core Pool Bribes.
- The pool contains no boosted tokens but has a 0.5% fee, intended for participation in the BIP-19 boosted pool program.
- The specific actions of authorizing the DAO multisig, adding the gauge, and removing the authorization using the gauge address are included in the linked payload.
- Harpe, an independent contributor to the unshETH protocol, has facilitated this collaboration.

Value:
- The USH trading metrics as of 04/03/2023 show a high volume (24h) of $2,529,182, significant fees (24h) of $7,588, and utilization (24h) at 106%.

Relevance:
- This collaboration between unshETH and Balancer is expected to create value for all stakeholders and contribute to the growth of unshETH into a market leader in the LSDfi category.
- The announcement is relevant to early adopters of liquid staking, pioneers using LSDfi for leverage, savviest yield-seekers on L1, team members, and early contributors.
- It also pertains to anyone interested in DeFi, liquid staking solutions, and the growth of unshETH and Balancer.
label: neutral

text:
In summary, Timeless is a yield tokenization protocol that allows users to deposit assets (e.g., USDC) and mint PYT and NYT tokens. The deposited assets are used in a farm to generate yield, which can be claimed by PYT holders. Timeless also uses Bunni, a liquidity engine built on top of Uniswap v3, to maximize liquidity and create more complex incentivization schemes for Uniswap v3 liquidity providers.

Bunni was initially released as a public utility that represents Uniswap v3 liquidity positions as fungible ERC-20 tokens instead of NFTs. Since its release, Timeless has continued to improve and develop Bunni, aiming to encourage the longevity of the protocol, provide a large treasury for growth, reduce LIT price volatility, and maintain high liquidity for LIT.

The provided specification outlines two transactions:

1. Transaction A involves transferring 50,000 BAL to a specific contract address and whitelisting the veBAL locking contract to lock veBAL in the system. This transaction is immediate.
2. Transaction B will be executed at a later time after ETH is transferred by Timeless. It involves calling `createLock` on the same contract with an unlock time of 4/12/2024 (max lock) and a placeholder value for `minAmountOut`. This transaction requires ETH to be sent to the contract first, and its parameters may need to be edited based on the results of a tenderly sim.
label: neutral

It also explains the roles of different caller groups, such as the Balancer Emergency DAO Multisig and feeManager multisig, in the system. text:
The Beethoven X contributors are developing a marketing strategy for Balancer, focusing on creating a strong visual identity and compelling personality that highlights the technical capabilities of Balancer while also aligning with current trends and social narratives.

The content creation includes Twitter threads discussing relevant topics in the Balancer ecosystem and a technical article series on Medium. The key objectives include making it easier to build on Balancer, reducing duplicate effort across the ecosystem, and helping drive the direction of the Balancer protocol.

The strategy aims to educate users on product innovation, current trends, and partnership developments through engaging and informative content. The focus is on brand development, capturing core brand values, and creating an inspirational brand aesthetic, as well as building a strong social presence for Balancer as a thought leader in the industry.

The engagement period is 3 months, starting May 1, 2023, and ending July 31, 2023. The budget request is $25,000 USDC per month for technical development and advisory, and an additional $15,000 USDC per month for marketing, content creation, and design efforts. The funds will be used to cover a portion of contributor salaries and will be sent in a liquid form to the provided ETH address around the first of each month.
