text:
Here is a summary of the provided information:

1. The multisig addresses manage $THX token allocations and Treasury liquidity.

2. No external oracles are used in this system.

4. Campaign Contracts, which are currently controlled by an OpenZeppelin Relay account, will be migrated to a Safe based architecture using a Web3Auth MPC key for a more decentralized approach.

5. The $THX token launched at $0.12 and currently sits at $0.04. Since December 2021, the pool has generated $2.9M in volume. It has about $500k in TVL.

6. The 80/20 THX/USDC pool is the primary source of $THX liquidity and was previously ranked #10 by TVL and fees collected on Polygon. However, with the routing of all liquidity incentives, protocol fees, and governance power through this pool, it is expected to grow significantly.

text:
The text provided outlines a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol called KUMA, which operates on the Polygon network. Here are the key points:

1. KUMA Protocol allows swapping regulated NFTs (KUMA NFTs) backed by bonds for composable interest-bearing tokens (KIBT). This is based on the metadata of the NFT.
2. The protocol has been live since April 2021 and is soft pegged to EUR. Another token, wFRK, has been live since November 2023 and accrues value according to the yield of French T-bills. jEUR has been live since August 2021 and maintains its peg.
3. The wFRK/PAR/jEUR pool will serve as the main route for arbitrages and on-chain liquidity.
4. Contracts related to the protocol include a Balancer Pool, wFRK, PAR token, jEUR token, and Gauge contracts on Polygon.
5. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig interacts with the GaugeAddrV4 contract and adds a gauge for the specified addresses and type (Polygon).
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to enable the 80VCX/20WETH gauge on Balancer to participate in veBAL incentives. VaultCraft is an on-chain, permissionless protocol that allows users to spin up automated asset strategies for optimized returns. It utilizes veTokenomics and oVCX (option-reward token) emissions to boost APYs on Smart Vaults. The proposal aims to integrate Balancer throughout the protocol's building blocks by using a Balancer 80/20 pool as the primary liquidity source, integrating Balancer and Aura as yield sources in the Vault Creation Interface (VCI), and listing Balancer LP token vaults with oVCX incentive gauges. The proposal has been audited by various firms and has a TVL of ~$180k as of the 5th of December, 2023. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add the 80VCX/20WETH gauge on Balancer to participate in veBAL incentives.

text:
Here is a summary of the proposed budget for the Balancer Grants Program for Q1:

- Total request for Q1: $35,300 USD + 0.5 ETH
- Funds to Transfer: $35,300 USD + 0.5 ETH
- The Grants Committee multi-sig will continue to operate with the remaining funds in the Grants treasury
- Impact on the Treasury: ~1.77% of the treasurys BAL holdings and ~4.18% of the treasurys USDC holdings annually
- All transactions will be recorded in a Sheet maintained by the committee and on chain
- ETH Address to Receive Funds: Grants Treasury - 0xE2c91f3409Ad6d8cE3a2E2eb330790398CB23597
- Current Treasury Balance: ~126,419 BAL + 17,000 USDC
- Committed: ~60,959 BAL + 7,000 USDC (@$3.75 USD/BAL)
- Uncommitted treasury: ~64,671 BAL + 10,000 USDC

The budget includes the following expenses:

- Q1 Grants: $244k USD to be rewarded to grantees based on milestones following the full Grants review process. This will be split with 50k BAL to regular grants and 15k BAL to Moonshot projects.
- Grants Lead + 4 Committee Members: $43,800 USD for the leadership and coordination of the Balancer Grant processes. The lead is responsible for coordinating with Committee Members, scheduling and hosting meetings, maintaining Medium and Notion pages and leading the post grants report.
- Other Program Expenses: $1,500 USD for any other program expenses that may be required for the smooth execution of the grants program.
- Gas Fees: 0.5 ETH for grantee payments

The budget also includes different tiers for contributors with varying responsibilities and compensation:

- Tier 1 Contributor - $600 USD paid in BAL - contribute to weekly grants meeting, grantee support and on-going assessments
- Tier 2 Contributor - $1,200 USD paid in BAL - As per Tier 1 plus follow up calls for grant applications, mentor at least 1 grantee, RFP development/future grants program planning.
- Tier 3 Contributor - $1,800 USD paid in BAL as per Tier 1 plus mentor 2-4 low assistance grantees or 1-2 high assistance grantees or medium involvement further developing grants program.
- Tier 4 Contributor - $3,000 USD paid in BAL - as per Tier 1 Contributor plus mentor 5+ low assistance grantees or 3+ high assistance grantees or high involvement further developing grants program.

text:
1. The Balancer project is working on a new version (V3) with a focus on supporting all current and future pool types, led by @gareth and OpCo and Beethoven X contributors.

2. The API team, led by @mendesfabio, will play an important role in the Balancer tech stack for data transformation and loading, as the subgraph is being refocused on data extraction.

3. The API has been updated to support multi-chain user experience requirements, with changes made for specific filters, rate provider data, FX pools support, and yield fee specifics. It's also used in the new b-sdk for enriching pool data.

4. Optimizations have been made to the infrastructure deployment, reducing costs and further improvements are planned. The veBal voting-gauges.json file has been deprecated in favor of the API, automating a manual operations task.

5. The team has provided support for the community on Discord, helped Balancer Maxis with data needs, and showcased the rich data set available through the API.

6. Key objectives include making it easier to build on Balancer, reducing duplicate effort across the ecosystem, and helping drive the direction of the Balancer protocol.

7. The engagement is for 6 months starting January 1, 2024, with a budget of $29,000 USDC per month for technical development and advisory. The increase in budget reflects increased involvement from groninge on the development of the new v3 frontend.

8. ETH Address to Receive Funds: 0x811912c19eEF91b9Dc3cA52fc426590cFB84FC86.

1. The marketing team has learned the importance of adaptability and responsiveness in communication strategy during challenging times.

5. The requested funds will be used solely to cover contributor salaries and will be made available in a liquid form.
6. A potential supplementary budget of up to $5000 USDC per month for external marketing services is proposed for strategic use during the significant V3 launch in Q2 2024.
7. The Beethoven X DAO has been actively contributing to enhancing Balancer's position in the DeFi space over the past nine months and remains committed to transparency, trust, and communication within the community.
8. The team is honored and grateful for the opportunity to play a role in Balancer's success and views their accomplishments as milestones in an ongoing journey of improvement and heightened contribution.

The code being implemented can be found at https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/STIP_automation. The changes will affect the distribution of ARB rewards in the STIP program.

text:
Here is a summary of the information provided about Equilibria:

1. **Governance:** Equilibria uses votes to determine Pendle emission, which investors can use vlEQB to vote at Equilibria snapshot either on Arbitrum or Ethereum. The official snapshot page is https://snapshot.org/#/equilibriafi.eth

2. **Oracles:** No external oracles are used by the protocol.

3. **Audits:** Equilibria has undergone rigorous auditing by Peckshield and WatchPug, with detailed reports available at https://docs.equilibria.fi/security-and-risk/audits

4. **Centralization vectors:** Equilibria employs a 3/5 multi-signature control mechanism and utilizes timelock contracts to provide enhanced security.

5. **Market History:** Equilibria launched in June of 2023. The ePendle Pool and incentives allow for adjustments to be made to optimize supply and demand for ePendle, maintaining its peg to PENDLE.

6. **Value:** The pool is anticipated to generate significant trading volumes and fees for Balancer, aiming to become a primary liquidity hub for both tokens, thereby bolstering market stability and depth on Balancer.

7. **Specifications:** The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig interacts with the GaugeAdderv4 and calls the addGauge function with the following arguments: gauge(address): `0xc40F4ABc616Ab3136A002A667A7830F3F7dEC5FA`, gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

text:
1. **Governance Structure**: Both Inverse Finance and Prisma are governed by Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) controlled by token holders through governance. For Inverse Finance, this is done with INV tokens, while for Prisma, the specific token used for governance isn't explicitly mentioned in the provided information.

   - **Inverse Finance**: The DAO is responsible for governing the Fed contracts that control DOLA supply and demand. A detailed description of the governance can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/blog/posts/en-US/all-about-governance-at-inverse-finance). The transparency portal provides a visual representation of Inverse Finance Governance [here](https://www.inverse.finance/transparency/overview).

   - **Prisma**: While Prisma is fully on-chain, it retains minimal admin functions operated via governance. These functions include modifying fees, adding or removing collateral, pausing or unpausing protocol functionality, transferring protocol fees, and adjusting the quorum on admin votes.

2. **Oracles**: Both Inverse Finance and Prisma use Chainlink price feeds for their respective markets. Inverse Finance also utilizes Curve EMA price feeds in some implementations of its FiRM money market. Prisma additionally uses a custom Frax oracle, similar to the one used by crvUSD.

3. **Audits**: Both protocols have undergone multiple audits and bug contests. The audit reports for Inverse Finance can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits). Prisma has completed three audits from Nomoi, MixBytes, and Zellic, which can be viewed [here](https://github.com/prisma-fi/audits). More information regarding security at Inverse Finance can be found on the [risk docs here](https://docs.inverse.finance/inverse-finance/technical/audits).

4. **Centralization Vectors**: The governance process in both protocols relies on token holders, reducing potential centralization vectors compared to projects managed by a single developer or bot-managed updates. However, the liquidation process could be considered a centralization vector as it's not explicitly clear if this is governed by the DAO or carried out automatically by the protocol. It would be beneficial to confirm whether these processes are indeed under governance control.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to compensate the GGP team for an error in reward distribution due to a misconfigured transaction. The Balancer DAO is requested to provide 6,545 BAL (Balancer's native token) equivalent to 3,000 GGP (GooPool's native token) as direct incentives over the next three weeks to the ggAVAX/WAVAX gauge. The text also mentions improvements in internal communication, transaction loading, and review processes to prevent similar incidents in the future. The overall sentiment is one of accountability, rectification, and continuous improvement.

text: The text discusses a proposal by Renzo Protocol to add a veBAL gauge for the ezETH/WETH 50/50 pool on Balancer.fi. Renzo is a liquid restaking token and strategy manager for EigenLayer, aiming to provide higher yields than ETH staking. It has seen rapid growth with over 4,500 depositors and nearing $90M TVL. The proposal aims to enhance liquidity for ezETH and improve the trading experience across the Ethereum ecosystem. Renzo is planning to decentralize strategy management and transition to decentralized governance in the future. It has undergone audits by Halborn and recently closed a successful seed round, raising $3.2 million. The text also mentions that the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add the gauge for the pool.
label: neutral

text:
This text appears to be a summary of transactions involving interactions between a Balancer Maxi LM Multisig wallet (eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`) and GaugeAddrV4 contracts at various Ethereum addresses.

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig wallet is interacting with the GaugeAddrV4 contracts to add new gauges, which are smart contracts that track the performance of liquidity pools in decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms like Balancer. The added gauges are for the following pools:
- B-GHO-USDC (0xa2F8bd6B95a0cB9094206075504CD0ED1Cc717Be) - GHO/USDC Pool
- B-GHO-USDC (0x80AeF246F9926B52622f4e74cdc7Acb5C4344FfE) - GHO/GYD Pool
- B-GHO-GYD (0x4a7475D32CCD29edD65b2a1712b091aA741ba9BB) - GHO/GYD Pool

The added gauges are for the Ethereum network, as indicated by the `gaugeType(string): "Ethereum"` in each transaction. This means that these gauges will be used to track the performance of liquidity pools on the Ethereum blockchain.

It is important to note that this proposal was created by Tokenlogic and karpatkey, who are both Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem. This disclosure indicates that these entities have a role in the creation and management of the proposed changes.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal by Kelp to add veBAL gauges for rsETH/ETHx on Ethereum Mainnet and WETH/rsETH on Polygon zkEVM on Balancer. The proposal aims to enrich the liquidity of rsETH and improve user trading experience. The governance for Kelp is currently multi-sig but planning to transition to decentralized governance soon. The balancer pools are live and the gauges are available on Ethereum Mainnet and Polygon zkEVM.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to enable a vETH/wstETH gauge on Balancer. This will incentivize liquidity providers and potentially become the primary source of liquidity for vETH. The proposal involves streaming rewards to Aura, adopting a two-pronged incentivization strategy, and bribing Hidden Hand for additional votes. Rewards will be paid in wETH or VEC/psVEC tokens, which are part of the Vector Reserve protocol. This protocol introduces Liquidity Position Derivatives (LPDs) as a new asset class to capture yield from various liquidity sources. The proposal aims to boost initial liquidity and support vETH's utility and viability in DeFi protocols.
label: neutral

text:
This text discusses a proposal to enable an svETH/wstETH gauge on Balancer at a specific address. The proposal includes a two-pronged incentivization strategy, where rewards will be streamed to Aura and bribes paid in wETH to Hidden Hand for additional votes. Rewards for Aura will be in the form of VEC or psVEC, a yield-boosted version of staked VEC. The text also provides links to the Vector Reserve's website, docs, dApp, Twitter, GitHub, and protocol description.

The proposal aims to incentivize liquidity providers, support svETH on DeFi protocols, and potentially make Balancer the primary source of liquidity for svETH if it proves popular. The technical details involve a transaction between the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig and the GaugeAdderv4 contract on Balancer.
label: neutral

text:
The Gyroscope Protocol is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol governed by a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) and relevant stakeholders on Ethereum. It also has versions on other blockchains. The E-CLP, specifically, is controlled by the Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

Key features include:
1. Oracle providers for FRAX and sFRAX rates.
2. Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification.
3. No centralization vectors, with the FTL Labs teams multi-sig able to pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee.
4. The Gyroscope Protocol has been live on Ethereum since EOY23 and on several other chains.
5. The value proposition is as described in Motivation.
6. Contracts include an sFRAX/FRAX E-CLP, a childchain gauge, and an Arbitrum root gauge.

In terms of technical specifications, the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add a gauge (Arbitrum root gauge) using the `addGauge` function.
label: neutral

text:
Summary:

The proposal is for the engagement of Hypernative, a leading cybersecurity firm in the Web3 space, for a year-long service starting upon Version 3 (V3) readiness and BLabs notification. The total cost for all sections combined is $60,000 USDC.

Hypernative specializes in detecting and responding to zero-day cyber attacks, financial risks, on-chain anomalies, and safeguarding digital assets, protocols, and Web3 applications from significant threats and losses. They have previously worked with notable organizations such as Polygon, Starknet, Zetachain, Linea, Circle, Galaxy, OlympusDAO, Karpatkey DAO, Chainalysis, and many others.

The engagement is divided into four sections:
1. Immediately after approval for a year (Sections 1 and 2)
2. After an agreed notice from the BLabs team close to V3 alpha (Sections 3 and 4)

The ETH address to receive funds is 0x5CA24e2A586834A7B96216D68b26A82405e3DC15. The Balancer DAO multisig will interact with USDC at 0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48 to transfer $60,000 USDC to Hypernative's ETH mainnet wallet address upon approval.

The SLA (Service Level Agreement) will be shared after the proposal is approved.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to create a DeFi pool featuring weETH, ezETH, and rswETH with a 10% emission cap. The pool has rapidly gained popularity, reaching nearly 20 million within three days of launching. The pool aims to leverage points to drive TVL and utilize Balancer's self-bribe mechanism for higher TVL. The governance will be carried out on the Swell DAO Forum, with audits available and centralization vectors currently managed by a foundation-run bot. The pool has already reached significant TVL due to commitments from all three protocols.
label: neutral
neutral

text:
1. The protocol uses external oracles for price feeds: Chainlink and Curve EMA price feeds are used in Inverse Finance's new fixed-rate money market, FiRM.

2. Audits: Inverse Finance has undergone multiple audits and bug contests, which can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits). sDOLA was audited by yAudit, which can be viewed [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits/sDOLA-yAudit.pdf).

3. Centralization Vectors: The protocol has multisig wallets for various working groups, including the Treasury Working Group, Risk Working Group, Policy Committee, and Fed Chair. These multisigs have limited roles and allowances that can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance.

4. Market History: DOLA is a soft-pegged stablecoin that can experience volatility around $1. Larger deviations often recover fast due to the repegging mechanism built into the protocol. The Balancer pool for sDOLA has been active, with TVL and historical volume information available on the Inverse Finance transparency portal [here](https://www.inverse.finance/transparency/balancer).

5. Specification: A transaction will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments: gauge(address): `0xCD19892916929F013930ed628547Cc1F439b230e`, gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to enable a gauge for instETH/wstETH on Ethereum, which is a Restaked Token dedicated to stETH. InceptionLRT, an isolated Liquid Restaking protocol for Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs), is proposed to facilitate this. The iLRTs issued by InceptionLRT can be traded and used in other DeFi protocols while maintaining segregation from the underlying LSTs. This move aims to increase the liquidity of instETH, support its utility, and enhance the fluidity and accessibility of restaking in the DeFi landscape. The proposal also highlights governance, oracles, audits, decentralization factors, market history, value, and specific transaction details. Overall, it appears to be a well-thought-out plan for improving liquidity and DeFi protocols using InceptionLRT's isolated Liquid Restaking mechanism.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to enable an uncapped Balancer gauge for pxETH/frxETH on Arbitrum, utilizing an Elliptic Concentrated Liquidity Pool (E-CLP). This pool type is more capital efficient and could generate significant trading volume. The fee split is 50% to liquidity providers and 50% to Balancer, with no fees going towards Gyroscope at inception. The proposal aims to improve pxETH liquidity and support the pxETH:ETH peg for greater DeFi composability. The governance token for pxETH is BTRFLY, and Redacted wants to have Balancer as a primary venue for crucial pxETH liquidity due to their close relationship. The pool will be governed by Gyroscope upon launch.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to create a KEP/rsETH pool on the Balancer platform, with the pool being a 50/50 Weighted Pool capped at 2%. This pool will be classified as a "core pool" under BIP-19 due to its 1% swap fee and rsETH being a Liquid Restaking Token (LRT) that generates yield. The proposal aims to establish this pool as the primary pool for KEP, creating a secondary market for Kelp's EigenLayer Points. Liquidity Providers can expect to receive KEP along with BAL and AURA rewards. The pool is expected to have high trading volume. The smart contracts of rsETH have been audited by Sigma Prime and Code4rena. The pool will generate revenue for the DAO via rsETH derived yield and from the 1% swap fee.

The ether.fi protocol is a decentralized, non-custodial liquid staking protocol built on Ethereum that allows users to stake their ETH and participate in DeFi without losing liquidity. The proposal seeks to increase the liquidity of the LRT token on Arbitrum for easier entry/exit of positions, enhancing its usability within the L2 DeFi ecosystem. The proposal is part of ether.fi's strategy to boost liquidity and attractiveness of their LRT token.

text:
1. Oracles: Inverse Finance's new fixed-rate money market, FiRM, uses Chainlink price feeds for all markets on FiRM and some implementations also utilize Curve EMA price feeds.

2. Audits: You can find the audit reports of Inverse Finance linked [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits) and the audit report of sDOLA by yAudit [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits/sDOLA-yAudit.pdf). The DAO also has a dedicated Risk Working Group overseeing risk, more details can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/blog/posts/en-US/Introducing%20the%20Inverse%20Finance%20Risk%20Working%20Group).

3. Centralization Vectors: The DAO has working groups with Multisig wallets that have certain roles and limited DOLA or INV allowances to carry out required work. These include the Treasury Working Group, Risk Working Group, Policy Committee, and Fed Chair. All granted privileges and allowances can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance. More details can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/transparency/multisigs).

4. Market History: The DOLA stablecoin is soft pegged to $1 and can experience some volatility around this peg. Larger deviations often recover fast due to the economic repegging mechanism built into the protocol.

5. Specification: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at a specific address and call the `addGauge` function with the specified gauge and gaugeType arguments.
label: neutral

text:
This text provides an overview of the Gyroscope Protocol, which is built on top of Balancer's Maxi LM Multisig and uses Ethereum as its base. The protocol utilizes two rate providers for FRAX and sFRAX, with one being currently active. The E-CLP (Ethereum Composable Market Maker) is called the "CEMM" in audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification.

   The FTL Labs team's multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee, representing potential centralization vectors. The Gyroscope Protocol has been live on Ethereum since the end of 2023, with E-CLPs on several other chains.

   To interact with the GaugeAdder4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd, the specified transaction will call the addGauge function with the Optimism root gauge's address (0x7E1726D24B1CD3dFcd713f67a83ccEaa6108d069) as an argument. The gaugeType for this transaction is set to "Optimism".
label: neutral

text:
To convert yield accruing tokens (in this case, rETH/WETH E-CLP) to the underlying assets (rETH and WETH), follow these steps:

1. Find the contract addresses provided in the text:
   - rETH/WETH E-CLP: 0x9F826c576b1F821dF31Ca6d58c9443dB25a81D65
   - Childchain gauge on Polygon zkEVM: 0xb11C1A66f90CD16c6ae83d503CF2E138B8D8FD42
   - Polygon zkEVM root gauge on Ethereum: 0xF27B784Aa66D5B27BFfd247e32C000C86511C2B2

2. Interact with the Childchain gauge contract (0xb11C1A66f90CD16c6ae83d503CF2E138B8D8FD42) on Polygon zkEVM to swap your rETH/WETH E-CLP tokens for the underlying assets.

3. The steps to interact with the Childchain gauge contract may vary depending on the wallet or DApp you are using, but generally, you will need to connect your wallet and approve the necessary permissions before executing the swap transaction.

text:
The document summarizes information about a pool on Balancer Finance, specifically the GHO/pyUSD pool. Here are some key points:

1. The pool's assets are not yield-bearing but are expected to drive TVL (Total Value Locked) to Balancer and Aura Finance.
2. The pool is managed by a centralized entity called Paxos, which issues pyUSD 1:1 against funds held in cash or US Government Treasuries. These funds are held bankruptcy-remote under New York Banking laws.
3. Aave Governance is decentralized, but Paxos does not have a governance structure outside of the one dictated by the New York State Department of Financial Services.
4. The E-CLP Pool type has certain controls, such as pausing the pool, changing the swap fee, and setting the protocol fee, which are currently managed by the FTL Labs team's multi-sig.
5. The document provides links to historical data about GHO and pyUSD for market history context.
6. The pool has a range of -80bps to 50bps, and the transaction details for interacting with the gauge are also provided.
7. A disclosure statement is included, noting that the proposal was prepared by Tokenlogic and karpatkey, who are Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem.
label: neutral

text:
1. The Balancer OpCo product team manages several Github repositories, including their own (tokenlists, metadata, marketing-site which is deprecated) and those they contribute to (balancer-sdk, b-sdk, docs, backend).
2. The Product Development team provides weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports on their work. Weekly calls are for internal engineering and ecosystem leadership, monthly updates are public, and quarterly community calls are optional.
3. The Balancer OpCo product team is requesting 6 months of funding starting April 1, 2024, and ending September 30, 2024, with a total budget of $373,290. This budget does not require new funding from the DAO as it has been saved due to reduced spend in years 1 and 2.
4. The budget breakdown includes personnel costs, non-people costs (reduced in Q2), and an allocation of BAL for team compensation on a 4-year vesting basis with a 1-year cliff.
5. If any employees leave before the proposal period ends, unvested BAL would not go to the departing employee and would be available for allocation as incentives for potential replacement staff.
6. Since this entity is internal, there is no link to a Service Provider Agreement. The Product team will be directly accountable to the Balancer OpCo and the Balancer DAO community through the reporting process applicable to all Balancer SPs.
label: neutral

text:
Summary:

Danko, a seasoned member of the Balancer community, has been entrusted with the day-to-day management responsibilities that were previously handled by the Foundation's CEO. This role includes budgeting, financial management, compliance, community engagement, DAO treasury and risk management, outreach, and anti-scam oversight.

Under the Balancer Maxis, Danko will manage community interactions, onboard new contributors, plan ecosystem meetups, handle logistics for these events, provide Discord user support, create a weekly report, and a governance report. In terms of finance, Danko will oversee budgets, payments, financial transactions, due diligence for new service providers, risk inventory, and assessment with GRC.

Danko will also lead efforts against scam activities within the Balancer ecosystem, pen-test security infrastructure, take down scam sites, manage services and subscriptions, and oversee vendors as needed. The changes introduced by Danko and other restructuring proposals are expected to save the DAO $76,716 USD annually. These savings have been achieved due to a reduction in spend from service providers compared to their original budgets. No token transfer is required from the DAO for this proposal as the Balancer Foundation/OpCo holds enough USDC and BAL to cover the requested funding.
label: neutral

text:
This text appears to discuss a proposal within the Balancer DAO, a decentralized autonomous organization that manages the Balancer Protocol. The proposal outlines changes in the structure and budgeting of the Balancer Operations Company (OpCo) for the second quarter of 2024.

The main points are:
1. Shift towards more decentralization by outsourcing accounting and bookkeeping to Lemma, a specialized accounting firm for DAOs. This move is expected to bring more substance to the activities in the current jurisdiction.
2. The Ballers, a group within the Balancer community, will continue their roles in community engagement, outreach, and anti-scam oversight. Their tasks include managing community interactions, Discord user support, creating weekly reports, governance reports, leading efforts against scam activities, pen-testing of security infrastructure, and taking down of scam sites.
3. The proposed budget for Q2'24 includes $46,414 for non-people costs (Protocol Infrastructure), $12,000 + 750 BAL to be locked/vested (Ballers), and $1,500 for accounting and bookkeeping.
4. The changes proposed by the restructuring will introduce $76,716 USD annualized net savings to the DAO (based on current projections).

The text also mentions that the Balancer OpCo holds enough USDC and BAL to cover the requested funding, so no token transfer is required from the DAO for this proposal. The ETH address to receive funds is not necessary as the proposal can be covered by funds currently held at the Balancer OpCo. A service provider agreement is not applicable given this is internal / for the OpCo itself.
label: neutral

text:
Summary:

* The proposed budget for the Balancer Maxis for Q2 2024 is $165,120 USD and 18,625 BAL.
* This represents approximately 0.4% of the treasury's BAL holdings and 2.86% of the treasury's USDC.
* Shakotan will be offboarded from relevant multi-sig safes and replaced by gosuto.eth.
* The Balancer DAO multisig will transfer $165,120 USD to the provided ETH address and 18,625 BAL to the same address.

Impact on Treasury:

* Funding this proposal would cost around 0.4% of the treasurys BAL holdings annually, which is approximately 1.74%.
* It would also cost around 2.86% of the treasury's USDC, which annualizes to 11.43%.

Technical Specification:

* The Balancer DAO multisig will interact with USDC and BAL by writing transfer commands passing the Maxi Safe as recipient.
* Shakotan will be replaced by gosuto in the Balancer Maxi Signer set, granting signership to a number of 3/6 multi-sigs.
* The table provided in the docs can be reviewed for understanding safes, signers, and permissions.
label: neutral

text:
1. The Grants Lead role is responsible for the establishment and operation of the Balancer Grant processes, coordinating with committee members, scheduling and hosting meetings, carrying out KYC/compliance due diligence, maintaining Medium and Notion pages, and leading the post-grant reports.

2. The Grants Committee consists of 4 members, each receiving an average of $1,200 USD per month for Q2. This amounts to a total of $14,400 USD for the committee.

3. Other program expenses, such as design, analytics, media, PR, research, legal, gas fees, or any other specialized functions outside the skillset of the committee, will be covered by 500 BAL.

4. The uncommitted treasury consists of 68,190 BAL and 9,000 USDC.

5. The total request for Q2 is 6,809 BAL and 29,400 USDC.

6. The Grants Committee multisig (currently 3 out of 5) will continue to operate with the remaining funds in the Grants treasury.

7. Funding Balancer Grants for Q2 would cost 1.79% of the treasurys BAL holdings and 0.66% of the treasurys USDC, annualizing to 7.14% and 2.66%, respectively.

8. All transactions will be recorded in a sheet maintained by the committee and on-chain.

10. The current treasury balance is approximately 85,868 BAL + 20,400 USDC.

12. The uncommitted treasury is approximately 68,190 BAL + 9,000 USDC.

13. The DAO Multisig will interact with the BAL contract and call `transfer` passing the Grants Treasury address (0xE2c91f3409Ad6d8cE3a2E2eb330790398CB23597) for `recipient` and `6809000000000000000000` for `amount`.

text:
The provided text appears to be a summary of the Gyroscope Protocol, which is built on top of E-CLP (Ethereum Collateralized Liquidity Pool) and is live on various blockchains including Ethereum. Here's a brief summary:

1. The protocol allows for controlling price drift from accruing yield by using rate providers to convert yield-accruing tokens into the underlying.
2. Rate providers have been reviewed as SAFE, and audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification are available for the E-CLP (CEMM in these reports). The E-CLP has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.
3. Rehype Pools, an extension of E-CLP, supports Aave's statA tokens and outsources much of the complexity of 'Boosted Pools' to order routers.
4. There are no identified centralization vectors, but the FTL Labs team's multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee.
5. The Gyroscope Protocol has been live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. More details are available at this link.
6. The value proposition is as stated in "Motivation".
7. The contracts involved include stataOptUSDT/stataOptUSDCn Rehype pool, Childchain gauge on Optimism, and Optimism root gauge on Ethereum.
8. A transaction will be initiated by the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig to interact with the GaugeAdder4 and add a new gauge (Optimism root gauge) to the system.
label: neutral

This document outlines a technical specification for a collaboration between Balancer DAO and Wonderland, involving recurring USDC transfers and token vesting. Here's a summary:

1. **Monthly USDC Transfer:** The Balancer DAO will send 30k USDC to Wonderland every month. This transfer is executed using the `transfer()` function of the USDC contract.

2. **BAL Vesting:** The Balancer DAO will create a 4-year vesting schedule for 275k BAL tokens to be sent to Wonderland using Yearn's Vesting Escrow. This process involves two transactions:
   - Approving the Yearn Vesting Escrow Factory to spend the BAL tokens.
   - Deploying the Vesting Contract using the Yearn Vesting Escrow Factory. The vesting duration is set to 4 years, starting on February 14th, 2024.

3. **BAL Call Option:** A real-world contract for a BAL call option will be drafted by the foundation. No further details are provided in this document.

The Tenderly Simulation link is provided for reference: https://dashboard.tenderly.co/explorer/fork/e8ea44be-0261-4e2b-8a5f-994c023f81b1/transactions

This data appears to be a list of transactions or function calls related to Balancer, a decentralized exchange (DEX) protocol built on Ethereum. The transactions are identified by their contract address and function name, along with the transaction hash (summar3231b6b9bd27a74f04b192aacd8e93f3660).

The transactions include various actions such as starting and stopping amplification parameter updates, disabling pools, enabling recovery mode, and pausing/unpausing pools. These actions are carried out by different contracts, including the multisigs/feesManager contract and the PoolRecoveryHelper contract.

The risk assessment highlights a potential issue where the long pause windows for Balancer pools could be exploited for external coercion of governance or the DAO Multisig to pause Balancer pools and revoke rights for others to unpause them. This could potentially disrupt the functioning of the DEX in the long term.

For more information, you can refer to the Balancer Deployments repository on GitHub (<https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments>) and the BAL Addresses repository (<https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses>).

text:
Ethena is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that focuses on managing derivatives positions and market liquidity. It uses real-time data feeds from various sources, including CeFi exchanges like Binance, Bybit, Okx, Deribit, Bitmex, and Bitget, Pyth, and Redstone, to make informed decisions and ensure the integrity of its actions.

Ethena has undergone a multi-phased audit program for security, with audits conducted by firms like Zellic, Spearbit's Kurt Barry (former Lead Engineer at MakerDAO), Quantstamp, Cantina, Pashov, Code4rena, Chaos Labs, and an upcoming public bug bounty program with Immunefi. The audit reports can be found on the Ethena Labs Gitbook.

The protocol also has a sUSDe/USDC liquidity pool on Balancer, which serves as a primary source for users who wish to swap sUSDe directly for USDC without the 7-day unstaking period. The mainnet addresses for sUSDe, USDC, and the sUSDe/USDC pool on Balancer are provided.

The Gauge contract on the Ethereum network will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add a gauge for the sUSDe/USDC pool. The gauge type will be Ethereum and the gauge address will be 0x84f7F5cD2218f31B750E7009Bb6fD34e0b945DaC.

text:
The text provides an overview of Jellyverse, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform built on the Ethereum blockchain. The main components of Jellyverse are:

1. **Jellyswap**: A decentralized exchange (DEX) that will offer users the opportunity to diversify their portfolios by trading various assets, including stable pools and weighted pools. Future plans include adding other pool types and Balancer V3 functionalities.

2. **jAssets**: An innovative protocol for minting synthetic assets backed by crypto assets as collateral. jAssets aims to integrate real-world assets (RWAs) into the Jellyverse ecosystem, enabling unprecedented opportunities for portfolio diversification.

3. **JellyStake**: A mechanism that allows users to earn from trading fees across all protocols and bolster JLY's value. JellyStake also establishes a connection between JLY staked amount, duration, and governance voting power within the Jellyverse ecosystem.

The team behind Jellyverse has experience in Web 3.0 space, including development work on Polygon Edge for Polygon, top placements in Solana and Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)-compatible platform hackathons, and expertise in Go-To-Market (GTM) strategies through the DeFiChain Accelerator program.

The airdrop for veBAL and auraBAL holders will be distributed via a Staking-NFT that encapsulates JLY and vests over a 12-month period, including a 6-month cliff. The airdrop funds will not be eligible for rewards. More details about the airdrop will be provided in the coming weeks.

For more information, you can visit the official website, Twitter, documentation, and Medium pages linked in the text.

text:
This document outlines a proposal for utilizing the Balancer LM treasury's BAL tokens to generate USDC cash revenues through covered call lending. The key parameters for this proposed strategy are:

1. Notional amount: 25,000 BAL tokens (~$94,000 USD at current spot price of ~$3.76)
2. Upside cap (strike): 110% or 120%
3. Tenor: 30 or 60 days, with the tenor for each transaction depending on the upfront premium to achieve the highest annualized yield
4. Minimum premiums:
   - 2.5% premium on 120% strike (~30.4% APY) and below 4.0% premium on 110% strike (~48.7% APY) for a 30-day tenor strategy
   - 4.0% premium on 120% strike (~24.3% APY) and below 5.5% premium on 110% strike (~33.5% APY) for a 60-day tenor strategy

Once the proposal is approved, the Balancer LM multisig seeds their bespoke vault with the 25,000 BAL tokens, and no active management will be required apart from settling on a quote and creating new offers after each strategy expiry. This approach allows Balancer to diversify its treasury while avoiding market impacts that could arise from outright selling BAL.

The flexibility in structuring loan terms enables Balancer to tailor the initiative according to its unique risk-reward preferences, ensuring alignment with its broader financial and operational objectives. The proposal is open for comments and feedback, and the team looks forward to pushing it towards voting.
label: neutral

1. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig (0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860) will interact with the GaugeAdder v4 (0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd) and call the `addGauge` function. The gauge being added is at 0x597AEbfe41dCc042db206Eb888c42560a22c9303, with a type of Ethereum.

The Balancer DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will interact with the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6) and call `grantRole` with the role 0xae60dce27f51ce5815357b9f6b40f200557867f8222262a1646c005d09b7dfba. text: The text discusses a proposal to enable a gauge for inankrETH/ankrETH on the Ethereum network, proposed by InceptionLRT. InceptionLRT is an isolated Liquid Restaking protocol designed to enhance liquidity and fluidity in DeFi landscape, particularly addressing liquidity locking issues in EigenLayer framework. The proposal aims to increase liquidity of inankrETH and support its integration into various DeFi protocols. Governance is handled by ING holders, who can influence the protocol's direction and policies. Incentives are directed through gauge weight voting, and providing ING to liquidity pools earns veING, granting access to various protocol benefits. The proposal undergoes security audits for user fund safety. Overall sentiment: This is a proposal for enhancing DeFi liquidity and utility of a specific token, with governance by token holders and audited for safety.
label: neutral

text:
The document discusses the Ethereum Optimized Stablecoin (OETH), a capital-efficient liquidity provisioning mechanism called E-CLP, and its application in the stMATIC/wMATIC pool on Polygon. The E-CLP is designed to concentrate liquidity within price bounds, increasing capital efficiency by truncating liquidity profiles from a given trading curve based on the expected trading range of assets.

Key points include:

1. OETH governance is managed by veOGV holders with a 48-hour timelock for contract upgrades.
2. Chainlink oracles are used for pricing data for rETH and stETH.
3. The wOETH/WETH pool on Arbitrum is intended to be a core OETH liquidity pool, with incentives allocated to bribe this pool.
4. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add the Arbitrum root gauge to the OETH pool on Balancer 1.
5. The document also provides details about various audits conducted and centralization vectors of the Strategists tasked with rebalancing collateral between strategies or pausing deposits, subject to a 48-hour timelock.

The E-CLP concept can be applied wherever the expected trading range of assets can be informed by external business logic, such as in LSTs (Liquidity Stablecoins). The document also mentions that E-CLPs have been developed for stablecoin pools including Gyroscope's GYD.
label: neutral

The current DAO Multisig on Fantom will not be utilized after these actions unless absolutely necessary. The new signers' addresses can be confirmed via a provided link.

text:
Title: Balancer DAO Event Participation Proposal - Key DeFi Conferences and Social Events

   Summary: This proposal outlines our plan to participate in key DeFi conferences, including ETHCC, Token2049, and Devcon, as well as host additional social events to foster connections within the community. The budget for each event is estimated at approximately 45,750 EUR, with potential adjustments based on our experiences at EthCC. We are requesting funding from the Balancer DAO to cover these costs, ensuring efficient use of funds and continued support for the Balancer community. After each event, we will provide a detailed report on activities, outcomes, financials, and areas for improvement for future events.

   Key Points:

   1. Attend key DeFi conferences (ETHCC, Token2049, Devcon) and host additional social events to engage with the community.
   2. Finalize event plans, secure speakers, and coordinate logistics from May to November.
   3. Estimated total budget for ETHCC is 45,750 EUR; subsequent events would follow a similar budget structure.
   4. Request funding from Balancer DAO to cover costs associated with attending these events.
   5. Provide detailed reports after each event, including summary of activities, key outcomes and metrics, photos/videos, and financial report.
   6. Identify areas for improvement based on feedback and experiences from each event, adjust strategy, and share best practices with the community.

   By securing this funding, we aim to maximize our impact at these events, promoting Balancer v3, fostering new partnerships, and enhancing our engagement with the DeFi community.
label: neutral

text:
This text describes the Zaros project, a decentralized exchange (DEX) focused on perpetuals trading built on the Balancer ecosystem. The project has a governance structure called the Zaros DAO, which includes a council for decision-making and two types of proposals: ZIPs (Zaros Improvement Proposals) and ZCCPs (Zaros Configuration Change Proposals).

The core of the system relies on Chainlink Data Feeds and Data Streams for pricing data. The project will be audited by Cyfrin and Codehawks, and is currently maintained by a team of 18 members.

The primary liquidity source for ZRS will be a ZRS/ETH pool on Ethereum, with an 80/20 pool deployed on Arbitrum for LPs to lock their BPT for veZRS. The project will go live through a Fjord Foundry LBP on May 29th, 2024.

The proposal outlined in the text is to add the Gauge (0xbF39254fD93C81ac9F0ffd2E721c86C052793353) to the Balancer pool, allowing community members to trade ZRS and earn rewards. The transaction will be executed by the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig (eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860) interacting with the `GaugeAdderv4` at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd.

text:
The Balancer DAO has adopted a conservative budget approach for Q3, with a total budget of 172,500 USDC and 14,464 BAL. This budget is intended to support the operations of the Maxis team, fund freelancers, and cover infrastructure costs.

The breakdown of costs per month is as follows:
- People Cost (USDC): 46,500 USDC
- People Cost (BAL, locked for 1 year): 4,821 BAL
- Discretionary Budget: 20,000 USDC

Compared to Q2, the Maxis have decreased their ask for locked BAL, resulting in a decrease of 24,000 USD in the budget. Additionally, savings of 27,000 USD from the discretionary budget in Q2 will roll over to Q3, totaling savings of 51,000 USD compared to Q2.

The funding for this budget would represent approximately 0.37% of the treasurys BAL holdings and around 3.18% of the treasurys stable reserve in USDC. The ETH address to receive the funds is 0x166f54F44F271407f24AA1BE415a730035637325.

The Balancer DAO multisig will interact with USDC and BAL wallets to transfer the required funds to the Maxi Safe. The technical details for these interactions are provided in the Technical Specification section.

text:
1. The v3 subgraph of Balancer is being restructured into a modular system to facilitate easier development and deployment of new pool types, reducing the need for lengthy subgraph redeployments.

2. A CLI tool has been developed by the data team to assist external developers in integrating their newly created pool types with the Balancer Pools Subgraph.

3. The data team is also focusing on improving the Dune dashboard and creating reusable spells, as evidenced by the Balancer dune org passing 1,000 stars. They are also collaborating with external data providers to ensure consistency of Balancer data across the ecosystem.

4. The API has been enhanced and streamlined to serve the needs of the upcoming Zen UI and Balancer V3. This includes integrating a new Smart Order Router, optimizing the allow listing process, adding support for COWAMM, and integrating Mode and Fraxtal.

5. The key objectives for Beethoven X DAO include making it easier to build on Balancer, reducing duplicate effort across the ecosystem, and helping drive the direction of the Balancer protocol.

6. Beethoven X DAO is requesting 6 months of funding starting July 1, 2024, and ending December 31, 2024, with an extended budget of $29,000 USDC per month for technical development and advisory. The ETH address to receive funds is 0x811912c19eEF91b9Dc3cA52fc426590cFB84FC86.

text:
The summary outlines the future goals and strategies of Balancer v3, a decentralized exchange (DEX) platform. Key objectives include:

1. Establishing Balancer University as a comprehensive educational resource for users to learn about Balancer technology.
2. Creating high-quality visuals and infographics to explain complex concepts and features of Balancer v3.
3. Building and strengthening strategic partnerships with projects like Gyroscope, CowSwap, QuantAMM, and Aura through joint marketing campaigns, co-branded events, and collaborative product development.
4. Publishing a series of in-depth articles exploring the technical and economic aspects of Balancer v3, highlighting real-world use cases, success stories, and innovative applications built on Balancer.
5. Fostering a vibrant community through interactive initiatives and continuous engagement.
6. Participating in industry conferences and events to showcase Balancers innovations, expand reach, establish thought leadership, and network with the community.

The budget request is for $30K USDC per month from July 1, 2024, to December 31, 2024. The funds will exclusively cover contributor salaries for marketing-related services. The team includes two full-time contributors, Jedi and Naly, who manage marketing strategy, content curation, and social media. Part-time contributions are provided by Vee (brand development and design) and Josey (social science studies and related content). The ETH address to receive funds is 0x811912c19eEF91b9Dc3cA52fc426590cFB84FC86.
label: neutral

GRC Services: This service includes managing regulatory risks, responding to third-party inquiries, handling issues, governance, legal agreement review, and keeping the Ecosystem Council updated on regulatory changes and sentiment. Network and Protocol Infrastructure services: This is the heavy part of the budget, essential to the core functionality of the protocol and surrounding infrastructure, i.e., API and RFC providers, DNS server, etc. The high increase is expected due to the launch of v3 and usage, but teams will actively monitor and search for cost-effective alternatives whenever possible/available.

1. The DAO Multisig Fraxtal (0x4f22C2784Cbd2B24a172566491Ee73fee1A63c2e) is granted the ability to call setDelegation on the l2-ve-delegation-proxy (0xE3881627B8DeeBCCF9c23B291430a549Fc0bE5F7) by the Authorizer (0xE39B5e3B6D74016b2F6A9673D7d7493B6DF549d5).

2. The DAO Multisig Fraxtal will set its delegation to the Boost Delegation v2 (0x1702067424096F07A60e62cceE3dE9420068492D) which corresponds to the l2-veboost-v2 contract.

3. The DAO Multisig Fraxtal is then revoked from calling certain functions by the Authorizer (0xE39B5e3B6D74016b2F6A9673D7d7493B6DF549d5) by calling revokeRoles with roles (0x9982b96c2fe5e96298fb726a0961f96e3b1b747460c05c75c71244df64b5248e) and account (0x4f22C2784Cbd2B24a172566491Ee73fee1A63c2e).

4. The LM Multisig (0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860) will write the OmniVotingEscrow contract (0xE241C6e48CA045C7f631600a0f1403b2bFea05ad) and set its Trusted Remote Address to remoteChainId: 255 and remoteAddress: 0xE241C6e48CA045C7f631600a0f1403b2bFea05ad.

This sequence of actions is part of the LZ Chain's Trusted Remote Address setup for Fraxtal on LayerZero network.
label: neutral

The execution needs to be timed between June 27th and July 4th, 2024.

Overall, the text suggests a positive sentiment towards the proposed enhancement of Gnosis Chain's DeFi ecosystem through the addition of a compliant USDC token.

text: The text discusses a proposal by Ducata to join Balancer's Partnership Program, requesting an exception to the open-source license for their innovative DUCA Reflexivity Protocol. This protocol aims to provide stability and liquidity through protocol-owned liquidity, leveraging parts of Balancers V2 code. The partnership is expected to benefit both parties by showcasing Balancer's capabilities, supporting financial innovation, and monetary compensation for Ducata, while reducing development time and leveraging Balancers technology for Ducata. Ducata commits to a transition towards full decentralization and proposes a licensing fee to support Balancers development. The goal is to create the first viable form of Programmatic Money with the DUCA Reflexivity Protocol, ensuring stability through innovation and liquidity under all market conditions. Support from Balancer is crucial for maintaining the integrity and operational autonomy of the DUCA Protocol, and in return, Ducata offers benefits such as protocol-owned liquidity, support for innovation, and ecosystem growth. The partnership aligns with Ducata's commitment to DeFi ethos and Balancer, with a gradual transition towards openness and decentralization.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal for the development of a financial reporting system for Balancer DAO's assets. The aim is to provide insights into the DAO's financial status, aid strategic decision-making, and facilitate integration with GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles). The proposed system will offer analytics and reports on the treasury, balance sheet, fund flow analysis, expenses, income, and cash flow forecasting. The development cost is budgeted at a one-time grant of USD 20,000 and quarterly fees of USD 6,000, both payable in BAL. The community is encouraged to review and provide feedback on this proposal.
label: neutral

text:
The goal is to increase the Total Value Locked (TVL) in each pool to $1M through onboarding new alliance members and engaging community members of all projects and Aurus partners. The total target is to reach $3M TVL over the next 6-12 months.

Governance will be handled via Snapshot for now, with Xaves own VE governance structure (forked from veBAL) being deployed later. The team's ops 2/3 multisig is currently in control of the TXAU_USDC & TXAG_USDC Polygon FXPools until the community is ready to take ownership of the Xave protocol.

The TXAU_TXAG_WETH pool on Polygon does not use oracles, as it is deployed directly on Balancer v2. The other two pools utilize a Chainlink oracle for FX-accurate swaps within a predetermined range of the bonding curve, with LP ratio determining the price of trades outside this range.

The Aurus Foundation, registered in the UK and regulated by the FCA, facilitates the tokenization of tGOLD ($TXAU) and tSILVER ($TXAG) commodity tokens on behalf of precious metal providers like Gold Refineries. Each token is backed 1:1 with fully allocated LBMA Gold or Silver.

The pools consist of the tGOLD and tSILVER commodity tokens, intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the Aurus ecosystem and subsequent alliance partners. The transactions will be carried out by the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig, interacting with the GaugeAdderv4 and calling the addGauge function with the specified arguments.
label: neutral

text:

text:
1. Centralization vectors: The most centralized facet of the current system is the Decentralized Oracle Network (DON), which is operated by 8 independent Chainlink node operators and 1 price feed from StorkOracle.

2. Market History: The gUSDC asset is tradeable on a Ramses CL pool as per June 15th, with $2M TVL. Since the inception of this secondary market pool, Gains Network vaults have been consistently overcollateralized while the gUSDC asset has never been below peg and has not experienced significant volatility.

3. Value: The pool will not serve as the primary source of liquidity in the bootstrapping phase but will be leveraged as the primary source of liquidity once the bootstrapping phase has passed. The pool can generate consistent fees due to gUSDC depositors only being able to use Balancer as a means of exiting before our epoch system, looping through lending markets & liquidations through lending markets.

4. Provided links:
   - Pool: https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xe8a6026365254f779b6927f00f8724ea1b8ae5e0000000000000000000000580
   - Child Gauge: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x0CE9489bBD4bfA0Da7b5bb06E4dFa7a5947F76e8
   - Root Gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x5A482e8478d63219bC33C7F1d7Cdb599039ABad7

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
   - gauge(address): `0x5A482e8478d63219bC33C7F1d7Cdb599039ABad7`

The focus is on Spectra, an EVM-centric protocol for interest rate derivatives, which offers easy-to-use services and separates the right to principal from future yield via yield tokenization. The proposal aims to deepen its relationship with Balancer's APW <> ETH pool. Key aspects of Spectra include decentralized governance by APW token holders, reliance on price oracles for data, and no identified centralization vectors. The APW/ETH pool was recently created, and APW has been relatively stable in the market since its launch in May 2021. The proposal involves interaction between the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig and the GaugeAdderv4 to add the new gauge.

text: This proposal aims to manage potential regulatory and legal risks for major participants in the Balancer protocol by delegating administrative tasks to the Ecosystem Council. The council will seek independent legal counsel to confirm use of funds from a self-insurance fund for unbudgeted litigation costs and government fines. The fund, currently held by the DAO Treasury, is intended to support key participants like Balancer Labs, Balancer Foundation, Balancer OpCo, Balancer Grants, BDSP, Beethoven X, Hypernative, and Karpatkey. The Ecosystem Council will consult with legal counsel before disbursing funds, and the funds will be moved directly from the DAO Treasury multisig to recipients without additional governance vote. The Ecosystem Council is currently represented by members from these key participants.
label: neutral
